politics of selling and buying the social experience of city , culture and people ?', 'With a full and sensitive exploration of the ethical debate surrounding the ‘ sale of emotion ’ elicited by the first-hand contemplation of poverty , Touring Poverty is an innovative book that provokes the reader to think about the role played by tourism– and our role as tourists– within a context of growing poverty .', 'It will be of interest to student of sociology , anthropology , ethnography and methodology , urban study , tourism study , mobility study , development study , politics and international relation .', 'Sým-bolon : Symbol-action-context .', 'The Greek root for the word symbol are sým ( thrown ) and bolon ( together ) .', "In the recent idealized and abstract turn of the social science towards 'discourse ' , it has been forgotten how in their production meaning carried by symbol are precisely thrown together with material , social , and interactive circumstance .", "Urban ethnographer are well equipped to see the signifier not as 'free-floating ' but as always engaged - through its intransigent opacity as well as its transparent relevancy - in socially situated context and social action as it finds its signified .", 'Utilizing example from my own ethnographic work , this article presents an urban and class-specific view of how symbol are thrown together with the circumstance of material want , social pressure , and ideological abjection suffered by young people at the bottom of social space in deprived urban area .', "The struggle for survival here produces cultural form and meaning which are no less creative and complex than the recognized formal creation of 'art ' but are formed in quite different way under pressure and compression , rather than in 'choice ' and 'freedom ' .", 'Toward diversity that works : Building community through art and culture .', 'City , neighborhood , college campus , and even business often herald diversity-the tolerance and celebration of difference-as a selling point , making the case that it broadens perspective , enriches life , promotes compassion and even leads to innovation .', 'But just what does it take to have diversity , particularly racial and ethnic diversity , in a context where racial and ethnic group have been divided by racism , discrimination , competition for resource , and fear of change ?', 'How can tolerance and celebration of difference that leads to compassion and innovation thrive in such a context ?', 'Within urban planning and related field , concern for fostering racial and ethnic diversity has resulted typically in attention to eradicating housing segregation and redistributing wealth and economic opportunity ( Cashin 2004 ; De Souza Briggs 2005 ; Rawlings et al .', '2004 ) .', 'While these are area that warrant analysis and action , not enough attention has been paid to understanding or affecting the actual process by which people express or work to change racial ethnic dynamic within and among different group .', 'Much of this is being achieved through art and cultural participation .', 'This chapter uses example of art and cultural activity in community around the United States to discuss how art and cultural activity-through which people affirm , preserve , challenge , and transform racial ethnic identity and dynamics-is a precondition for true diversity , the tolerance and celebration of difference , and how that precondition is being achieved on the ground .', 'Based on these example , the chapter also discusses important implication for urban planner and policymakers concerned with effort to create more equitable and diverse community .', 'My ultimate argument is that , without consideration for and inclusion of art and cultural activity , such effort are inherently flawed .', 'I draw in my discussion from a decade of research on the presence and role of art and cultural activity in many different type of community around the United States , including moderate- and low-income neighborhood , community of color , and immigrant community .', 'This research has included participant observation in cultural event , hundred of interview , and score of focus group discussion with neighborhood resident , community leader , artist , people who run cultural organization and others involved in a range of community institution .', 'The research-which focus always on the kind of cultural activity that people value in their community and the reason why these are valued- is being done by the Art and Culture in Communities Project ( ACIP ) .1 Before launching into a discussion about how cultural participation contributes to diversity in community , a few word are in order about how we interpret art and culture in our work .', 'Mapping the intangible cultural heritage of ethnic community : Designing an interactive cultural history of Koreatown .', "This paper presents the interactive online cultural history 'The Seoul of Los Angeles : Contested Identity and Transnationalism in Immigrant Space ' ( http : //seoulofla.com/ ) .", 'Informed by interaction design and urban study , this project examines and visualizes the sociocultural network shaping immigrant community and how local neighborhood negotiate a sense of place within an increasingly globalized space .', 'Geographer Doreen Massey recognizes space not as a static entity but as the product of interrelation from the immensity of the global to the intimately tiny .', 'These interrelation are part of a story , an interpreted history that change and develops over time .', 'One could recognize cultural heritage in a similar way-as dynamic and part of a narrative trajectory that is not merely frozen in a romanticized or essentialist past .', 'Much of what constitutes the dynamic of ethnic community formation is intangible as it is largely a lived experience rather than one that is necessarily documented or archived .', 'As such , this project serves as a digital archive and platform for community storytelling that enriches our understanding of the city and the often intangible narrative that create a sense of place .', 'Currently , Los Angeles has the largest population of Koreans in the United States living outside of Korea .', "Nicknamed the ' L.A .", "district of Seoul City ' , most visitor understand Koreatown as an extension of Seoul .", 'But , what most people may not know is that the majority of inhabitant who comprise its residential and working class population are not Korean , but Latino .', 'The everyday space of this community is inhabited by a mix of immigrant coming from Mexico , Central and South America , and other part of Asia including Bangladesh .', 'These network of nationalisms converge in the urban space of Koreatown .', 'This contests predominant conception of ethnic enclave being understood as homogenous and makes us re-imagine what we think we understand about them-they are increasingly becoming polycentric in complex way .', 'Combining design , documentary and issue in contemporary medium study including global/local relation , ethnic and urban study , this work uses new medium and mapping to create greater awareness of our built environment and the people who populate it .', 'Mapping is a dynamic system that changes according to the shift in culture and community that characterize any geographic place .', 'How can this system be visualized in order to read a space with newly informed imagination ?', 'What kind of urban interface could be designed to communicate with the space we move through and what overlooked story could be uncovered in order to enrich our understanding of city and the intangible cultural history embedded in them ?', 'Such question are explored in this project .', 'Underground movement : Modern culture on the New York city subway .', 'For more than a century the New York City subway system has been a vital part of the city ’ s identity , even as judgment of its value have varied .', 'It has been celebrated as the technological embodiment of the American melting pot and reviled as a blighted urban netherworld .', 'Underground Movements explores the many meaning of the subway by looking back at the era when it first ascended to cultural prominence , from its opening in 1904 through the mid-1960s .', 'Sunny Stalter-Pace analyzes a broad range of texts written during this period—news article , modernist poetry , ethnic play , migration narrative , as well as canonical work by author such as Hart Crane , William Carlos Williams , and Ralph Ellison—to illustrate the subway ’ s central importance as a site of abstract connection , both between different part of the city and between city dweller who ride the train together .', 'Writer and artist took up question that originated in the sphere of urban planning to explore how underground movement changed the way people understand the city .', 'Modern poet envisioned the subway as a space of literary innovation ; playwright and fiction writer used it to gauge the consequence of migration and immigration ; and essayists found that it underscored the fragile relationship between urban development and memory .', 'Even today , the symbolic association forged by these early texts continue to influence understanding of the cultural significance of the subway and the city it connects .', 'Mod , Working-Class Youth , and London ’ s Transformation into a Modern Post-war Metropolis .', 'London ’ s working-class youth grew up in a city that in the 1960s began to move away from the London their parent had known during their own childhood .', 'This chapter illustrates how the making of a post-Victorian Britain can be viewed as a project that took place and was materialised across a variety of social sub-systems , and it covers topic such as urban planning and the cultural life of city .', 'It reconstructs , firstly , the way in which politician and creatives formed a symbolic relationship between urban working-class youth and modern town planning , and in the process popularised a concept of urban modernism in the 1960s in which ordinary working-class kid had become “ hopeful passenger ” who were shifting London ’ s self-narrative from its role as the former hub of the British Empire into that of a world leader in term of global teen and popular culture .', 'Secondly , therefore , it looks at the impact of internal migration on London ’ s transformation into a global city known for cultural production , as well as the way in which theme of new urban modernism , such as increasing physical mobility among working-class people , interacted with modern youth identity .', 'Thirdly , this chapter introduces the reader to the rise and fall of the “ Swinging London ” narrative and discusses its role as the invention of a former imperial metropolis in a period which was dominated by the decline of the Empire .', 'It describes how the city and its key actor , from local authority to business owner , started to see London ’ s reinvention as a new weapon at a time when competition between global city called for efficient city marketing , and examines the extent to which the new image of the capital interacted with its historical past .', 'Coming to Rest : Aesthetic of Cosmopolitanism and Mobility in Marseille .', 'This article traces the history of cosmopolitanism in Marseille as well some of the major aesthetic development in its Vieux Port over the last century .', 'I consider a series of moment from the Vichy government ’ s destruction of the Vieux Port in an effort to stamp out resistance during WWII , to the transformation of La Criée aux Poissons from a fish market to a theater in the 1970s , to the recent pedestrianization of the shoreline and the construction of the Museum of European and Mediterranean Civilizations .', 'The Vieux Port ’ s aesthetic transformation have reflected prevailing sentiment about the meaning of Marseille ’ s past and its hope for the future .', 'While the recent prevalence of cosmopolitanism in Marseille ’ s year as European Capital of Culture and its urban revitalization effort is striking , the concept has been used as a narrative for the city ’ s revitalization since at least the 1970s .', 'Whereas some have argued that the space of cosmopolitanism are hyper-mobile , abstract non-spaces , I argue that Marseille ’ s cosmopolitanism is historical and linked as much to space of immobility as space of mobility .', 'Far from distancing itself from history and tradition , Marseille has incorporated its ancient past into a cosmopolitan culture-led urban renewal project .', 'Ethnographically examining pedestrian traffic around the port reveals that the space where people come to rest are as essential as the space of constant movement and flow in charting cosmopolitanism in the city .', 'Urban Australia and post-punk : Exploring dog in space .', 'Richard Lowenstein ’ s 1986 masterpiece Dogs in Space was and remains controversial , divisive , compelling and inspirational .', 'Made less than a decade after the event it is based on , using many of the people involved in those event as actor , the film explored Melbourne ’ s ‘ postpunk ’ counterculture of share house , drug and decadence .', 'Amongst its ensemble cast was Michael Hutchence , one of the biggest music star of the period , in his acting debut .', 'This book is a collection of essay exploring the place , period and legacy of Dogs in Space , by people who were there or who have been affected by this remarkable film .', 'The writer are musician , actor and artist and also academic in heritage , history , urban planning , gender study , geography , performance and music .', 'This is an invaluable resource for anyone passionate about Australian film , society , culture , history , heritage , music and art .', 'Not-the-troubles : Disinterring the Marginalised Story of the Ordinary and the Everyday .', 'Urban study of Belfast , Northern Ireland , thoroughly explore the contested or post-conflict city .', 'However , these ‘ grand narrative ’ do not necessarily accord with people ’ s day-to-day experience .', 'Although the ordinary and the everyday are the lifeblood of anthropological inquiry , the mundane in Belfast dwells on the narratorial margin , as academic and political loci predominantly align to the Trouble : to the protagonist , the cause or the peace-building aftermath .', 'Ten by Nine ( Tenx9 ) is a monthly , public storytelling night showcasing ordinary people and their true , personal , everyday story , juxtaposing the funny , poignant and educational , and celebrating the quotidian .', 'Retelling Belfast at Tenx9 challenges hegemonic discourse by moving the mundane from the margin to the centre , opening up a space for small ‘ t ’ trouble to be shared .', 'The communitas at Tenx9 promotes a sense of belonging in the city outwith Troubled narrative and storytelling , an ancient Irish oral culture , becomes a new form of symbolic practice .', 'Visual culture of urban spectacle : a discourse on festival in the light of urban semantics .', 'Every city has its own identity and culture manifested through its people and activity that occur in its urban space .', 'With advancement in technology and globalisation , there has been a mass influx of people in urban environment .', 'This has led to the confluence of idea , philosophy and culture , while stretching and challenging the psychological and physical boundary of city around the globe .', 'City are the physical manifestation of such paradigm shift , thus becoming hub of cultural expression which are notably rich in visual culture .', 'In this regard , the city can be viewed upon as a palimpsest which constantly adapts and redefines its meaning over time as a result of a conglomeration of multiple intermingling discourse .', 'As urban space gain new meaning and function with change in cultural practice , a city can no longer be seen as unidirectional but fluidity and temporality are observed as some of the key aspect .', 'Urban spectacle such as festival provide some interesting insight in this regard .', 'In a time where change is the norm , a foray into the visual culture of urban spectacle can give a multidimensional view on urban semantics by analysing the three main dimension of urban space : functional , aesthetical and symbolic .', 'This paper will foray into the domain of Urban Semantics through the study of festival by bringing together semiology and the urban .', 'It will also analyse the role festival as temporal marker , spatial marker , narrative fortifier and visual identifier .', 'Re-Living the Global City : Global/Local Process .', 'Living the Global City ( 1996 ) was a landmark text in the field of Global Studies , offering an analysis of globalization and global/local process by focussing on specific issue and theme which include community , culture , milieu , socioscapes and sociospheres , microglobalization , poverty , ethnic identity and carnival .', 'In this new collection Eade and Rumford draw together scholar whose work has engaged with the original volume over the last 15 year and the result is a unique and thematically coherent collection of essay which both complement the original book and challenges some of its core assumption .', 'Re-Living the Global City both pay homage to a key text and pushes its agenda into important new area .', 'After reflecting upon how debate in the field have developed since the original publication , the contributor seek to drive the debate forward through discussion of contemporary theme and issue such as border and bordering , social movement , community and global connectivity .', 'They consider the way in which the city produces different experience of globalization for different people and examine the various account of the way in which new form of sociality are definitive of contemporary globalization and cosmopolitanism .', 'Drawing together scholar from a range of discipline including international relation , politics , sociology , urban study and anthropology , this work will be of great interest to all student and scholar of global study and globalization .', 'Preface to Part 1 .', 'The chapter that comprise this Part of the book present penetrating insight into the global contexts within which city building and urban planning occur .', 'City , their culture , planning practice and economy increasingly are enmeshed in an array of global process that include transnational flow and multifaceted circuit of capital , people , idea and service .', 'With increased globalization has come a fascination not only with its contour and contradiction , but also with the situation of different city within and outside influential network .', 'It was in this context , for instance , that the notion of the ‘ global ’ and ‘ world ’ city gained currency .', 'Globalization and associated categorization of city are founded on the existence of a core and a marginalized periphery with city increasingly being defined in term of their location vis-à-vis the global .', 'A consequence of the fixation on global network , status , contexts and process is countervailing interest in the ‘ other ’ of the global – the local .', 'And so it is with the chapter here , each of which in some way seeks to understand local condition and processes not only in the context of , but frequently in opposition to , the global .', 'Introduction : Globalizing downtown .', "`` DOWNTOWN ! ''", "The word itself , like its myriad global cognates including el centro , wasat al- madina , centre ville , and zhongwan , evokes intensity at the core of urban life , space , and capital : `` Bright light , surging crowds , tall building , big money , power politics . ''", 'To speak of global downtowns demand careful analysis of the particularity of place and people as well as examination of shared process connecting and transforming city worldwide as dense , active site of encounter , competition , celebration , and conflict .', 'In this volume , we look at widespread process , knowledge , and mediation underpinning the formation of such central space .', 'We consider the global element of individual case , the civic consciousness and elite strategy that connect downtown around the world , and the point of conflict and transformation that spill out into street and space from Barcelona to Los Angeles , Beirut to Mumbai .', 'We listen to and interpret competitive politician , multinational corporation , cosmopolitan planner , and itinerant tourist while recognizing local citizen , association , artistic vanguard , and excluded voice in the day- to- day reconstitution of space and image .', 'As crucible of international flow , downtown offer unique vantage point on globalization , which we illuminate in this volume through comparative urban ethnography .', "The concept of `` global downtowns '' thus captures the way in which downtowns around the world increasingly share common feature , serve as model for the transformation of old city center and the emergence of new one , and become site for the convergence of diverse global process .", 'What is a downtown ?', 'Our interrogation begins at the urban center , marked in many older city by monumental statement of hierarchy and power , ritual and administration .', 'Over time , ancient palace and temple precinct have expanded and contracted , giving way to the divergent presence and meaning of city hall , opera house , stock exchange , corporate office , skyscraper , museum , department store , sport complex , hotel , apartment , park , and promenade that constitute heterogeneous downtown today .', 'Some downtown are clearly bounded , some diffuse , and some part of polycentric network of activity .', "Deeply enmeshed with other part of a metropolitan region , downtown distill the economic , political , and cultural life of the city as a whole through period of decline and abandonment as well as florescence- identity evoked by competing term of spatial reference such as `` Main Street , '' `` inner city , '' and `` central business district ( CBD ) . ''", 'As our study show , downtown are continually in the process of being remade as symbol and site of human interaction in counterpoint to other metropolitan space and function .', 'In social and cultural term , downtown are embodiment of hegemonic ( and competing ) elites at the same time that they have enabled public expression of the need of other group and interest defined by race , class , mobility , gender , age , and sexuality .', "Hence , they have been locale for transient public , divided between day and night , often writ as `` civic virtue '' and `` vice . ''", 'At the same time , downtown worldwide are now increasingly defined by new residential populations- young , wealthy , sociable , creative- who challenge this temporality and movement .', 'Yet the lifestyle of such new downtowners may conflict wiThestablished institution and their employee , with world tourist , and even with homeless people who have found niche at the heart of the city .', 'Downtowns incorporate the past , but they often prove to be even stronger repre sen ta tions of the present and future .', 'As multiple contribution to this volume make clear , downtowns around the world have taken shape through imagined form and meaning that have global currency : consumption , monumentality , mobility , modernity , gentrification .', 'Yet they are equally inflected with more problematic global dynamic such as stark division of capital and class , issue of immigration and assimilation , and problem of in e qual ity and exclusion .', 'Power , memory , creativity , and protest coalesce in downtown as flow of people , capital , and image constitute human space of connection and distinction , making and remaking the global in the form of immigration and investment , art and touristic branding .', 'Understanding downtown as center of human activity and imagination through the investigation of multiscalar intersection of economic , political , and cultural trend enacted and lived therein thus contributes to a richer understanding of global city formation and the theorization of globalization as process .', 'Still , downtown remain ambiguous .', 'Meaning converge and compete , as contradictory vision and action shape them .', 'Downtowns stand for democracy and witness its denial .', 'Theater and museum embody high culture , scandalize public , and allow interstice for new creativity .', 'Commerce invite and manipulates some global consumer while excluding others .', 'Burgeoning office building host millionaire , manager , and clerk by day and poor immigrant janitor or huddled homeless by night .', 'Public space may crystallize the conscience of a nation in protest or be patrolled into emptiness .', 'Downtowns , while place of deep local meaning , have become commoditized for global sightseer who transform museum , cathedral , market , and citizen into heritage destination , exotic experience , and disposable souvenir .', 'Many a Center City , selling a dazzling new opportunity for lifestyle choice among late capitalist elite , encloses its promise of downtown for a new and exclusive cohort , challenging its relation to the urban poor , to family in surrounding neighborhood , and even to commuter from outlying suburb .', 'The varied feature of the transformation of downtown have long interested historian , economist , geographer , and planner as well as urban bureaucrat and entrepreneur ( see , among others , Birch 2005 , 2009 ; Fogelson 2001 ; Ford 2003 ; Gratz and Mintz 1998 ; Isenberg 2005 ; Jacobs 1957 , 1961 ; Loukaitou- Sideris and Banerjee 1998 ) .', 'Drawing on contemporary anthropological theory and practice that combine an investigation of social dimension with a critical awareness of built form , political economic process , planning model , and mass medium imagery , we insist on the contribution that urban anthropology has to make to discussion at the heart of the city .', 'In examining specific dynamic of urban planning and development , for example , we are committed to understanding advocacy and order , as well as the uneven application and iteration of plan and the way in which multiple force both facilitate and hinder development .', 'While many scholar have focused on local story as narrative of decline or regeneration , our analysis reflect our commitment to comparative global ethnography from diverse position , incorporating social historical process and multiple level of cultural understanding of place and people .', 'We employ approach that examine both material culture and social construction , linking discourse of planning and social science .', 'In par tic u lar , we insist on the breadth of anthropological subject , speaking to planner , civic elite , and other academic while showing that plan , politics , the built environment , ideology , mass medium , and myriad texts all provide anthropological material , situated alongside thick ethnographic description of lived experience of those affected by , rather than shaping , urban development .', 'Th us , through contribution by anthropologist and sociologist , we emphasize the import of qualitative ethnographic work for considering these process and dynamic , and as such , the potential for an urban anthropology of downtown image , planning , and action .', 'In bringing together a collection examining global downtown through the method and theory of contemporary ethnography , we seek to enhance both interdisciplinary and transnational discussion by underscoring theme and processes that recur among compelling case .', 'The discourse of downtown already has strong root in North American development .', 'Vision of decaying city and sprawling suburb after World War II , in fact , fostered an active turn toward preservation , revitalization , and growth that has augmented previous economic , political , and cultural command function with a new evaluation of downtown lifestyle , with rationale ranging from gentrification to improved environmental planning .']

['An imaginable community : The material culture of nation-building in early republican Turkey .', 'This paper examines the spatial strategy used to achieve national integration in the formative year ( 1923-45 ) of the Turkish Republic .', "During this critical period , despite a severe shortage of human and material resource , Turkey 's leader undertook ambitious infrastructural project , including the construction of road , railroad , bridge , institutional building , and the implementation of uniform urban plan , which were meant to transform the face of the country .", 'These project generated webs of uniform and centralized service , which enabled the state to assume a more active role in shaping the daily life of its citizen .', 'Crucially , they also forged a standard recognizable material culture throughout Turkey .', "I argue that this extensive tangible scaffolding of public work , which introduced new type of space and practice , reworked the rhythms and routine of daily life , and created new network of accessibility across the country , was instrumental for cultivating people 's ability to relate the local with a larger national geography , thus rendering the nation an imaginable community .", 'The conservation and use of the walled city of Tripoli .', 'The Madina of Tripoli has suffered as a result of the departure of the wealthy , the decline of the local economy , the presence of low income inhabitant , the disrepair of heritage building and other factor .', 'The strategic action needed to improve conservation and use of the walled city include : the development of a culture dependent rather than a selective conservation approach ; improved organization and coordination among responsible agency and the people ; and , broader spatial and regional planning .', 'Specific needs include education and training ; effort by government and private group to secure more socio-economic benefit from craft , tourism and related activity ; and , economic incentive for appropriate us and conservation , for example favourable tax policy , loan and grant .', '-from Author', 'Tribalism , genealogy and the development of Al-Alkhalaf .', 'A traditional settlement in southwestern Saudi Arabia .', 'This paper examines the relationship between social structure and the built environment of Al-Alkhalaf , a traditional community in Southwestern Saudi Arabia .', 'Characteristic of the tribal way of life are discussed , leading to an examination of their influence on the built form , as well as on several community institution .', 'The important role of genealogy in the Arab culture is also demonstrated through construction of a genealogical tree of the sub-tribe inhabiting Al-Alkhalaf which is superimposed on the developed schematic layout of the settlement .', 'The paper is envisioned to contribute to the study of residential group , interaction pattern , land tenure and conception of social space .', "It concludes that today 's architect and planner can not ignore the complex interaction of the social and physical environment and , indeed , should not abandon the traditional value of society in the rush of modernity .", 'The urban sustainable structure of the vernacular city and its modern transformation : A case study of the popular architecture in the saharian Region .', 'The community vernacular city is the example of the popular architecture in arabmuslim world foundation to create a sense of belonging and attachment to the land .', "It is a reflection of people 's tradition , culture , aspiration , need , and their future .", 'In the past , the local community with its belief and creative ability was an integral part of the design and building process .', 'As a result , the architectural product has succeeded in expressing the identity of this community and maintaining element of continuity and distinction .', 'There is a lot of typical historic Islamic city , recently its urbanization has been advanced with the demolition of townscape and historic monument under the modern European style urban planning Today , most design and construction process are based on imported trend , and the product is foreign and does not express community value , and local urban space have lost their identity .', 'This contradiction represents the key issue of the identity crisis in the contemporary Arab city.Arab architecture is suffering from the absence of value and principle derived from the architectural heritage , ignorance of local climate and material , in addition to the lack of integrating modern technology with local value .', 'Tradition must be respected but development is the key of our existence .', 'Development and tradition could move in parallel .', 'Architectural style and technique could also be developed with respect to their original ideal .', 'New road construction has demolished many traditional house in old town .', 'This paper describes these phenomenon in oriental and west world and we based on case study transformation of the city of Bechar during the last 50 year , indicating in particular how the city has moved from an introversion sustainable city ( the vernacular tissue or the old ksar ) to the ex-colonial and rather provincial city into a urbanisation that is open to and influenced by the financial flow of international capitalism and that is seeking further integration into the world economy .', 'This research targets a deeper understanding of the urban structure and heritage , studying the different cause of tradition remodelling in local urban space and find out a way that understanding traditional design principle and sustainability material , our object is to motivate the architect to conserving the local identity , to find an approach that blends between tradition and modernity to revive the urban sustainable vernacular city .', 'Published by Elsevier Ltd .', 'The transitional space in the traditional urban settlement of Cyprus .', 'The interaction between public and private , people and environment , open and closed , inside and outside , and part and whole are important design criterion in traditional environment .', 'This interaction and indissoluble whole of the fabric , transitional space , which is described as the overlapping of indoor and outdoor space , has great importance .', 'In different culture , transitional space have different name : arcade , engawa , vestibule , eiwan , and hayat .', 'It is commonly named sündürme in Cyprus .', 'Sündürme is the essential component that determines the spatial pattern and formal configuration in the traditional architecture of Cyprus .', 'At the same time , it is the forthcoming transition device between traditional and contemporary environment of Cyprus .', 'Through open and renewed interpretation , sündürme has the potential to be a cultural transition that can achieve continuity of traditional value and maintain physically and socially satisfying environment .', 'Furthermore , any planning and designing strategy that considers the potential of sündürme in new housing development as a shared image of all community living on the island could contribute to the sociopolitical process .', 'Under this scope , this study points out the cultural and architectural role of sündürme and describes its spatial , functional , and climatic characteristic by referring to the formal analysis result of 154 house .', 'The study aims to draw attention to the importance of sündürme in the development of living environment towards achieving better living condition and a higher quality of living environment , while maintaining the spirit of the social and cultural lifestyle of the past and possibly is estimated that the number of people aged ≥75 year will exceed 20 million by 2025 .", 'Furthermore , over the past 10 year , we have not reduced the difference between life expectancy and healthy life expectancy .', 'Therefore , the extension of healthy life expectancy and the development of a healthy society are the most urgent issue .', 'In term of medical care , the changing time have inevitably led to change in disease structure and medical demand ; therefore , the medical delivery system has had to be changed to meet these demand .', 'As dementia rapidly increases , it is important to address “ frailty , ” a condition in which people become more vulnerable to environmental factor as they age , and there is a need to provide service to older people , particularly the old-old , that emphasize quality of life in addition to medical care .', 'To realize a super-aged society that will remain vigorous and vibrant for many year , we need to rethink the future of Japanese medicine and healthcare , and the state of society .', 'Current situation and problem : Disparity between healthy life expectancy and average life expectancy in the realization of a healthy society It is a challenge to build a society with a long and healthy life expectancy through comprehensive prevention and management of lifestyle-related disease , as well as the elucidation of the factor that explain sex difference in healthy life expectancy , based on the recognition that lifestyle-related disease in midlife are risk factor for frailty and dementia in old age .', 'Challenge in medical care for building a super-aged and healthy society The challenge include promoting clinical guideline suitable for older people , including lifestyle-related disease management , promoting comprehensive research on aging ( basic research , clinical research and community collaboration research ) , and embodying a paradigm shift from “ cure-seeking medical care ” to “ cure- and support-seeking medical care.', '” Furthermore , the key to the future of integrated community care is the development of a comprehensive medical care system for older people in each region and the development of the next generation of medical personnel .', 'Dissemination of frailty prevention measure in a super-aged society The concept of frailty encompasses the meaning of multifacetedness and reversibility ; therefore , a comprehensive approach is required , including the renewal of conventional prevention activity in each region , such as the nutritional status of older people , physical activity including exercise , and various opportunity for social participation and participation condition .', 'Challenge of an unstable diet and undernutrition in older people According to the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey of Japan , energy and protein intake are low in Japanese people aged ≥75 year ; particularly in people aged ≥80 year , low and insufficient intake of nutrient are prominent .', 'Undernutrition in older people is increasing and is more pronounced in woman .', 'There are multiple factor behind this , including social factor , such as living alone , eating alone , poverty and other social factor , as well as problem with access to food security .', 'Pharmacotherapy for older people : measure against polypharmacy In addition to the problem of adverse drug event , drug interaction , duplication of effect and the presence of drug that “ require particularly careful administration , ” it is also necessary to take measure against polypharmacy in older people , as well as medical economic issue , such as high drug cost and large amount of remaining drug .', 'Barrier to this measure include multiple medical institution visit for each disease , lack of coordination between profession , and lack of understanding by patient and family .', 'Role of local community in a healthy society The decline in the working-age population is also a major challenge ; however , we need to make a shift to use this declining birthrate and aging population as an opportunity rather than a crisis .', 'As we look ahead to the coming of the 100-year age of life , we rethink the creation of a comprehensive society and community , and aim to create an age-free society where everyone can play an active role and live in peace , regardless of age .', 'Content of the proposal : In this report , we have put together a vision for the future of an aging Japanese society from a broader perspective of how the environment and local community should be , rather than simply from the perspective of individual health .', 'We aim to convey this proposal to the Ministry of Health , Labor and Welfare , the Ministry of Education , Culture , Sports , Science and Technology , the Cabinet Office , and various professional organization .', 'The paradigm shift from “ cure-seeking medical care ” to “ cure- and support-seeking medical care ” should be promoted for the development of a healthy society While further promoting pre-emptive medical care in the medical care for older people , the development of multidisciplinary medical guideline appropriate for older people should be promoted at the same time .', 'In addition , we should promote basic aging research , clinical research ( including the long-term care field ) and transitional research that cover regional area .', 'Furthermore , while promoting the paradigm shift from “ cure-seeking medical care ” to “ cure- and support-seeking medical care , ” the development of various comprehensive medical treatment system for older people and the strengthening of integrated community care system should be promoted .', 'Development of the next generation of medical personnel to comprehensively deal with geriatric care , including training geriatric specialist , should be promoted As the number of older people with multimorbidities and frailty rapidly increases in the future , we should promote the development of the next generation of medical personnel who can comprehensively handle medical care for older people , including training leading geriatrician in cooperation with multiple profession in the integrated community care system to provide sufficient medical care .', 'Countermeasure for frailty in older people should be promoted from medical and community planning perspective To address frailty , which requires comprehensive evaluation and intervention , the three pillar of frailty prevention ( nutrition , exercise and social participation ) should be incorporated and addressed as part of community development within each municipality , taking into account local characteristic .', 'In particular , it is necessary to revise the way of thinking about nutrition management in older people and the guideline of the society in the field .', 'In addition , it is important to strengthen industry–academia–government–private partnership in each region , taking into account not only medical issue , but also social factor , and encourage the development of momentum in the entire region regarding measure against undernutrition in older people .', 'Polypharmacy measure should be promoted in pharmacotherapy for older people It is necessary to promote cooperation between physician and pharmacist , establish other multiprofessional cooperation system , and develop medical and long-term care insurance system to support this .', "It is also essential to change the public 's mindset , and awareness-raising activity at all level are required , including the enhancement of educational material for medical caregiver and the general public .", 'In addition , the economic impact of healthcare using big data should be timely clarified .', 'Innovation in medical and urban planning perspective should be promoted In the future , it will be necessary to modify and update multidisciplinary approach such as social participation ( e.g .', 'participation in a salon ) with a view to innovation in both medical care and community development , especially on the idea of a symbiotic community .', 'In addition , industry–academia–government–private partnership is necessary , including all aforementioned , such as place where people can play an active role in the rest of their life ( such as employment ) , promotion of human connection , promotion of technology to support older people and support for daily life .', 'Geriatr Gerontol Int 2021 ; 21 : 601–613 .', 'Urban Landscape-Cubic Stone Streets in Historical Areas , Advantages and Disadvantages .', 'Architect , landscape architect and culture people , inhabitant of Timisoara , want to stop the approach of local councillor who adopted in 2016 a feasibility study on the modernization of the to , depending on their local need and the benefit they give .', 'A simple comparison with city from Italy , such as Rome , can make us not only more aware of their importance , but also teaches us ( cost ) .', "The above mentioned building function have constituted the framework of the `` sustainability '' issue which was held in the U.N. Rio conference in 1992 .", "This study argues , `` sustainable system '' as an issue of traditional urban form which has been regarded as optimum , impressive and objective solution to design problem heritage district .', 'Re-locating the identity of Amman ’ s city through the hybridization process .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to define the identity , city identity and architectural identity ; to review , analyze and synthesize different piece from literature to explore and define the factor that shape the city identity ; to define the strategy of hybridization process that can be used to re-locate ( re-define ) the city identity ; to examine the most effective factor that shape the identity of Amman city from various perspective , to examine the relationships/interrelationships between all the factor that shape any city identity from the designer ’ perspective , finally , to apply the strategy of hybridization process to re-locate ( re-define ) Amman ’ s city identity .', 'Design/methodology/approach : This research used two research method to collect data as follows : literature review , content analysis and face-face questionnaire .', 'Descriptive statistic were used to examine the most effective factor that shape the Amman ’ s identity from different perspective .', 'The Pearson product-moment correlation coefficient ( Pearson r ) was computed to assess the relationship between all factor that shape the identity of any city from the perspective of Jordanian designer and expert .', 'Finding : This research concluded that the factor that shape the city identity are cultural factor ( socio-cultural , historical , economical and globalization factor ) , environmental factor ( geographic , climate and building material factor ) and urban and architectural factor ( spatial design organization , architectural style , open space and park , urban structure factor ) .', 'Additionally , the six urban development factor that responsible for the hybridization process in a city are new architectural typology and new special configuration , urban edge and hybrid texture , public hybridization open space , road highway-scapes , urban redevelopment through super site by star architect and downtown urban development .', 'This research found that there are different perspective about the definition and factor that shape the identity of Amman ’ s city because of difference in culture , experience , knowledge , education level and personal preference .', 'The city identity is not a constant concept .', 'It is changed according to time , place , people , culture , global trend , economic status and experience .', 'Moreover , the correlation result revealed that the relationships/interrelationships between all the factor that shape the identity of any city have strong/very strong positive linear association and significant relationship ( r > 0.89 ) .', 'Practical implication : Greater Amman Municipality ( GAM ) should provide a vision to redefine the identity of Amman city and control over the development pressure , built form and image of the city .', 'This vision should be based on research , analysis and adoption of the most effective road map .', 'GAM and all stakeholder should establish and enforce using specific architectural style , urban design guideline , building code , policy tool and land use regulation to re-define the city identity .', 'GAM should review , assess , approve and supervise all development project through all design and construction phase especially in sensitive area .', 'GAM should focus on building capacity , empower its architect and planner , and re-organize ( re-structure ) their unit and administration especially planning and licensing department to improve the city image and guide development .', 'This research recommended that architect should design new , diverse and innovative architectural concept , typology and spatial configuration .', 'Rapid development and new edge should be planned , designed and managed from the part to the whole .', 'The heterogeneous landscape and everyday activity will improve the vitality of urban and open public space and form of public culture .', 'Architect and star architect ought not to make a clear and sharp separation between old and new development , architectural style and typology .', 'Architect and urban designer ought to design hybrid physical urban environment , urban morphology , urban multi-functional activity , mix-use building , open space for social life , street pattern and furniture , square , architectural style and typology , spatial connectivity , green space and landscape entity .', 'The designer and planner should consider how to create a city for living , working and recreation .', 'Originality/value : This research defined the identity , city identity , architectural identity and the factor that may shape the city identity .', 'This research proposed and used the hybridization process as a tool to re-locate ( re-define ) the identity of Amman city and any city to be more obvious .', 'Additionally , this research examined the relationships/interrelationships between the factor that shape the city identity .', 'Geophysical setting and urban form of a traditional city : Examination of the Kurdish city of Sanandaj , Iran .', 'Considering the nature of place which includes both inside and outside characteristic , as essential part of existence , a city can not be imagined without nature .', 'Natural element determine the character of urban form and they can be recognised as the primary component of the urban form configuration .', "Based on this leading point , the traditional city of Sanandaj , the capital of the Kurdistan province , located in the western part of Iran , is examined to reveal the nature of interaction between the city 's urban form and its natural setting through time .", 'Drawing on document analysis and observation of existing built form and its natural context , this paper highlights how the traditional city has been forming and changing through time .', "The result present evidence of how people related to nature and how the overall spatial principle of the city 's traditional core were shaped on the basis of idea stemming from the natural order while culture shapes the detail of the place 's structure .", "From stone masonry to emigrant 's mansion .", 'Change in vernacular architecture in central Portugal .', 'The research made for this purpose was realized to study the connection between the way of life , the climate , the geology and the vernacular architecture in the parish of Cernache do Bonjardim , municipality of Sertã , central region of Portugal , where various style of rural house can be found .', 'The traditional rural home of this territory is constituted by stone wall , mostly made of shale or granite and has two floor : a lower floor with a place for animal or food storage , and an upper floor with the kitchen/living-room and bedroom .', 'Usually , both floor are joined by outside stair .', 'Each available space , for instance under these stair , is used to keep animal like swine or hen , goat or rabbit , and to store food .', 'Usually there is a piece of ground around the house used for the plantation of vegetable and fruit tree .', "This kind of home is adapted to the people 's way of living and the climate , using local material like stone or wood .", 'In the 19th century there was an emigration wave to Brazil .', "When the people returned they wanted to show their acquired richness and ( sometimes ) culture to the neighbour in the village and constructed large house of mansion-type , which did n't show the strong adaption to the environment anymore , but had other functionality and a better comfort .", 'As the transportation means improved , the building material was no more limited to the local offer .', 'The emigration from the sixty of the 20th century until today brought new kind of building .', 'Their style was influenced from the country of emigration .', 'There is no more relation to the local style of building .', 'For the construction , modern material like concrete , tile wall and roof tile are used .', "The major conclusion of the research are that the vernacular architecture of the studied region has changed from house adapted to the climate and the rural way of life , to larger and no more `` typical '' building .", "The main reason for this change are the return of emigrant from abroad and its influence , the availability of new material , the better education and income of the people , the wish to life more comfortably , and the change of the people 's way of life from farming to employment .", 'Architectural conservation as a promoter of cultural identity .', 'Culture has been generally understood as the characteristic and knowledge of a particular group of people in the area encompassing language , religion , cuisine , 'External influence on architecture and planning from different source has been modulating the culture of place .', 'And so , a conscious action towards conservation of culture can be strengthened by case is , how to make them a good continuation in term of architecture and culture .', 'Conversion in the heritage of Modern Movement often concerns both the structure of the building and their function .', 'It mainly focuses on extension , renovation or rebuilding the old structure .', 'Those action usually achieve their functional and economic goal , but the architectural result are often more debatable .', "The article presents three example of `` continuity by change '' in modern architecture of Gdynia : the extension of the City Market Halls carried out in the 1991 ; the renovation
