'But more and more sociologist present an idea that urbanism is not only the evolution of land use or change of other objective thing , is but also a kind of life style , a whole set of social and culture characteristic , which is totally different from that of rural area .', "This review summarizes study of urban sprawl from many side , and then conducts a diverse understanding of urban sprawl and urbanization , which points out that social is made of people and urbanization should add the concept of people 's urbanism , such as the social mixing , social integration .", 'Only when the social urbanism is completed , the urbanization is done and urban sprawl finish .', 'To plan , design and evaluate “ urban mending ” .', 'Pope Francis ’ s encyclical provides researcher concerned with the problem of the urban periphery with three suggestion .', 'The first is to renounce any specialized approach that is based on an acritical confidence in the power of science and technology to solve the complex problem of today ’ s world , particularly those that concern the environment and the poor .', 'The second is to adopt an approach based on a “ culture of care ” for nature and for the most vulnerable people , and third approach is to include people ( especially those who are weakest ) in transparent decision-making process that affect the quality of their life .', 'Starting from these suggestion , and from Renzo Piano ’ s statement that , at present and in the future , “ the mission of architecture is to save the outskirt ” through “ a huge work of mending ” , we believe that researcher should , with humility , make use of the ‘ urban-mending ’ approach when dealing with the complexity of regeneration project .', 'At the level of both the architectural project and urban planning , they should adopt an integrated , interdisciplinary approach that is lighter and more sensitive than those used in the past .', 'This will help them to face up to the multidimensionality and complexity of redeveloping peripheral area .', 'All stakeholder , especially the weakest people in society , should be empowered and involved in public decision making and planning implementation .', 'Finally , genuine participation of the marginalized , excluded and disaffected inhabitant of peripheral area ( i.e.', ', the outcast ) can be achieved using a “ deliberative-democratic ” approach .', 'City and Urbanity in the Social Discourse .', 'The aim of our article is an attempt to present the concept of urbanity that has been shaped throughout century along with the development of ['Wildfire risk , biodiversity and peri-urban planning in the Mt Lofty Ranges , South Australia .', 'Major fire on the periphery of Australian city are reframing perception of what constitutes effective landscape planning and vegetation management .', "The emerging governance challenge to simultaneously mitigate wildfire risk and support improved conservation practice is reviewed in the context of pre-colonial and modern culture within the peri-urban Mediterranean climatic region of South Australia 's Mt Lofty Ranges .", 'The analysis suggests that anthropogenic burning of landscape has been a vital historical component of risk management .', 'During the early modern era however , improved capacity to manage wildfire risk led to complacency in light of the hazard , which in turn has led to urbanization that has not sufficiently accounted for the level of risk .', 'A planning conflict is emerging within the wooded upland as there is renewed interest in wildfire risk , which is reflected in new state policy providing greater allowance for land owner to clear vegetation around dwelling .', 'Although attempt have been made to constrain urban growth around the city of Adelaide , recent workshop with key environmental management stakeholder suggest that urbanization continues within the Mt Lofty Ranges in area that are both highly vulnerable to fire and of great importance for biodiversity conservation , such that planning is not reflecting the culture of risk or biodiversity value .', 'For such risk and value to be taken into account within reflexive system of governance , the narrative on opportunity for adaptation generated by the people who facilitate vegetation management must be accommodated into deliberation on policy .', 'The identification and planning of particularly vulnerable and valuable space within the broader landscape and cultural contexts of risk and value would enable complex , targeted response to environmental hazard , conservation and development need in the peri-urban upland .', 'Yanama budyari gumada : reframing the urban to care as Darug Country in western Sydney .', 'In non-urban place of Australia , caring-as-Country frame natural resource management ( NRM ) as a practice of reciprocal , more-than-human care-giving ( S. Suchet-Pearson , S. Wright , K. Lloyd , and L. Burarrwanga .', '2013 .', '‘ Caring as Country : towards and ontology of co-becoming in natural resource management.', '’ Asia Pacific Viewpoint 54 ( 2 ) : 185–197 ) .', 'Caring-as-Country is an idea that encapsulates the entangled , reciprocal relationship that people have with , and as part of , agentic more-than-human world .', 'In more urbanised place , however , practice of caring-as-Country are often unrecognised , undervalued and undocumented .', 'In this paper we make explicit practice of caring , healing and rejuvenation at Yellomundee Regional Park , Darug Country in western Sydney .', 'Our discussion of care , entanglement and reciprocity at Yellomundee focus on two specific activity that embody caring-as-Country : the return of cultural burn and sustained presence on Country in the form of Darug-led culture camp .', 'The Darug principle of yanama budyari gumada , to ‘ walk with good spirit ’ , embodies and invites new way of thinking and practising intercultural caring-as-Country in heavily colonised , urban place like Yellomundee .', 'As we document the practice arising from this invitation , we consider its far-reaching implication for NRM and planning , and we expand on the importance of geography of care for unceded urban place .', "Indigenous Rough Sleeping in Darwin , Australia : 'Out of Place ' in an Urban Setting .", 'Much of what is known of street homelessness is informed by account from urban centre throughout North America and the UK .', 'The nature of the problem and the way in which it is addressed are implicitly assumed to be similar across diverse major city .', 'The street homeless are thought to be highly marginalised and vulnerable .', 'In turn , contemporary policy aim to provide housing/accommodation and welfare to address this form of homelessness as deep exclusion .', "Based on empirical research in Australia 's northernmost capital city , Darwin , this article demonstrates the role of culture in how homelessness is experienced and addressed .", 'It argues that cultural mobility and mode of behaviour that normalise rough sleeping are embedded within condoned poverty and discriminatory legislation directed towards Indigenous people .', 'Indigenous people are constructed as out of place in urban environment and rather than housing and welfare , the focus is directed towards moving the problem .', "Urban renewal and the creative underclass : Aboriginal youth subculture in sydney 's redfern-waterloo .", "Redfern-Waterloo , on the edge of Sydney 's CBD , has long been an important center for the city 's Aboriginal population , as a place to live , socialize , work , and/or access service provided by the area 's numerous Aboriginal organization .", 'State plan to regenerate Redfern-Waterloo , to realize its latent potential , far from seeking to displace the socially disadvantaged Aboriginal community and erase its cultural legacy , stress the importance of a continuing indigenous presence .', "Planning and policy document generally suggest that Aboriginal people can contribute to , and reap the benefit of , the area 's renaissance .", 'This article will explore construction of minority culture in planning discourse in Sydney and in particular the way indigenous culture and citizenship is delineated in the discourse of urban renewal .', "The vision of Aboriginal culture ( and residual communal presence ) is narrow and circumscribed by conventional `` touristic '' representation ( fine art , dance , and other performance ) around national heritage and consumption .", "This excludes many of the area 's youth who , like their counterpart throughout the world , identify more with street culture-hip-hop , graffiti art , skateboarding , etc.-than with traditional arts/high culture .", 'These activity have little place in the vision for urban renewal .', 'This article will argue that civic booster strategy that fail to recognize the complex and ambiguous character of public space and their importance as site of resistant/underground/avant-garde/youth subculture will inevitably generate sterile landscape ; their vision of local communal heritage is little more than tokenistic .', 'Right to the diverse city : Challenge to indigenous participation in urban planning and heritage preservation in Sydney , Australia .', 'Western city are becoming increasingly culturally diverse through the intersection of process such as international migration and the political resurgence of Indigenous people .', 'The challenge remains , however , to shift from physical copresence to equal right to the city .', "This article explores this challenge in an empirical case study of Aboriginal participation in plan for urban development on the fringe of Sydney , Australia 's largest city .", 'The finding from this research highlight the limit of official attempt at recognition that focus on a narrow definition of culture to the detriment of economic and political equity .', 'It provides empirical support for a reconceptualization of recognition to incorporate redistribution in order to redress historical marginalization and dispossession that currently limit participation in the urban polity for diverse group .', 'La Belle Mort en Milieu rural : A report of an ethnographic study of the good death for Quebec rural francophones .', 'An ethnographic study was undertaken in two rural area of Quebec to conceptualize the good death .', 'The finding reveal that a good quality of life for the dying person and his or her family and friend is essential for a good death .', 'The resulting conceptual model emphasized four dimension : physical , spiritual , social , and emotional/psychological .', 'These dimension were determined to be similar to those discovered through a previous urban study , indicating that there may be considerable overlap between good death in rural and urban area .', 'Some finding of this Quebec French-language rural study were similar to those of an Alberta English-language rural study , indicating that rural people may have some common need and interest with regard to the good death .', 'As such , there could be some common element of the good death that transcend culture or ethnicity .', 'Chief among these is the desire of rural people to die at home or in their home community .', 'Designing affordable housing with cree , anishinabe , and métis people .', "Three level of government are investing in the renewal or construction of affordable housing in Manitoba 's inner-city area .", 'Much of this housing is targeted to community that are predominantly Aboriginal .', 'Little consultation has occurred about the underlying cultural assumption of the design of these home .', 'This is in spite of the fact that the layout of a home may significantly direct the life way of a family or affect their relationship to relative or neighbour .', 'Lack of consultation has proved problematic in some Indigenous community , whereas in those few case where consultation has occurred , the emerging design have been significantly different from conventional design .', 'This article describes a four-year process of consultation on cultural concept in the design of building intended for Aboriginal family in urban community in Manitoba .', 'Participatory design activity drew out numerous theme that , if incorporated into building , might help Indigenous family retain or recover their cultural value and lifeways .', 'A number of these Indigenous theme have been incorporated in building that have already been constructed .', 'The theme relate not just to the decorative feature of the building but to conceptual assumption underlying their design .', 'The article concludes with some public policy recommendation .', 'Indigenous placemaking and the built environment : toward transformative urban design .', 'This paper examines how the design and programming of the built environment of settler city have contributed to the invisibility of Indigenous people and minimizing their cultural influence .', 'It seeks to address gap in the academic literature on Indigenous placemaking and urban design .', 'Indigenous placemaking has the capacity to create positive symbolic capital associated with Indigenous people , empowering urban inhabitant in their cultural representation , and advancing the project of truth and reconciliation .', 'To transcend beyond tokenism , Indigenous culture projected in built form should not be subordinated by settler mainstream decision-making framework .', "Living near the `` town that lost its water '' : Explaining resident ' environmental concern in a rural-small urban township in Ontario .", 'This study is concerned with developing culturally sensitive risk management strategy among Old Order Mennonite ( OOM ) and other community , living in the Township of Woolwich and farming along a tributary of the Grand River .', "Based on 34 semi-structured interview with two group of female participant , the multiple layer of culture ( community context , people 's shared core value , worldviews ) were analyzed in term of their effect on risk perception as well as risk attenuation or risk amplification processes .", "This research with excluded `` others '' articulated an exploration of modern environmental hazard in a place isolated from outsider .", "The research reveals not only that epistemic difference shaped these woman 's perception of risk , but also that their response were modified through ongoing obligation to cultural and religious separation , and a centuries-old resistance to change and modernity .", 'By focusing on the influence of culture in risk perception , this case study contributes essential insight for environmental planner and manager into developing collaborative work with conservative religious community faced with environmental hazard .', 'Schooling for sustainable development : A focus on Australia , New Zealand , and the oceanic region .', '“ This book Schooling for Sustainable Development : A Focus on Australia , New Zealand and the Oceanic Region , is the product of passionate interest of teacher , scholar and researcher located in diverse part of the Australasian region .', 'Working with their colleague within local contexts they have conducted research and gathered together information for practitioner and student interested in learning more about sustainable lifestyle practice .', 'Some of the work has taken place in remote location and some has been in within the confines of major city .', 'The Australasian Region brings together people and culture that link traditional economy to global network and lifestyle .', 'Diverse terrain , politics and response typify the region .', 'Close to Asia there are lingering tie with old European way and cultural belief .', 'The major economy of Australia and New Zealand provide the lead with development practice for lesser economy such as Papua New Guinea , Fiji and the many island nation scattered throughout the South Pacific .', 'This complexity is not easily represented .', 'Key issue relate to land ownership , mobility within the region and the gradual dissemination of knowledge , skill and wealth .', 'The book will provide both reference material and interesting reading for teacher , researcher and practitioner in interested in community based perspective on sustainability .', 'We have learnt from each other and hope that others will benefit from our effort .', 'Whither aboriginal education ?', '.', 'Taiwanese government is continuously putting significant effort into aboriginal education that is vital to keep their traditional culture alive and offers a way to success and self-realization .', 'Adding point to school admission examination score and government funding for overseas student are benefiting aboriginal student .', 'The government , in addition to the preservation of aboriginal language , has worked out a system for writing the language , completed the compilation of the teaching material for the nine-year compulsory education system and passed the relevant law to encourage indigenous student .', 'The College of Indigenous Studies at National Dong Hwa University is expected to become a foundation for talent cultivation and offer job opportunity to indigenous people .', 'Some tribal college have also been set up to combine ethnic , educational , cultural and community resource to develop tribal wisdom and shape a collective will in tribe .', 'Translating culture : Framing indigenous knowledge through architecture .', 'Can architecture contribute to equality and reconciliation of indigenous people ?', 'Having worked with Aboriginal community for over two decade on a series of typology across Western Australia , architects iredale pedersen hook have recently contributed to a major scheme for the heart of Perth ’ s central business district .', 'Yagan Square ’ s spatial framework is informed by the substantial historical research and public engagement that are at the heart of their method , bringing Indigenous and non-Indigenous people together .', 'Martyn Hook , a co-director of the practice and Dean of the School of Architecture and Urban Design at Melbourne ’ s RMIT University , explains .', 'Transforming tradition : Place , ideology , development , and planning in bali .', 'This chapter addresses a globally celebrated culture - Bali , the Island of the Gods .', 'It argues that the protection of culture is a pivotal element in the creation of a healthy city .', 'Balinese culture involves long-standing tradition in a myriad of art form , including religion , architecture , urban planning , language , dance , art , theatre , painting , sculpture , silversmithing , and wood carving .', 'Culture in Balinese society refers predominantly to the traditional system of government and beliefs called adat and sima .', 'While Balinese live within a system of globalized capitalism , ideologically they remain rooted in the custom and tradition of village life .', 'In consequence , Balinese culture is increasingly becoming a ‘ manufactured ’ phenomenon as the process of commodification deepen .', 'The state ’ s feeble planning action to protect culture disguises its tacit support for private capital against the will of the people for truthful and significant policy that work in the best interest of cultural conservation .', 'Intercultural landscape : An Australian approach to cultural literacy .', "Introduction Australia has an indigenous culture with thousand of year of associative relationship to `` country '' and our contemporary urban centre are home to increasingly diverse population of people from all corner of the globe .", "For landscape architect and urban designer this presents both the challenge of multiple 'sense of place '' and the opportunity to create a unique notion of 'intercultural place ' that generate an environment that people of all culture can have associative relationship with .", "This paper explores the notion of Cultural Literacy and the impact of design decision on the cultural life of Australia 's diverse community .", 'Method Cultural Literacy can be understood as the ability to read , understand , find significance , evaluate and compare local culture .', "As Lefebvre [ 1996 ] states `` Cultural Literacy can be seen as the skill base associated with understanding both the encoding and decoding required to develop culturally meaningful product , place or program '' .", 'The paper will present a cultural literacy framework for seeing , planning and designing through an intercultural lens .', "Result By understanding the community multiple 'place narrative ' and seeing thing through an intercultural lens it is possible to plan and develop more inclusive and culturally sensitive public space .", 'Conclusion As culture is what gives meaning to our life then everything we do should have a cultural dimension .', 'Therefore , all planning is or at least should be cultural , and be at the very centre of thinking about city , not just about our social or civic life but also about the environment , infrastructure and economics of the city .', "The presenter will explore the potential of responsive planning and understanding the consequence and implication of urban planning on a community 's cultural life and highlight a range of Cultural Literacy tool for planner and urban designer .", 'Using of indigenous knowledge in agriculture .', 'Experience shows that indigenous knowledge not only has no contradiction with formal knowledge but different indigenous knowledge feature , put it as well complementary for formal knowledge .', 'Indigenous knowledge is accessible , useful and cheap .', 'Its perspective is holistic and its transmission is verbal .', 'Knowledge is dynamic and time-tested , and while it has grown within local natural and social environment , so it is very sustainable with indigenous condition .', 'Indigenous knowledge refers to both component and whole part of culture of each nation and this component and whole integration is so that stop to change traditional society of life without indigenous knowledge out of its cultural origin and therefore would lose it concept and effectiveness .', 'in recent decade following issue had been recognized very essential : programming and performing development plan , indigenous knowledge at farming , pest control , ranching , veterinary , nutrition , medicine , watershed management , foresting , architecture , urban planning , social association and decision making method as sustainable technology .', 'At on hand , reason of this great evolution can be found due to wrong policy and at the other hand in undesirable environmental consequence of these policy .', 'Indigenous knowledge is different with scientific knowledge that was established by university and scientific community .', 'This knowledge is basis for decision making at field of agriculture , health , education , food and natural source Indigenous knowledge is set of all knowledge and skill that people enjoy in one geographical area ( in one environmental condition ) that most of their skill and knowledge be transmitted to next generation , and new generation would be adapted with them and add to it Since , each knowledge is consequent of individual interaction with environment , so indigenous knowledge is consequent of indigenous people interaction with their environment .', 'Word and music .', 'Aboriginals-related publication in Taiwan are becoming richer in content and style due to the growing concern for aboriginal issue and the effort to promote aboriginal culture .', 'Aboriginal songwriter have started to create new work , often combining aboriginal and non-aboriginal element .', 'The Shung Ye Museum of Formosan Aborigines has been translating texts written by Spanish and Dutch colonist during their stay on the island in the 17th century to have a more complete understanding of indigenous people in earlier time .', 'Aside from producing its own publication , the museum is promotes those released by other publisher from time to time and makes special edition for exhibition it holds annually to focus on aboriginal-related theme .', "The Taiwan 's Indigenous Peoples Resource Center ( TIPRC ) , an agency commissioned by CIP , is collecting publication and establishing a digital archive of everything aboriginal .", 'Giving indigenous people a voice .', "The Taiwan Indigenous TV ( TITV ) , the first TV station devoted to the Taiwan 's aboriginal , is performing a vital task to help aborigine to keep their language and culture alive .", "TITV 's news department often offers break story concerning aborigine , while the station also tackles sensitive issue .", 'Program at TITV are diverse , ranging from cooking show featuring traditional recipe from the various tribe , rarely shown on mainstream TV , to segment educating child about their native language and culture , to talk show and interview covering serious issue including the health , economic and educational problem faced by aborigine .', 'TITV regularly invites distinguished aborigine such as respected scholar to speak on air about matter concerning indigenous people , including unemployment , alcoholism , inadequate health care , fading custom and the sense of isolation felt by youth unable to assimilate into mainstream Taiwanese society .', 'Strengthening the root .', 'Indigenous movement in Taiwan , intended to make both indigenous people and Taiwan as a whole more competitive , is promising Taiwan a brighter future through reviving the traditional wisdom of indigenous people , which can contribute significantly to the promotion of many highly promising venture such as eco-tourism and leisure culture .', 'The government is trying to design a new partnership that be defined in constitutional revision , with an entire chapter devoted to indigenous people , a significant step to safeguard the status of aboriginal in accordance with their will .', 'The Council of Indigenous Peoples ( CIP ) works legally as the coordinator of aboriginal affair among different ministry .', 'The council has began to take charge of management of some 250,000 hectare of land reserved for habitation and cultivation by aboriginal .']

['The relation between perceived sensory dimension of urban green space and stress restoration .', 'Research indicates a relationship between sensory perception of natural environment and human health .', 'Our hypothesis is that people perceive green space in term of certain dimension , where some dimension are more important and preferred than others with respect to restoring people from stress .', 'The aim are to : identify and describe the perceived dimension in nature ; identify which dimension people in general prefer ; identify the dimension people reporting stress prefer ; and identify a combination of the dimension people reporting stress prefer .', 'A total of 953 randomly selected informant from nine Swedish city ( representative of the Swedish population ) answered a postal questionnaire with pre-coded question .', 'The questionnaire consisted of three part : personal data , preference for natural quality and self-estimations of health status .', 'The data were analyzed using factor analysis and regression analysis .', 'The result identify and describe eight perceived sensory dimension .', 'People in general prefer the dimension Serene , followed by Space , Nature , Rich in Species , Refuge , Culture , Prospect and Social .', 'The dimension Refuge and Nature are most strongly correlated with stress , indicating a need to find the most restorative environment .', 'A combination of Refuge , Nature and Rich in Species , and a low or no presence of Social , could be interpreted as the most restorative environment for stressed individual .', 'From a city planning perspective , the result indicate how urban green space can be viewed as element of importance to public mental health .', 'However , before the dimension can be used by practitioner as tool to promote health through city planning , more research is needed .', 'People need in the urban landscape : Analysis of Landscape And Urban Planning contribution .', 'The article published in Landscape and Urban Planning during the past 16 year provide valuable insight into how human interact with outdoor urban environment .', 'This review paper explores the wide spectrum of human dimension and issue , or human need , addressed by 90 of these study .', 'As a basis for analysis , the major theme tapped by the finding were classified into two overarching group containing three category each .', 'The Nature needs , directly linked with the physical feature of the environmental setting , were categorized in term of contact with nature , aesthetic preference , and recreation and play .', 'The role of the environment is less immediate in the Human-interaction group , which includes the issue of social interaction , citizen participation in the design process , and community identity .', 'Most significantly , the publication offer strong support for the important role nearby natural environment play in human well-being .', 'Urban setting that provide nature contact are valuable not only in their own right , but also for meeting other need in a manner unique to these more natural setting .', 'In addition , although addressed in different way , remarkable similarity exist concerning these six people requirement across diverse culture and political system .', 'Urban resident worldwide express a desire for contact with nature and each other , attractive environment , place in which to recreate and play , privacy , a more active role in the design of their community , and a sense of community identity .', 'The study reviewed here offer continued evidence that the design of urban landscape strongly influences the well-being and behavior of user and nearby inhabitant .', 'Capitalising on multiplicity : A transdisciplinary system approach to landscape research .', 'Different discipline have landscape as the focal point of their research .', 'They are successful in presenting new finding about landscape within their specialisation , but collaboration - and thus , transfer of knowledge across disciplinary boundary - is seldom realised because a common approach that bridges the gap between discipline is missing .', 'Instead , different landscape concept exist side by side .', 'Yet , cooperation is required to tackle the various environmental and social problem related to landscape .', 'This paper provides an overview of the historical development of landscape concept originating from different cultural and scientific trend , and presents a new complex concept of landscape , which is designed to enable transdisciplinary landscape research .', 'The transdisciplinary landscape concept is based on five dimension of landscape : the spatial entity , the mental entity , the temporal dimension , the nexus of nature and culture , and the systemic property of landscape .', 'In contrast to other approach , it unites dimension that are usually the domain of individual discipline and makes it , thus , possible to capitalise on plurality in landscape research .', 'The concept promotes landscape as the combination of the subsystem known as the geo- , bio- and noo-sphere , and is illustrated by the people-landscape interaction model .', 'The concept can be applied to all human-landscape-related research , but is exemplified by two study that have investigated the relationship between landscape and second-home tourism , and landscape and farming , respectively .', 'Perception of cultural ecosystem service in urban green space : A case study in Gwacheon , Republic of Korea .', 'Green space provide a variety of ecosystem service .', 'Urban green space have particular value because they offer the benefit of cultural service to those living in urban area .', 'This study analyzed perception of cultural ecosystem service in the urban context of Gwacheon , Republic of Korea .', 'We analyzed the cultural service provided by green space by surveying 240 resident of Gwacheon about which green space they frequently visit and what their major activity are in these green space , in order to find out how green space are utilized by urban resident .', 'Since forest and large park in Gwacheon are easily accessible from downtown area because of the city structure , they play major role in providing cultural ecosystem service .', 'This study suggests that people find diverse cultural value in their everyday surroundings , not just in space with excellent ecosystem .', 'This study has significant implication because of its quantification of current cultural service by a survey approach .', 'Preference and emotion perception of ornamental plant specie for green space designing among urban park user in Iran .', 'The main objective of the present study was to explore preference and eumotion perception of people in Rasht and Ardabil ( Iran ) to some ornamental plant in order to help designing appropriate urban green landscape .', 'The study surveyed urban park user in the two city in 2017 to identify and compare the most important factor underpinning the viability of public open space from the perspective of user ( mental aspect ) and the extent to which these mental factor match the visual feature of the selected space ( visual aspect ) .', 'A random sample of 232 individual was taken from student in Ardabil ( 119 person ) and Rasht ( 113 person ) .', 'A considerable part of the participant ( 37.2 % ) reported a feeling of tranquility when they saw flower , while 28.8 % of the participant reported a feeling of love .', 'Flower-bearing plant specie were more appealing to the participant than leafy ornamental plant .', 'Red was the most preferred flower color ( 52.1 % ) followed by violet ( 18.6 % ) and orange ( 11.4 % ) among the ornamental specie commonly used in the design of green space , while tulip ( Tulipa gesneriana ) ( 29 % ) , rose ( Rosa hybrida ) ( 25 % ) , and Easter lily ( Lilium longiflorum ) ( 19 % ) were in the first top rank of preference , respectively .', 'Coleus ( Solenostemon scutellarioides ) and garden croton ( Codiaeum variegatum ) were also reported among preferred specie .', 'The result support the assumption of similarity in preference and requirement of citizen of large city and despite great diversity in geography , culture , and ethic , people in large city exhibit similar emotion perception .', 'The study finding are expected to support public authority and urban planner to effectively design and manage urban green space to meet user ’ need .', 'How a riparian landscape finds form and comes alive .', 'If we consider riparian area as landscape it means that we consider them as entity whose survival depends on ecological as well as on cultural sustainability .', "Ecological sustainability requires people 's understanding of the role of both diversity and connectivity of riparian area .", "Cultural sustainability requires people 's attention and care towards diversity and connectivity .", 'It is argued that interaction between ecological and cultural sustainability governs riparian management , and that we still have to promote such an interaction .', 'Community attachment and resident attitude toward old masonry wall and associated tree in urban Hong Kong .', 'Mature urban tree dwelling on old masonry wall are a rare urban ecological and landscape treasure .', "These 'stonewall ' tree denoting synergy between nature ( tree ) and culture ( masonry ) are worth preserving .", 'This study aims to identify factor influencing public attitude toward this important but threatened natural-cum-cultural asset in a compact city milieu .', 'Evidence is solicited from a face-to-face questionnaire survey involving 800 citizen of Hong Kong .', 'Result indicate that Hong Kong people generally appreciate the existence of stonewall tree .', 'Younger adult harbored doubt about their value , whereas the older one were more sympathetic .', 'Local resident of the suburb that host the majority of stonewall tree registered stronger commitment than non-local resident .', 'Community attachment had positive effect across both resident group , but length of tenure was not a key factor .', 'This suggests that affinity for stonewall tree is a function of the affective bonding between people and the community where they live .', 'Deep engagement with the local community elevated the desire for preserving the wall and associated tree .', 'The finding are important for understanding public perception and enlisting support from the larger society for preserving the urban asset against mounting pressure for urban development and renewal .', 'Comparative analysis of utilisation of open space at neighbourhood level in three Asian city : Singapore , Delhi and Kuala Lumpur .', "Planner and urban designer place high value on public open space , because of the latter 's contribution to the quality of life and social interaction of resident in an urban development .", 'Many urban theorist consider open space as an important component of a healthy urban environment .', 'It is well established in the literature that the utilisation of public space varies from context to context .', 'This article investigates whether the utilisation of open space at the neighbourhood level is more associated with the physical and functional property of open space or if it varies across different culture and contexts of city .', 'This research adopts the method of comparative analysis , involving three case study from different culture , and climatic and geographical contexts .', 'In each of these three city , the opinion of resident and visitor about public open space were obtained and observation survey were conducted to measure the utilisation of these space .', 'The research found that the utilisation of public space at various level of neighbourhood significantly differs between city because of the local context , such as culture , social value and climate , instead of just being due to the physical and functional property of open space .', 'Application of the eight perceived sensory dimension as a tool for urban green space assessment and planning in China .', 'Several evidence from the Nordic country suggest that the eight perceived sensory dimension , which are serene , nature , rich in specie , space , prospect , refuge , social and culture , can be used as a reliable tool for urban green space assessment and planning , but whether or not this is the case for China is unknown .', 'Using an onsite questionnaire distributed to green space user in Hefei , China , this study is the first to examine the representation of the eight sensory dimension as perceived by Chinese people in different type of green space , and to identify the relationship between the eight sensory dimension and preference , including the factor that most influenced their perception .', "The result showed that : ( 1 ) Social was common , while culture and rich in specie the least common—which was not in line with the previous European study ; ( 2 ) The popularity of green space type was positively related to the number of highly perceived sensory dimension ; ( 3 ) Type of green space was a key determinant of perception of the eight sensory dimension , and certain socioeconomic and green space use variable also had a great impact on people 's perception .", 'The result grant potential to the method in assessment and planning of urban green space in China .', 'The perception to the symbolic meaning in landscape designing .', 'It is believe that the experience of landscape for people is the complex content in many way , which is based on the sight people looks , the body perception and the experienced aesthetic object are regarded as the landscape , yet , what the focus of the landscape perception researches has changed from biology to social culture as the foundation .', "This paper points out that the landscape is not only a space place , but also can reflect people 's ideology , moreover , landscape is even more a kind of meaning experience foe people .", "Using Saussure 's Signifier and Signified Theory and Pierce 's three theory of type to discuss the meaning of the landscape symbol , the landscape is regarded as a symbolic text , referring to the relationship between signifier and signified , emphasizing on the landscape symbols to show the meaning recognized by the audience by mean of the the specific form .", 'On this basis , the meaning representation of the landscape symbol can be divided into three type : image symbol , indexing symbol , symbolic sign , and point out the complexity of the symbol is the highest , which needs the viewer has the relevant cultural background .', 'Finally this paper states the ambiguity and openness of the landscape significance , and the relationship with the context design , aiming to provide reference and inspiration for the related designing .', 'The Formation of the Urban Environment in the West Siberian Oil and Gas Region : Problems and Challenges .', 'The article deal with the problem faced by the person in relation to the culture of creating a sustainable urban environment .', 'The urban environment is seen as space of human existence , influencing its spiritual and physical health .', 'All the expert involved in the urban environment , think about the culture of its formation , unfortunately , only from a departmental point of view .', 'Differently organized human environment inevitably affects behavior , emotional state of a man , his perception and understanding of space .', 'The cultural heritage of society fit in the space of an artificial environment created by a man , and determines the behavior of people.For the solution of problem of formation of the urban environment , it is necessary to apply a set of interrelated technical , social , environmental , aesthetic and other measure .', 'In this capacity , landscape design as a set of method has to build a sustainable urban environment to ensure harmonious living.Current trend , method , and technique of landscape design are to create sustainable environment for a person - creative , spiritual , comfortable , attractive , safe , harmonious .']

['The city and the car .', 'The social science have generally ignored the motor car and its awesome consequence for social life , especially in their analysis of the urban .', "Urban study in particular has failed to consider the overwhelming impact of the automobile in transforming the time-space 'scapes ' of the modern urban/suburban dweller .", 'Focusing on form of mobility into , across and through the city , we consider how the car reconfigures urban life , involving distinct way of dwelling , travelling and socializing in , and through , an automobilized time-space .', "We trace urban sociology 's paradoxical resistance to culture of mobility , and argue that civil society should be reconceptualized as a 'civil society of automobility ' .", 'We then explore how automobility makes instantaneous time and the negotiation of extensive space central to how social life is configured .', 'As people dwell in and socially interact through their car , they become hyphenated car-drivers : at home in movement , transcending distance to complete a series of activity within fragmented moment of time .', 'Urban social life has always entailed various mobility but the car transforms these in a distinct combination of flexibility and coercion .', 'Automobility is a complex amalgam of interlocking machine , social practice and way of dwelling which have reshaped citizenship and the public sphere via the mobilization of modern civil society .', "In the conclusion we trace a vision of an evolved automobility for the city of tomorrow in which public space might again be made 'public ' .", 'Beyond binary choice : Integrating individual and social creativity .', 'The power of the unaided individual mind is highly overrated .', 'Although society often thinks of creative individual as working in isolation , intelligence and creativity result in large part from interaction and collaboration with other individual .', 'Much human creativity is social , arising from activity that take place in a context in which interaction with other people and the artifact that embody collective knowledge are essential contributor .', "This paper examines : ( 1 ) how individual and social creativity can be integrated by mean of proper collaboration model and tool supporting distributed cognition ; ( 2 ) how the creation of shareable externalization ( `` boundary object '' ) and the adoption of evolutionary process model in the construction of meta-design environment can enhance creativity and support spontaneous design activity ( `` unselfconscious culture of design '' ) ; and ( 3 ) how a new design competence is emerging - one that requires passage from individual creative action to synergetic activity , from the reflective practitioner to reflective community and from given task to personally meaningful activity .", 'The paper offers example in the context of collaborative design and art practice , including urban planning , interactive art and open source .', "In the effort to draw a viable path `` beyond binary choice '' , the paper points out some major challenge for the next generation of socio-technical environment to further increase the integration of individual and social creativity .", 'A city for all citizen : Integrating child and youth from marginalized population into city planning .', 'Socially just , intergenerational urban space should not only accommodate child and adolescent , but engage them as participant in the planning and design of welcoming space .', "With this goal , city agency in Boulder , Colorado , the Boulder Valley School District , the Children , Youth and Environments Center at the University of Colorado , and a number of community organization have been working in partnership to integrate young people 's idea and concern into the redesign of park and civic area and the identification of issue for city planning .", "Underlying their work is a commitment to the Convention on the Rights of the Child and child 's right to active citizenship from a young age .", 'This paper describes approach used to engage with young people and method of participation , and reflects on lesson learned about how to most effectively involve youth from underrepresented population and embed diverse youth voice into the culture of city planning .', 'HCI & sustainable food culture : A design framework for engagement .', 'The current food practice around the world raises concern for food insecurity in the future .', 'Urban / suburban / and peri-urban environment are particularly problematic in their segregation from rural area where the natural food source are grown and harvested .', 'Soaring urban population growth only deteriorates the lack of understanding in and access to fresh produce for the people who live , work , and play in the city .', 'This paper explores the role of Human Computer Interaction ( HCI ) design in encouraging individual user to participate in creating sustainable food culture in urban environment .', 'The paper takes a disciplinary perspective of urban informatics and present five core constituent of the HCI design framework to encourage sustainable food culture in the city via ubiquitous technology : the perspective of transdisciplinarity ; the domain of interest of people , place , and technology ; and the perspective of design .', 'Uncovering inconspicuous place using social medium check-in and street view image .', 'There is a Chinese proverb , “ if your wine taste really good , you do not need to worry about the location of your bar ( 酒香不怕巷子深 ) ” , which implies that the popular place for local resident are sometimes hidden behind an unassuming door or on unexpected street .', 'Discovering these unassuming place ( e.g .', 'restaurant ) of a city will benefit the understanding of local culture and help to build livable neighborhood .', 'Previous work has been limited by the lack of appropriate data source and efficient tool to evaluate the popularity , ambiance and physical surroundings of place in large-scale urban area .', 'In addition , how to characterize place with respect to different group of people remains unclear .', 'In this work , we propose a data-driven approach using social medium check-in and street-level image to compare the different activity pattern of visitor and local , and uncover inconspicuous but interesting place for them in a city .', 'We use check-in record as a proxy of the popularity of a particular type of place , and differentiate visitor and local based on their travel and social medium behavior .', 'In addition , we employ street-level image to represent the physical environment of place .', 'As a result , we discovered a number of inconspicuous yet popular restaurant in Beijing .', 'These restaurant are located mostly in deep alley of Old Beijing neighborhood , where the physical environment are not particularly appealing ; however , these place are frequently visited by local for social engagement .', 'We also discovered beautiful but unpopular outdoor place in Beijing .', 'These place are potential recreational area for all group of people and could be improved regarding urban design and planning to make these public infrastructure more attractive .', 'This work demonstrates how multi-source big geo-data can be combined to build comprehensive place-based representation for different group of people .', 'Planning for sustainable urban area or everyday life and inclusion .', 'This paper discusses the extent to which the diversity and equality agenda is being taken into account at street level as planner and urban designer seek to create sustainable settlement .', 'The paper argues that many design policy inspired by the sustainability agenda do not take into account inclusive urban design consideration , and thus large sector of the population are adversely affected .', 'While attention is given to the need of the disabled , particular emphasis is put in this paper upon the design need of woman and older people who together compose around a third of the population .', 'The impact of compact layout and higher density in residential area is first discussed , along with the problem created by increased car control , without commensurate transport policy alternative , or adequate , safe pedestrian routeways .', 'Second the problem of city centre are discussed where sustainability policy is also being targeted , but other priority including the new urbanism , the 24-hour city , the evening economy and the city of culture jostle for pre-eminence .', "It is concluded that the lack of awareness of people 's need and inclusive design principle are reducing the chance of ordinary people accessing , comfortably moving around and enjoying the city .", 'In order to bridge the gap between sustainability and inclusive design in planning , it is concluded that greater emphasis must be given to user need and the constraint of everyday life .', 'Street and social life in city : a taxonomy of sociability .', 'Evident in the urban revival of North American city are planning and design strategy focused on attracting the downtown worker , the tourist , the conventioneer and the newly implanted suburbanite .', 'In this wave of revival , many group are marginalized , the reclaimed public space is often sanitized , gentrified and fortified , and not inclusive .', 'However , there are urban public space that defy or at least resist these trend .', 'Examining urban neighbourhood main street reveals that even though the contemporary urban street can never be an unregulated place of unconstrained diversity , there are street that counter the prevalent culture of consumption , and one can find visible sign of spontaneity and diversity of people and activity , and genuine social life .', 'Using research in urban sociology , a taxonomy for sociability is developed , and the existing range of classification of outdoor social activity is expanded .', 'Through empirical examination , this paper explains how these street perform as social spaces—how sociability is enacted , and what is the nature of planning , design and management , which supports social behaviour .', 'Finally , the research emphasizes the role of the street as an ordinary public space in creating affordances for everyday social contact that are crucial to personal well-being and social cohesion .', 'Information technology and civic engagement : Perspective from librarianship and planning .', 'Urban planning and librarianship are parallel field in many way .', 'Both have theoretical and practical underpinnings driving each discipline ; are interdisciplinary in focus ; and both profession gather and disseminate information to stakeholder .', 'Essential to the success of each discipline is an engaged user population .', "The author use a case study from the Village of Oak Park to examine and reflect upon the effect of the Internet and other technology in the public 's ability to participate in an open planning process .", 'The Village of Oak Park is known for its architectural heritage and outspoken community .', 'Within its 4.5 square mile live a diverse population of approximately 52,000 people from different culture , race , ethnicity , profession , lifestyle , religion , age , and income where a majority of the population have some advanced education and over 80 % of the household report home Internet use .', 'How does a community like the Village of Oak Park engage in the planning process ?', 'What role does information play in this process ?', 'Can modern Information Technologies facilitate civic engagement ?', 'These question are examined during a year-long case study conducted by the University of Illinois at Chicago ( UIC ) in cooperation with the Village of Oak Park ( VOP ) .', 'Specifically , the investigator examined how information is gathered and used in the planning process and how the introduction of Information Technology ( IT ) tools influenced public participation and introduced many citizen to e-government through the planning process .', 'The use of these tool is compared to the traditional planning process .', 'Data from the project is presented to demonstrate a different kind of role librarian play in the research process .', 'Last , the author discuss the role of privacy in the gathering and sharing of information with the reliability of that information and the impact of privacy on the public planning process .', 'Minecraft as a tool for engaging child in urban planning : A Case study in Tirol Town , Brazil .', 'The purpose of this paper is to explore the potential of Minecraft ’ s game environment for urban planning with older and younger child in a public school in Tirol town , Brazil .', 'Minecraft is employed as an innovative tool to tackle the present lack of engagement and involvement of key societal actor such as child and young people in urban planning .', 'Thus , how can game support child to co-design their future city ?', 'Which heritage value do they represent graphically in the game environment ?', 'Geogames are game that provide a visualization of a real spatial context and in this study , Minecraft is the tool which we use to explore youth engagement .', 'We designed two experiment , which tested Minecraft as a geogame environment for engaging young people in urban planning .', 'These experiment were conducted with child , who emerged as active emancipated actor to bring their value to the planning practice .', 'The playtesting result revealed the potential of Minecraft to keep child engaged in the design workshop , as well as their relevant ludic ability to co-create walkable , green , and interactive place .', 'New research question arose about the potential of creating a culture of planning among child in order to motivate other social actor to share responsibility for sustainable development and management .', 'Rethinking urban design for a changing public life .', 'Purpose – The nature and conceptualization of public space and public life have been always associated with collective participation and socialization – in other word , the capacity to live together among stranger .', 'Today these association seem to have become challenged and problematic , and often end in questioning whether public space still matter for our public life ?', 'This paper aims to bring new understanding to the reading of public life in public space and also contribute to rethinking of the role of urban design today within our changing public life .', 'Design/methodology/approach – The paper adopts participant/observation within a case/study area , “ Parque das Nações ” , in Lisbon , Portugal .', 'Finding – The paper identifies a number of spatial , social and experiential condition that are conducive to social interaction amongst stranger .', 'Often it is the combination of three factor that generates the most interaction .', 'Research limitations/implications – Participant observation is a useful method to study public behaviour in the public realm .', 'Nevertheless , as the study was conducted in one location , the finding may not be transferable to other locations/cultures , etc .', 'Practical implication – This paper demonstrates the need to rethink and adapt urban design practice to an increasing changing public life .', 'Urban design needs to be much more sensitive to all location ( planned and unplanned ) and the favourable spatial , experiential and social condition people make use of and which can provoke positive interaction need to be recognised .', 'Social implication A better understanding of the factor that are conducive to positive interaction between stranger and non/strangers in the public realm will help to develop more favourable condition for these to take place .', 'The interaction between people is part of the fabric of social life .', 'Originality/value – This is the first paper to combine social/spatial and experiential factor in the observation of social interaction in public place .', 'The right to walk in city , a comparative review of Macau , Lisbon and Las Vegas .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to analyze walking activity and recent effort at augmenting walkability condition in the city of Macau , Lisbon and Las Vegas .', 'Design/methodology/approach : The methodology consisted mostly of in-loco observation , pedestrian count and extensive review of the literature , city plan and regulation .', 'Finding : The finding include the need to properly design , maintain and retrofit pedestrian facility , while reducing safety conflict among street user as well as the establishment and the nurturing of a culture of walking .', 'Research limitations/implications : A fivefold international walkability research agenda with implication for other city around the world is established : the value and the need for comparative study and best practice ; the need for urban design intervention ; the cultivation of attractiveness and aesthetic ; the implementation of safety , construction and maintenance criterion ; and responsible funding program .', 'Practical implication : This paper has twofold implication for stakeholder with direct responsibility in the design , planning , building and maintenance of street and public space , and for those who simply use those place at their own discretion .', 'Social implication : A succinct set of recommendation include the need to augment endogeneity , the need to make city for people and not for automobile and commitment to resolving pedestrian safety concern .', 'Originality/value : This paper discusses the factor affecting street vibrancy from both a stakeholder ’ s and a user ’ s perspective .', 'The fundamental and inalienable right to walk is analyzed using the WPPFUS framework ( walking level , purpose , primacy of walking , facility , unique feature and safety concern ) .', 'From designed space to designer savvy society : The potential of idea competition in willing participation .', 'The design of public space has gained importance as city are increasingly positioned in global flow of people , capital , and idea .', 'These space speak to the culture of a place as much as to the quality of its design , but the implementation of design as an inclusive process is fraught with difficulty .', "This is particularly pertinent in discussion about better way of engaging people with urban design , where there is often a language barrier between those who specialise in spatial manipulation and the broader 'society ' that uses this space .", 'This paper gives an empirical account of how a spatial consciousness can be translated to society through an international design competition .', "The competition method of urban design relies upon promotion and 'eventfulness ' , both of which interpolate the public and contribute towards the generation of a deeper interest in the spatial imaginary of city planning .", "The creation of 'urban design consumer ' through the visual consumption of the design themselves offers an alternative way to gain public interest to the established tradition of public notice and formal public meeting .", "In this case , the competition extended the activity of urban designer beyond the mechanic of 'space production ' to include 'consumer production ' where a more intimate relationship between city planning and the people began to emerge .", 'Exposing globalization : Visual approach to researching global interconnectivity in the urban everyday .', 'This article explores how visual approach to globalization as expressed and enacted in everyday life may enrich and complement the more abstract and mainly quantitatively supported discourse around this convoluted phenomenon .', 'Visual method , with their focus on empirically observable aspect of culture , indeed have the capacity to uncover form of global interconnectivity in urban setting , by looking carefully at the material environment and artifact as cultural expression and at visual practice and performance of people within those space .', 'Observing globalization in urban public space involves a wide variety of resource , method , technique and technology , each with their specific affordances and limitation .', 'Therefore this contribution is less a detailed study about globalization than it is about how to study aspect of globalization through its visual dimension and by using visual mean and method to capture data and to communicate insight in novel way .', 'Suggesting theoretical urban neighborhood design concept by adopting the changing discourse of social capital .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to review , analyze and synthesize different piece from literature to explore , define and describe the concept of social capital and its relationship with urban neighborhood design concept .', 'Additionally , to define the indicator and principle that can enhance social capital within urban design context .', 'Moreover , to suggest theoretical urban neighborhood design concept that can adopt the changing discourse of social capital .', 'Design/methodology/approach : This research used the theoretical , analytical and descriptive approach-driven case study method .', 'In all , 29 paper were analyzed to conclude the indicator that can measure social capital within the urban neighborhood design context and to conclude the required neighborhood design feature and principle that influence social capital .', 'Additionally , two new urban neighborhood design concept , cohousing and hybrid concept that adopt new form of social interaction , were studied , analyzed and then synthesized to suggest new neighborhood design concept , which is a heterotopia concept .', 'Finding : Heterotopia neighborhood concept aims to create real , different and heterogeneous functional space with different layer of meaning for people from different culture in one place .', 'Different visible enclosure are merged into space of otherness while the diversity gives a sense of entering another alternative place .', 'The heterotopias neighborhood design principles aim to create a wide variety of form , shape and element [ different new space for different ritual activity to reflect the otherness self-reflection ( homogeneous and scattered space ) ] and create linkage , hierarchy , contrast and mingling between space and place ; well-defined functional effective space ; different fantasy and leisure space ; high standard quality of life and otherness space ; flux in social realm and fluidity of space ; mixed use and joint experience ; and innovated technology space to offer strange new temporality .', 'Research limitations/implications : This research recommended that different community stakeholder should participate in planning process , neighborhood urban design and decision-making process about public space to strengthen the community tie and achieve a heterotopia concept .', 'Architect , urban designer and planner should adopt bottom-up design approach when designing neighborhood .', 'Additionally , to avoid poor social capital research study , the new researcher , practitioner and journal reviewer approaching social capital for the first time must read widely to gain an understanding of the concept from different perspective and narrow their scope to their particular area of interest .', 'Practical implication : This research highlights the need for empirical study to examine the relationships/interrelationships between all neighborhood design principle and social capital .', 'This might increase the knowledge on how we can design and increase the quality of neighborhood to foster social capital , which might offer interesting insight into how neighborhood urban design principle are combined to foster social capital within neighborhood context .', 'Originality/value : Neighborhood-based research encourages new suggesting concept in designing every single place in the residential neighborhood in a way that can adapt the new form of social interaction .', 'This research scanned the current concept of neighborhood design that concerned successfully with the changing form of social relationship to conclude some design feature and principle for neighborhood design to ensure and promote social public health and well-being .', 'This research offers a unique perspective for better understanding the relationship between the neighborhood urban design as a spatial dimension and social capital .', 'This research aims to enrich the socio-spatial knowledge and build a resilient urban community by suggesting theoretical urban neighborhood design concept , which is the heterotopia concept , and providing the urban designer and architect with a valuable thinking tool to design space .', 'CulTech2015 : Cultural diversity and technology design .', 'With globalization and technological advance , people are increasingly coming into contact with others from different cultural background , particularly in place-based and virtual community .', "Yet , cultural diversity - the diversity of community member ' cultural background - offers both significant benefit and challenge in the design , usage and evaluation of technology .", 'In this one-day workshop , we explore the role of cultural diversity in potentially informing , supporting , challenging or impacting the design of Information and Communications Technology ( ICT ) within community contexts .', 'To delve into this complex and multi-faceted space , we welcome workshop submibions that 1 ) engage broadly with the role of culture within technology design and usage for , with and by community , as well as 2 ) proposal for approach , tool , conceptual and methodological framework , case study and best practice in community-based design that exploit cultural diversity as an abet and seek to encourage intercultural interaction .', 'Our goal is to bring together academic and practitioner from different domain such as computer science , urban design , interactive art , anthropology and social science who share a common interest in exploring the design space of ICTs , culture and community .', 'A people-based density perspective on physical/virtual world space in the microcosmic city .', 'Electronic and cyber-based method of conducting transaction have reduced the role of propinquity across a large spectrum of civic activity .', 'Simultaneously , however , technological advance affecting many realm of commerce and culture have increased the necessity and desire for face-to-face contact .', 'Ceding substantial portion of our time to the virtual realm has , curiously , enhanced the importance of local-scale , physical world interaction .', 'In this paper we focus on an elemental concept in urban development and planning : population density .', 'Given that individual life are now carried out within both physical and virtual space , we detail the advantage for land use policy of deploying density measure that are “ people-based ” rather than areal based .', 'Such metric provide a rich perspective reflecting planning-relevant geography of spatial interaction .', 'Rather than restricting density calculation to pre-specified areal unit , such as municipality , neighborhood , census tract , city block , or land parcel , we propose the deployment of “ perceived ” density surface that yield point-specific value for a set of bespoke value operationalizing critically relevant time-distance threshold .', 'We suggest embedding walking density , cycling density , and auto-travel density into the formulation and evaluation of land use decision .', 'In addition to being useful for many practical purpose , threshold-based perceived density provides an interesting conceptual framework for examining how individual experience and interact within a spectrum of surrounding , microcosmic world space .', 'Using decision support system to enable crowd identify neighborhood issue and its solution for policy maker : An online experiment at kabul municipal level .', 'Planning a city is a systematic process that includes time , space , and group of people who must communicate .', 'However , due to security problem in such war-ravaged country as Afghanistan , the traditional form of public participation in the planning process are untenable .', 'In particular , due to gathering space difficulty and culture issue in Afghanistan , woman and religious minority are restricted from joining male-dominated powerholders ’ face-to-face meeting which are nearly always held in fixed place called masjid ( religious building ) .', 'Furthermore , conducting such discussion with human facilitation biases the generation of citizen decision that stimulates an atmosphere of confrontation , causing another decision problem for urban policy-making institution .', 'Therefore , it is critical to find approach that not only securely revolutionize participative process but also provide meaningful and equal public consultation to support interaction among stakehold-ers to solve their shared problem together .', 'Toward this end , we propose a joint research program , namely , crowd-based communicative and deliberative e-planning ( CCDP ) , a blended approach , which is a mixture of using an artificial-intelligence-led technology , decision-support system called D-Agree and experimental participatory planning in Kabul , Afghanistan .', 'For the sake of real-world implementation , Nagoya Institute of Technology ( Japan ) and Kabul Municipality ( Afghanistan ) have formed a novel developed and developing world partnership by using our proposed methodology as an emerging-deliberation mechanism to reframe public participation in urban planning process .', 'In the proposed program , Kabul municipality agreed to use our methodology when Kabul city needs to make a plan with people .', 'This digital field study presents the first practical example of using online decision support system in the context of the neighborhood function of Gozars , which are Kabul ’ s social and spatial urban unit .', 'The main objective was to harness the wisdom of the crowd to innovative suggestion for helping policymakers making strategic development plan for Gozars using open call idea , and for responding to equal participation and consultation need , specifically for woman and minority .', 'This article presents valuable insight into the benefit of this combined approach as blended experience for society and city that are suffering long-term distress .', 'This initiative has influenced other local Afghan government , including the city of Kandahar and Herat as well as the country ’ s central government ’ s ministry of urban planning and land , which has officially expressed its intention to collaborate with us .', 'Modality environment : A concept for sustainability and vitality in the multi-modal city .', 'This paper reviews an idea of vital local high-street place with their walking space and economy founded in interface between neighbourhood and city ( between walking and public transport/bicycle movement infrastructure ) .', "It then extends this idea to higher scale , considering interface between city and region , which have already been theorised as 'mobility environment ' ( Bertolini & Dijst 2003 ) focusing on place and modal transfer point in new regional city of high mobility .", 'High-streets and mobility environment are both central place and our way of describing them suggests a new definition of central place as interface between normative ( but also technically-infrastructually supported ) political space ( neighbourhood , city and region ) .', 'It also clarifies the role of scale in place theory and we will deal with this in a following paper .', "Here we introduce idea of 'modality place ' and 'modality environment ' .", "The 'modality environment ' is concerned with areal and network transportation form in whole fabric and resulting condition of sustainability and urbanity .", 'Modality environment are understood in term of transportation network and the social and functional factor ( like sustainability and urbanity ) they produce .', 'Modality environment are seen as lived environment built around movement infrastructure grid that distribute everyday urban function .', 'Ideally modality environment would be simple clear grid that distribute all or close to all the function of everyday life so that a walking grid or a bicycle grid that gets adult to work , their child to school and includes shopping and recreation would be walking or bicycle modality environment .', 'They would be expected to have high level of direct visibility-legibility in the way urban element present themselves to a mobile community .', 'Modality environment would also include the central place ( like high-streets or mobility environment like station ) at which people would transfer to other modality environment .', "We will use a notion of 'movement culture ' to indicate the convergence of land us and mobile community mediated in information-rich network .", 'We are concerned first with how modality environment ( for cycling or walking for example ) may afford more sustainable lifestyle .', 'We are concerned in addition with the way they can be designed to include central place as zone of urbanity and vitality and as socially and culturally mixed centre .', 'We start not with a principle of accessibility of/from node in an extensive space but with the idea that particular social and political territory ( community and polity ) are already articulation of distinct modality environment .', 'We demonstrate using the case of the Amsterdam metropolitan area .', "Fostering a More 'Cultured ' City through Inclusion : Metric for Sense of Belonging for Migrants in Chinese Urban Areas .", 'Over the past four decade , infrastructural and economic development in Chinese city has outpaced its cultural development .', 'As the proportion of people living in city in China quintupled from 1950 to 2014 , from 11 % to 54 % according to a 2009 report by McKinsey , while at the same time various challenge have paved the way to limit cultural prosperity and quality of life in city .', 'City currently face number of problem : Vehicle-oriented street are not friendly to pedestrian ; public space are designed without user in mind [ 1 ] ; community are isolated from one another [ 2 ] ; and finally creative industry are lagging behind other industry according to a 2014 Forbes report .', "It seems that China 's urban development states a condition of `` survivability '' rather than `` livability '' .", 'What is understood from the notion of livability within a city today is to be able to sustain quality of life through holistic planning strategy rather than purely economic one .', 'Such city create robust natural environment as well as built environment , social equity as well as social stability .', 'And as a result both a more reliable creative prosperity and economic prosperity have been maintained .', 'This paper will seek to establish a 3-pillar approach to social inclusion and will examine each of these through issue related with migrant in China facing today .', 'It seems that there is a great potential in using mobile and web-based technology to generate rapid and sustainable solution for migrant .', "There is also an enormous potential to develop feedback mechanism for these solution that can become part of the 'culture ' of living in big city in China .", 'Pleasure-based design approach to the built environment .', 'As an exercise in discipline cross-fertilisation , this paper applies the emergent practice of pleasure-based approach in product design to the design of the built environment .', "This analysis provides insight into human ' emotional response to the environment that is provided for them .", "Jordan 's four pleasure model , composed of physio- , socio- , psycho- and ideo-pleasures , is used to undertake this analysis .", 'From this analytical process it is evident that physio- , socio- and psycho-pleasures are drawn from generic element that relate to human as a kind , and that these commonality are deeply rooted historical and cultural reference point .', "Understanding these reference point , and the design principles that emerge from them , will enable those who provide the built environment to engage with the 'super-usability ' imperative that these pleasure-based approach have been drawn from and , in so doing , to develop human-centric solution that engender positive relationship between people and the environment that is provided for them .", "However , in the absence of a 'market ' , one area will remain problematic - that of personalised and individually constructed ideo-pleasure .", 'Research on Urban Public Art Design Based on Digital Information Technology .', 'As the embodiment of human system , urban culture represents the historical development of human civilization .', "With the great improvement of people 's living standard , people pay more and more attention to the colorful city life [ 1 ] .", 'The intense impact of urban culture and life creates public art .', 'Expert believe that public art is the core idea of a city .', 'It is an important symbol of the maturity of the city .', 'In recent year , people began to study various form of public art .', 'With the development of digital information technology , some artist try to apply digital technology to urban public art .', 'On this basis , this paper briefly summarizes the public art and digital technology related knowledge and theory .', 'Finally , the principle of urban design based on digital technology are put forward .', 'Critical Analysis of Urban Livability
