Measures Based on the Perspective of Placemaking .', "The livability level of an urban area is a substantial measure of one 's sense of connection to their neighborhood .", "Urban livability is often measured based on various measurable aspect such as stability , healthcare , culture and environment , education , and infrastructure as stated in EIU 's Global Liveability Ranking .", "However , these indicator often neglect the nature and process by which place are made that form people 's sense of place much more than the physical availability of urban amenity .", 'Therefore , this paper aims to analyze the critical perspective and contribution that placemaking brings to the measure of urban livability .', 'This theoretical study analyzes key concept and framework from secondary data such as report and journal paper with the inductive content analysis method .', 'Through the lens of placemaking principle , the gap in many urban livability measure are identified .', 'It is proposed that urban livability measure should incorporate placemaking principle of being community-driven , local asset , bottom-up , and trans-disciplinary to enhance the human-environment quality of urban livability .', 'Governing with conversation culture–conditioning organizational interaction in a digital social movement .', 'Digital platform support form of collective action with varying degree of organizationality–that is , with organization-like attribute such as identity , actorhood , and decision-making .', 'These form include seemingly non-organized online group , which can be easily dismissed as informal chatter .', 'Building on communicative theory of organizing and Luhmann ’ s Theory of Social Systems , we explore the communicative organizationality of a Facebook group related to urban planning .', 'By analyzing private chat log of the group administrator , we explore the group ’ s organizationality and the way in which organizational and interactional communication become intertwined to produce and curate digital political discussion .', 'Our finding illustrate how technological affordances built for moderation also support the strategic organization of discussion to orchestrate political talk .', 'We conceptualize such operation as discursive conditioning of organizational interaction and suggest that political action online can be propelled not only by connecting people , but also by the powerful yet concealed tactic of conditioning public online discussion .', 'Published by Informa UK Limited , trading as Taylor & Francis Group .', "Alterlivability speculative design fiction and the urban good life in starhawk 's fifth sacred thing and city of refuge .", 'This article responds to two diverging notion of “ livability ” : the normative New Urbanist imaginary of livable city , where the urban good life manifest in neoliberal consumer culture , green gentrification , and inaccessible infrastructure , and the feminist and disability concept of livable world , such as those in which nonnormate life thrives .', 'Whereas the former ought to broaden its notion of “ lives worth living , ” the latter would benefit from a more specific theory of design-the making and remaking of more livable world .', 'In response , this article offers the concept of “ alterlivability , ” a design philosophy grounded in permaculture ethic .', 'Drawing on two novel by ecofeminist writer Starhawk-The Fifth Sacred Thing ( 1994 ) and City of Refuge ( 2016 ) -the article explores the genre of speculative design fiction for its insight into prototyping more livable future in the Anthropocene .', "Starhawk 's novel illustrate alterlivability as a set of political commitment , design methodology , and spatial form that place disabled , racialized , and poor people at the center of alterlivable world .", 'Creating great place : Evidence-based urban design for health and wellbeing .', 'This book provides a bold vision and roadmap for creating great place .', 'Imagining and designing urban environment where all people thrive is an extraordinary task , and in this compelling narrative , Cushing and Miller remind us that theory is a powerful starting point .', 'Drawing on international research , illustrated case study , personal experience , as well as fascinating example from history and pop culture , this practical book provides the reader with inspiration , guidance and tool .', 'The first section outline six critical theory for contemporary urban design - affordance , prospect-refuge , personal space , sense of place/genius loci , place attachment , and biophilic design .', "The second section , using their innovative 'theory-storming ' process , demonstrates how designer can create great place that are inclusive , sustainable , and salutogenic .", "Creating Great Places is an insightful , compelling , and evidence-based resource for reader who want to design urban environment that inspire , excite , and positively transform people 's life .", 'Knowing their place : Children , young people , and city .', 'This chapter focuses on the tradition of research in Western society for the discussion of child ’ s and young people ’ s need for social inclusion and environmental provision in city and city planning process .', 'It highlights the potential potency of urban planning and design in child ’ s and young people ’ s environmental and developmental experience .', 'The chapter considers the importance of attending to the prevalence and quality of child ’ s environment - both indoor and outdoor - as these designed environment provide the context for most child ’ s life in urban contexts .', 'The recognition of child ’ s and young people ’ s ability to contribute to urban planning and design remains the province of committed individual and one-off project rather than being continuously embedded in professional practice .', 'Modern urban life in most Western culture is pressured , time poor , fast paced , highly structured , and centered on economic performance .', 'As everyday citizen in every community , they have right to their city which need better recognition in urban planning and design .', 'A way to reconnect I Cycling Without .', 'Thinking about the development of city , demographic change and changing lifestyle are the challenge of today .', 'In order to create livable place for everybody , we need to think urban planning in a new way .', 'By making sure , that all part of a community have access to their surroundings and can participate in shaping the landscape they live in , we create an inclusive , welcoming neighborhood with a unique identity .', 'To highlight the peculiarity of a place we have to focus on tradition and culture taking into account the people using the urban landscape .', 'Currently , some group have a hard time to understand and contribute the way of nowadays planning process .', "In some place , elderly people ca n't be an active part of their environment , out of the loss of mobility .", "Being outside of a neighborhood ' community reduces their quality of life as well as the diversity of the urban landscape .", "Through the initiative 'Cycling Without Age ' they get a chance to engage to the local society - the neighborhood can reconnect to its story , its memory and the natural variety , which is necessary to create an exceptional place .", 'Preface to Part 5 .', 'The chapter in this Part of the book are concerned what are amongst the most critical challenge facing contemporary city and urban planning – how to support , understand and manage the cultural practice of urban population .', 'At stake is the creation of environment where different social group can live , work , mingle , and express their culture and value .', 'Also important is the equitable distribution of urban resource .', 'When contemplating such issue , attention frequently turns to public space because this is where the texture , complexity and diversity of urban life is most readily revealed .', 'And so it is with the chapter here , which in differing way acknowledge that the quality , use and presence of urban public space are central to the way in which people experience and relate to the city as resident or visitor , and whether encountering it in the context of work , education or leisure ( to name but three ) .', 'Public space is also linked to the development and maintenance of civic culture .', 'Park , footpath , beach , the verge of river and waterway are all important in this respect , as are road and thoroughfare – the site of intersection , movement and transportation .', 'Introduction landscape of mobility : Culture , politics , and placemaking .', "Urban planner James Rojas ' 'hands-on ' planning initiative demonstrate the power of mobility .", 'He uses transportable model and moving workshop as a way to involve citizen in the urban planning process .', 'He takes a medley of recycled material of vibrant color and varied shape , texture , and sizes to urban neighborhood , street corner and public location .', 'By setting up these interactive model in publicly accessible location , he encourages curious participant to use their hand and mind to experiment and create model of their ideal city , street , public space , or building .', 'These mobile and on site event take the planning process directly to the people .', "By giving them the opportunity to have a 'hands-on ' experience in envisioning their city , workshops help participant feel more connected to the urban landscape that surrounds them .", 'These experience set the groundwork for them to get involved in urban planning , and can help provide policy maker , urban planner , and architect with tool for information gathering .', 'The Co-creation of the city .', "Is it possible to imagine novel form of urban planning and of public policy regulating the way in which people use city space by listening to citizen ' expression , emotion , desire , and vision , as they ubiquitously emerge in real-time on social network and on other source of digital information ?", 'This chapter presents the theoretical and methodological approach , the investigation and research phase , the design and prototyping process constituting the ConnectiCity initiative , a collaborative , multidisciplinary series of project in which artist , scientist , anthropologist , engineer , communicator , architect , and institution participated to the design of innovative ubiquitous and pervasive system which were able to transform the way in which the concept of urban planning and city-wide decision-making are defined .', 'Novel form of urban life were imagined , in which city became the time/space continuum for multiple , stratified layer of information expressing the idea , goal , vision , emotion , and form of expression for multiple culture and background , producing new opportunity for citizenship : more active , aware , and engaged in the production of urban reality , and in the transformation of city space into possibilistic framework .', 'Ambient medium for the third place in urban environment .', 'As ambient computing blend into the fabric of the modern urban environment developing a positive interplay between people , place , and technology to create enlivened , interactive city becomes a necessary priority in how we imagine , understand , design , and develop city .', 'Designing technology for art , culture and gastronomic experience , that are rich in community , can provide the mean for collaborative action to ( re ) create city that are lively , engaging , and promote a sense of well being as well as belonging .']

['How art and culture happen in New York : Implication for urban economic development .', 'Problem : In the last two decade , urban economic development has shifted its focus from industrial recruitment to talent and human capital , including art and culture .', 'Many have argued that talented people are drawn to artistic and cultural amenity , but few have examined art and culture as a production system and drawn meaningful insight for urban planning and economic development based on understanding its inner working .', 'Purpose : This article looks closely at the mechanism that structure and drive the cultural economy and suggests possible avenue for cultural economic development and policymaking based on these mechanism .', 'I focus on the way cultural producer obtain job , advance their career , gain value for their good and service , and interact with each other .', 'Method : I conducted 80 interview with cultural producer , cultural gatekeeper , and owner and manager of entertainment venue these group frequent .', 'Result and conclusion : I find that not only are artistic and cultural producer densely agglomerated , but that key social mechanism structure and inform this clustered production system .', 'These industry depend on unique kind of social interaction , from nightlife to gallery opening , to thrive .', 'This is more than just fun and game , and is critical to the operation of this economic sector .', 'Takeaway for practice : Cultural producer rely heavily on their social life to advance their career , obtain job , and generate value for their good , so that the local art social milieu is critical to the cultural economy .', "Cultural producer also tend to cross-fertilize , collaborating to create good and service , review each other 's product , and establish new career , meaning the ability to live and work in close proximity to one another is important .", 'Finally , a large concentration of creative people and an active cultural milieu has made New York culture a known brand .', 'While New York is unique , the cultural life of other city and region can also be economic development asset .', 'Place can strategically cultivate the social milieus that are most conducive to the production of art and culture .', "Bohemia as subculture ; `` Bohemia '' as industry : Art , culture , and economic development .", 'Artist have long been thought of as agent of revitalization , transforming warehouse and blighted neighborhood into bohemian enclave that become destination for the well-heeled , simultaneously bringing redevelopment and reinvestment .', 'Yet , the active cultivation of art as a central part of economic development is new .', 'The increasing shift in economic development focused on attracting people not smokestack has brought art and culture center-stage .', "This article considers the art in economic development through several discrete but interrelated lens : 1 ) As an amenity or consumption product 2 ) As a redevelopment and development tool 3 ) As a way to `` brand '' place 4 ) As generator of job and revenue .", 'Finally , I consider current research that begins to unpack the social and economic process necessary to cultural production .', "This line of research may enable a better understanding of the art ' function and potential in economic development .", 'The role of urban design in cultural regeneration .', 'One of the technique that has been used as a tool for urban development in recent year is that of cultural regeneration .', 'This is seen as a means of restoring and improving the quality of urban life through the enhancement and development of the unique characteristic of a place and its people .', 'This article argues that urban design is integral to the process of cultural regeneration , as such thing as mixed-use development , environmental improvement scheme and , in particular , public art help in the expression and development of the culture of an area .', 'The article looks at how specific cultural quarter are developed in city centre area , focusing on an area of Manchester known as the Northern Quarter , and outlines the way in which urban design technique are used as part of the process of wider cultural regeneration .', 'It is suggested that , for improved chance of success , the adoption of a holistic approach to urban regeneration is required , with policy-makers using culture as an organizing principle for city management and urban design .', 'Knowledge-Based Regional Economic Development : A Synthetic Review of Knowledge Spillovers , Entrepreneurship , and Entrepreneurial Ecosystems .', 'The geographical nature of knowledge spillover and entrepreneurship has been well documented in the literature .', 'In most regional or urban study , these two topic are separately discussed .', 'This research reviews literature at the intersection of knowledge spillover , entrepreneurship , and regional economic development .', 'The key argument is that entrepreneurship can serve as a mechanism for transmitting knowledge spillover and accordingly contribute to regional innovation , cluster formation , and economic development .', 'However , the effectiveness of this mechanism depends on various factor in the regional entrepreneurial ecosystem , notably including knowledge base , absorptive capacity , competition , network of people , diversity , and culture .', 'Urban history and cultural resource in urban regeneration : a case of creative waterfront renewal .', 'In recent decade , the role of culture and history has often become a driving factor in the process of urban regeneration .', 'The focus on culture and history as factor in regional transformation has been particularly extensive in response not only to competitiveness among city but also to sustainability requirement in the cultural sector .', 'In the same perspective of this approach , culture in its broadest sense assumes a decisive role in constructing a system of intervention where employment and social and sustainable development become the product of the integration of place , people , economy and tradition .', 'Creative city are currently working on how to improve the interaction between regeneration building , economic development and social renewal in order to achieve more comprehensive development of the city .', 'Existing creative city may be seen to revolve around the design , promotion and activation of urban area established due to their particular local characteristic .', 'Such area become creative cluster as a result of economic and structural innovation , related to the realization of innovator project achieved with the help of local development strategy based on the economy of excellence , culture and territorial quality .', 'Starting from such premise , this article aims to show the main factor which condition creativity in city - such as new policy , participation , history , place identity , cultural resource and sustainability - and an emblematic case study of creative regeneration .', 'This concerns the HafenCity district in Hamburg , where the history has assumed an important role in re-constructing the maritime identity and for many choice of urban nature .', 'Singapore in transition : From technology to culture hub .', 'Purpose - This paper aims to present an approach to the knowledge-based economy that focuses on the developmental synergy between technology ( especially information and communication technology ) , culture and place ( hub ) as expressed in the innovative milieu of the inner city .', 'Design/methodology/approach - This paper draws on research in city and urban planning , which emphasizes the importance of quality of a place , location or city and the more intentional emphasis given to development of human and cultural resource , which are conducive to innovation , learning , creativity and change in a knowledge-based economy .', 'Finding - Singapore is chosen as a case study of analysis for a knowledge-based economy in transition because of its developmental approach and strategic shift from one focused on technology-intensive sector to one focused on high knowledge-intensive company and towards a free-spirited dynamic creative hub in the making .', 'It displays many characteristic typical of a knowledge-based economy in which people , their idea and capability are the key source of wealth and opportunity .', "Practical implication - The paper observes a missing link in the transition from technology to knowledge to culture hub , which might have implication for Singapore 's effort towards establishing itself as a cultural industry metropolis , a renaissance city using culture to re-position its international image as a global city for the art .", "Originality/value - The originality and value of the paper lie in this analysis , which makes one conclude that , although Singapore 's developmental model had created benefit in many way , it had also negatively constrained its development , particularly in the area of knowledge creation and application to entrepreneurship , innovation and creativity .", 'Talking about art ( s ) : A theoretical framework clarifying the association between culture and place branding .', 'The purpose of this paper is to develop a conceptual framework to describe possible key feature in the relationship between culture and place branding .', 'The inspiration to redact this paper was drawn from the inadequacy of literature and attempt to introduce the theoretical framework linking these two field by asking : how do we define culture within the context of place branding ?', 'How do decision maker distinguish whether culture should be at the forefront of a place branding strategy ?', 'On one hand , the paper points out the powerful advantage while using art ( s ) and culture-based activity to promote a place .', 'On the other hand , the paper highlights the layered dilemmas for practitioner concerning the amalgamation of such a practice on a branding campaign .', "Those question ' clarification is achieved by mean of a literature review that examines this relationship from a wide range of discipline : sociology , marketing , place branding , cultural management , urban study , etc .", "The paper 's finding can be summarized in three point : first , culture plays a critical role on a place branding campaign , as long as the authentic cultural element are produced by the resident .", 'This practice helps to avoid the mass reproduction of “ borrowed ” cultural element , i.e .', 'the investment in cultural and leisure consumption industry .', 'Second , the cultural field has already deployed practice used by local authority in urban regeneration , such as cultural planning .', 'Thus , converged objective link cultural manager to place branding expert , refining multi-dimensional policy thinking towards a more integrated image .', 'Finally , the cultural aspect is related with the pre-existing reputation of a place .', 'Further , it is connected with the mind of people , fostering the contention of common essence between culture and branding .', 'This paper intends to contribute and enhance inter-professional thinking , by approaching the cultural sector with the appropriate sensitivity .', 'The paper provides deeper understanding of culture , bordering the gap between technocrat and cultural-oriented professional by contributing to the creation of a coherent communication system for the study of place branding theory .', "The cultural dimension of a place is very spacious and further research needs to be made , approaching the subject from new perspective , such as people 's perception of the brand while using art ( s ) as a branding tool .", 'Lille 2004 and the role of culture in the regeneration of Lille métropole .', 'When considering the role culture can play in the regeneration of post-industrial city , the Lille experience can be seen as a major reference , as the success of Lille 2004 , European Capital of Culture demonstrates .', 'To better understand the reason for this success , it is necessary to set it in its historic context ; 2004 was indeed a special year for Lille and its metropolitan area , but for decade , cultural factor have played a crucial role in urban development there .', "Perhaps most interesting is the fact that cultural development was not just about promoting the city 's image and developing tourism , but also a matter of increasing local people 's self-confidence and civic pride and even of boosting the industrial conversion process .", 'Cultural concern have been present for more than thirty year in regeneration initiative , and there exists a large consensus for considering culture as a decisive part of the metropolitan development strategy .', "China 's new creative cluster : Governance , human capital and investment .", "Recognising that creativity is a major driving force in the post-industrial economy , the Chinese government has recently established a range of `` creative cluster '' - industrial park devoted to medium industry , and art district - in order to promote the development of the creative industry .", 'This book examines these new creative cluster , outlining their nature and purpose , and assessing their effectiveness .', 'Drawing on case study of a range of cluster model , and comparing them with international example , the book demonstrates that creativity , both in China and internationally , is in fact a process of fitting new idea to existing pattern , model and format .', 'It shows how large and exceptionally impressive creative cluster have been successfully established , but raises the important question of whether profit or culture is the driving force , and of whether the bringing together of independent-minded , creative people , entrepreneurial businessmen , preferential policy and foreign investment may in time lead to unintended change in social and political attitude in China , including a weakening of state bureaucratic power .', 'An important contribution to the existing literature on the subject , this book will be of great interest to scholar of urban study , cultural geography , cultural economics and Asian study .', 'Art and cultural participation at the heart of community life .', "A COMMUNITY 'S ART-its creative and cultural expression in the form of music , dance , theater , visual art , and crafts-embodies its essence and is crucial to its well-being .", 'Through making art-amateur and professional , formal and informal1-communities preserve , invent , and assert their identity ; transmit heritage ; and comment on their existence .', 'Art and cultural participation contribute to community condition in education , economic development , civic engagement , and to stewardship of place ( Jackson et al .', '2003 ; Jackson and Herranz 2002 ) .', "Based on year of research , we know that mural , altar , choir , music band , ethnic dance troupe , embroidery and quilting group , drumming circle , theater troupe , parade , and festival are all example of what people describe as cultural asset in community around the United States.These are artistic and creative outlet that are a crucial aspect of quality of life.They are valued for the intrinsic property of art and contribute to the community 's well-being .", 'They are found in a variety of place , including formal cultural presentation venue such as museum and theater , small and midsize organization where artists gather to make art and produce event , and in community cultural center .', 'But they also occur with great frequency , formally and informally , in place and through organization that are not primarily concerned with the art , such as school , church , park , community center , social service organization , social club and benevolent society , and sometimes business and commercial retail establishment .', 'Moreover , art and non-arts entity often have to work together to make cultural participation possible ( Jackson and Herranz 2002 ) .', "Although art and cultural participation at the community level are at the heart of community life , many policy maker , urban planner , and art administrator have not acknowledged the art as an essential part of a community 's core , to the detriment of community .", 'The range of opportunity for cultural participation needed for a healthy community eludes many of these player .', 'Instead , large cultural institution concerned primarily with presenting formal professional art , often with tie to the nonprofit and public sector , have dominated with their idea of what constitutes the art world and the cultural sector .', 'Activity at all artistic skill level , often in smaller art and cultural organization as well as through other public , private , and commercial art outlet , exists at the periphery of recognition , even though in reality it is at the center of real life in community .', 'In the art administration and cultural policy field , informal art practice were formally recognized as an important aspect of the cultural sector during an American Assembly meeting in 1997 focused on the art and their public purpose.2 During that meeting , the importance of ethnographic research that could capture informal , amateur , community-based , and unincorporated art , in addition to quantitative or statistical research on other aspect of the sector , was emphasized .', 'Since that time , research on this kind of informal or unincorporated activity has continued , although work is still needed to position this aspect of the cultural sector in a way that does justice to the significance of its role in society .', 'This chapter sets out to challenge the dominant model that relegates community art and culture to the sideline ; it offers an alternative set of value that has implication for how arts administrator , urban planner , and policy maker should pursue their work in planning , urban design , funding , and cultural programming .', 'With better research about community and charged with defining and engaging with the creative economy3 and the ideology of the creative city,4 they have an opportunity to reassess their assumption and approach .', 'The material presented here is based on year of research completed by the Urban Institute on the art and artist in community life.5 Research has included participant observation of arts-related activity and event in neighborhood all over the United States as well as hundred of interview and score of focus group discussion with artist , art administrator , urban planner , community development professional , policy maker , and community resident .', 'It has also included general population survey on cultural participation and attitude toward artist .', 'Urban branding and place as a quality product : innovation in the urban experience .', 'Purpose : Starting from these premise , the aim of the paper is illustrating the role of experience in urban regeneration project and to explore how the experience of high quality product luxury place can be sustainable with existent place identity or new place identity to be suitably created .', 'Design/methodology/approach : The experience of a place may become an integral part of a product experience .', 'The enhancement of product ( Splendiani , 2013 ) : assumes a meaning which goes beyond the simple sale of material good .', 'It covers the supply of complex experience … enriched by intangible element capable to stimulate and involve the sensory and experiential component of consumption .', 'It deals with attracting people to the place where local product are made by inserting the product in the most extensive offer covering the entire territorial system of reference The experience may also be used for the spectacolarisation of a place and its commercialisation , as in the case of “ brandscapes ” ( Klingman , 2007 ) .', 'In this case , it is important not to clone every place everywhere because they could inevitably resemble each other without be able to really engage the people who move into them ( Lehtovuori , 2010 ) .', 'The methodology approach is based on a wide bibliography and internet research based on the main term connected to the topic of the paper , including experience , place identity , quality product , regeneration ; on case study – even though not illustrated – concerning place of interest for the research topic , such as : Hafencity in Hamburg , the Albert Dock in Liverpool , Abondaibarra area in Bilbao .', 'Finding : The planning of place of quality product can not be separated from interpretation of the territory as a cultural system resulting from an ensemble of historical , economic and social process .', 'In such a system , the contribution of the cultural factor must be considered propulsive , not only for its qualitative meaning but also , and especially , for the role of “ trait d ’ union ” of a number of action taken to protect and enhance place .', 'Originality/value : The increasing importance of the use of experience in the urban regeneration process is leading city to be involved in constructing suitable image and symbol of their transformed area to meet the new trend , also according with luxurious one .', 'Even though globalisation is one of the main danger in innovative itinerary , the proper planning of quality architecture and public space could prevent it by creating a suitable mix between innovation and culture .', 'Art , culture and the city : An overview .', 'More people , more organization , more town , city , region and country for more reason have found that over the last 30 year the art , their broader culture and overall creativity has something in it for them in renewal and revitalization .', 'Over the last decade there have been over a hundred study of the economic and social importance or impact of the art , culture , heritage , the recycling of building for cultural purpose , creative quarter and the creative economy across the world .', 'Yet there is much more to the art , culture and creativity in city development .', 'Place in transition urgently need to develop an overall culture of creativity cutt ing across all domain within which the art can be signifi cant .', 'This can be a painful exercise as old certainty crumble and system , like education , need rethinking .', 'Yet this can unleash new social innovation , new business model and new form of citizen engagement .', 'Renewal and transformation together are a cultural project involving a shift in mindset and perspective .', 'Creativity is a primary resource as it creates the condition from which innovation can emerge .', 'Within this the creative economy sector , especially when aligned to the dramatic digitization dynamic , play a signifi cant role in developing new product and service , generating job , anchoring identity and helping expression .', 'Cultural activity and programming and the physical asset of place , their heritage and older industrial building are signifi cant element in the renewal repertoire .', 'Are creative city good place for creative people ?', 'Note on the social condition for cultural production in contemporary economy .', 'Purpose : This paper discusses the social condition for cultural production in contemporary city , in the context of a globalized economy , with rising importance of the integration of cognitive , symbolic and emotional element into tradable product and service .', 'Although the agglomeration dynamic of creative activity in urban contexts and the social or spatial inequality related to process of urban reorganization in Post-Fordist society have been analysed in the last year , the interrelation between these aspect still lack adequate investigation and empirical analysis .', 'Methodology/Approach : By synthetizing diverse theoretical contribution related to different level and interaction arising from creative activity , their transformation into tradable product ( commodification ) and some of their spatial implication in the urban context ( agglomeration , externality , identity , place branding and gentrification ) , the article emphasizes the different benefit obtained by the agent involved in this process , potentially contributing for increasing social conflict and to a process of cultural homogenization with negative implication on the uniqueness and authenticity of place .', 'Finding : Benefit arising from the externality generated by the agglomeration of cultural production and creative activity can be framed within the “ Common Pool of Resources ” approach , suggesting that a more balanced share of the benefit can be obtained by mean of participatory process for city planning and development .', 'Research Limitation/implication : The paper is based on a conceptual approach and further empirical research can be useful in order to test the formulation proposed .', 'Originality/Value of paper : This analysis leads to the identification of different question for further research , by combining quantitative analysis for the measurement of cultural and creative externality and modelling process for the distribution of benefit arising from cultural production , with qualitative analysis related to participatory process of urban planning and monitoring .', 'Art in the urban landscape .', 'This paper discusses the emerging use of public art in city as a means of positively transforming the urban environment .', 'It emphasizes the need for a symbiosis between an appropriate urban design and the natural transformation that occurs with the placement of sculpture in an urban context .', 'It comment on several example of planned artistic intervention and , in particular , analyses a recent major project of urban design in Concepcion , the third largest city in Chile .', "An environmental vision , that addresses itself to the contemporary city 's development , has also to consider that urban space should provide adequate venue for leisure and civic entertainment for the inhabitant .", 'Historically , the notion of art has been associated with the degree of culture of society and , indeed , it represents the expression and spirit of our urban community .', "Hence , together with the macro-planning goal of development , there exists a chance to restore people 's sense of belonging and pride of place , providing adequate space related to artistic manifestation that can contribute to the overall quality of life in neighbourhood and inner city area .", "The conclusion suggest that these type of artistic expression can be a key factor , but only by integration , that is a combination of an appropriate scale of intervention through urban design , rather than 'parachuting ' the art into different place .", 'Smart Creative Cities and Urban Regeneration Policy : Culture , Innovation , and Economy at Nexus .', 'Learning from Lyon Metropolis .', 'In 1995 , the English planner Charles Landry and Franco Bianchini published “ The Creative City ” , focusing on three intertwined topic : the cultural , social , and economic impact that arises from creativity in city ; the need to promote integrated urban planning levering on knowledge from other discipline ; and the active inclusion in urban planning process of ordinary , often marginalized people .', 'A few year later , Landry issue “ The Creative City .', 'A Toolkit for Urban Innovation ” , a book in which he challenges and further develops his idea by proposing them as a “ toolbox for urban renaissance.', '” At the beginning of the twenty-first century , the American economist Richard Florida delivers what is considered a milestone on the subject of the creative city : “ The Rise of the Creative Class ” , in which he emphasizes the characteristic of people performing creative activity in city , as well as the condition that city must offer in order for the “ creative class ” to be attracted and settle in them .', 'The Smart Creative City is a more recent concept .', 'It grew out of economic science , especially the so-called Experience Economy .', 'Regarding specifically the economic development of city , creativity , art , and culture represent strategic asset in the urban regeneration process , and the socioeconomic feature of smart creative city can be considered the most evident and critical one .', 'This study thus spring from the recognition of the relevance of smart creative city , and of an integrated and visionary planning approach to urban regeneration—itself creative .', 'This analysis has been conducted focusing on selected experience developed by Lyon metropolis , aiming at understanding whether and how the municipality is levering on creativity , art and culture within its urban regeneration programme .', 'This objective is addressed through a mixed-qualitative methodology that investigates the political discourse and adopts a descriptive case study approach to analyse policy process , driver , and obstacle that are fostering or limiting that vision in the local context of Lyon .', 'The research responds to the question posed , showing both the transformative capacity and the trade-off of explicitly integrating cultural and artistic project and event , as urban “ innovative ” regeneration device , within the “ common ” planning and design practice of the municipality of Lyon .', 'Cultural planning and sustainable development .', 'A decade or more has elapsed since the notion of cultural planning was distinguished from the more functional planning for art and culture within amenity , heritage , land use and economic resource planning system .', 'The ‘ cultural turn ’ in town and spatial planning which emerged from the 1970s and 1980s has taken longer to establish itself than say in geography ( Barnes 2001 , Crang 1997 ) , political economy ( Soja 1999 ) and sociology ( Chaney 1994 ) .', 'Planning as a hybrid practice has adopted culture - at least partially - to better inform more sustainable approach to scarce land use and amenity need and to respond to diversity and planning culture .', 'On the other hand it has also rediscovered culture in order to address aspiration and vision of city planning itself as a ‘ work of art ’ ( Boyer 1988 , Munro 1967 , Talen and Ellis 2004 ) .', 'Different approach and rationale for cultural planning have therefore emerged , rather than a single grand theory or conceptual model ( see also Bianchini , Chapter 22 , this volume ) .', 'This is in part due to the epistemological and definitional difference evident in these approach towards ‘ culture ’ and ‘ planning ’ and their combination , and in part to cultural politics that views the very idea of planning for culture as inherently instrumental in maintaining cultural and growth hegemony - both market and state-led .', 'Kunzmann ’ s aspiration ( above ) towards creativity in planning also conflates the practice of town planner withcomplex notion of city culture , environment and identity .', 'The notion of the creative city has also extended the cultural planning sphere to the creative industry ( ‘ economy ’ ) and issue of place-making , design quality and sustainability .', 'Place-making - like New Urbanism ( CEU 2004 ) - whilst usefully focusing on the street , urban design , mixed-use , local accessibility , ‘ sense of place ’ and so on , can also be seen as a rejection or failure of planning in term of the wider scale and the whole , distributed population ( Evans 2010 ) .', 'Everywhere is a ‘ place ’ , not just the valorized space which tend to feature in place-making agenda and guidance ( APA 2011 , Markusen and Gadwa 2010 ) , and which are preoccupied with town centre and regeneration site ( physical , economy ) at the expense of the everyday , residential area and cultural activity ( people ) .', 'Creative placemaking .', 'Creative placemaking is a new way of engaging creative people and activity to address social and economic issue in community .', "Together , creative placemaking 's livability and economic development outcome have the potential to radically change the future of American town and city .", 'Instead of a single art center or a cluster of large art and cultural institution , contemporary creative placemaking envisions a more decentralized portfolio of space acting as creative crucible .', 'Liverpool : Capital of culture .', 'Liverpool has been the center of investment in promoting business growth .', 'Launched in 1985 , the European City of Culture project is designed to supply to bringing the people of Europe together .', "The Liverpool 's status as European Capital of Culture ( ECOC ) is offering a good chance to observe a range of significant contemporary development in urban geography , providing a series of activity , while emphasizing shared cultural heritage and vitality of art ."]

['Defining Suburbs .', 'There is no consensus as to what exactly constitutes a suburb .', 'This article examines the range of suburban definition in term of their structure and the topical issue that they grapple with .', 'Suburb have been defined according to many different dimension from location and transportation mode to culture and physical appearance .', 'Given this confusion , one approach is to abandon the term ; another is to use it with greater precision .', 'This is more than just an issue of semantics .', 'Rather how people talk and think about suburb shape how they can see such area being developed and redeveloped in the future .', "Urban survey and planning in twentieth-century Japan : Wajiro Kon 's `` Modernology '' and its descendant .", "Since the nineteenth century , the survey of people 's way of life were the basic method to study big city .", 'Even though the survey were motivated by social awareness , the result was mainly analyzed by scientific , political and economical interest , and often was devided from the cultural and psychological research of urban phenomenon .', 'However , as it is obvious that these are closely integrated , the method and idea of the urban survey reflect the bilateral relationship between perceiving and conceiving urban space .', 'This study will explain how urban survey transformed and reflected the idea and interest in urban space and its study in Japan from the end of the nineteenth century to the 1980s .', "Especially in examining a research named `` Modernology '' by a Japanese architect Wajiro Kon from 1925 to 1930 , and the work of later Japanese architect inspiered by `` Modernology '' after 1960s , this study will explain how they tried to create urban study with cultural identity by conducting survey and integrating with international theory .", "`` Modernology '' described the emerging urban space and people 's way of life in Tokyo , and was often recognized as a method of popular culture .", 'However , Modernology represented critical aspect of social space and encouraged people to be more engaged with it .', 'While modernist architect distanced from urban reality to solve its problem scientifically , Modernology was often recognized as their counter part .', 'When we recognize its primal objective and influence on later generation in seeking the social ethos in the dialectical progress with the bilateral approach between surveying and planning , we can understand the alternative aspect of Japanese urban study .', '‘ Mentally , we ’ re rather country people ’ –planssplaining the quest for urbanity in Helsinki , Finland .', 'This paper explores the concept of urbanity in a specific context , namely Helsinki , Finland .', 'In a European context , Finland urbanized late .', 'This lies at the heart of the common interpretation that Finland lacks an urban culture and urban lifestyle .', 'Today , however , with the new comprehensive Urban Plan , city planner in Helsinki emphasize a paradigm shift towards urbanity .', 'This paper seeks to understand this changing emphasis in planning by exploring how planner frame and understand urbanity .', 'The paper concludes that within the Nordic welfare context more emphasis is needed to rethink whom urbanity serf and how it resonates with the prevention of segregation that the city also aims at .', "'This place has potential ' : Trash , culture , and urban regeneration in Tallinn , Estonia .", 'The article analyses the use of cultural programme and trash as tool for urban speculation in Tallinn , Estonia , naturalising an urban strategy that entails extensive spatial revaluation and socioeconomic intervention .', 'Through an anthropological perspective focused on concept of potential and trash , the analysis shows how the central-north shoreline was mobilised discursively as a wasteland and a zone of unrealised potential to justify capitalist development of the area .', 'The way it was framed , both moving towards completion and as a playground for cultural activity and young people , increased the value and accessibility of the area , but also allowed real estate developer to exploit the synergy generated and make profit from the revaluated plot .', 'Trope of potential and trash appear thus as discursive tool for urban regeneration , co-related with a formal allocation of resource and official permit .', "As the case study show , when an area is classed as having 'potential ' , it becomes defined by the fulfilment of that restrictive conceptualisation , which allows the economy to dictate urban planning and also cultural policy .", 'Migration , translation , and transformation of western urban planning model .', 'People , idea , lifestyle , culture , architecture and urban planning model have invariably traversed the world as a consequence of military compulsion , political goal , commercial motivation , or aspirational value .', 'Western model in particular have spread widely , first through colonization and , recently , as a consequence of globalization .', 'It is well-known that many city around the world have been impacted by western urban planning model but , curiously no comprehensive comparative study of these influence has so far been attempted .', 'This essay stems from 5 year of teaching and research in the field of urban history and presents a series of example from non-western context such as India , China , Africa , South America , and elsewhere to showcase the direct or indirect impact of several western urban planning model .', 'The aim is to analyse how differently these model , such as the English garden city , Le Corbusier ’ s plan voisin concept , and Haussmann ’ s plan for Paris have been adopted by a number of non-western city and the degree to which they have been transformed by local contexts .', 'Indeed , frequently , the original concept of the exported model has been completely modified .', 'The essay also identifies those western urban model which have spread most widely .', 'There are , indeed , a series of western model which have proved more popular than others and it is worth attempting to understand why they have proved to be so .']

['Study on building plan for enhancing the social health of public apartment .', "Mass-produced in a short period of time , Korea 's public apartment contributed to easing the housing anxiety of the common people .", 'Nonetheless , they also gave rise to problem of social exclusion and conflict , becoming undesirable facility that weakened social health .', 'This study examined way of producing an improved building plan that can raise the level of social health of public apartment , which were consistently built in the past but will no doubt continue to be developed in the future .', 'For this study , the survey method was employed through a questionnaire with visual content especially developed to raise the level of social health based on two idea .', 'One was to increase the possibility of social interaction among resident , and the other was to increase opportunity for resident to interact with society as well as for their social integration .', 'The result showed that resident had mostly favorable view on the proposed plan : in particular , they favored highly the formation of a lobby in each apartment building as a venue for social interaction .', 'They also responded very favorably to the plan of creating within the building spare space that will be used not only to promote a communal culture , but to open to outside society as well for integration .', 'This study showed vital idea to ensure the recovery of the residential function of promoting social health in the public apartment of Korea .', 'It has significance in inspiring an innovative approach to allow social mixture in a relatively different feasible manner from the conventional approach .', 'Visual pollution : Advertising , signage and environmental quality .', 'In recent year , there has been considerable interest in the problem that public space face because of the design of commercial sign .', "The negative consequence that commercial sign can have on the visual quality of urban area and further more , on people 's quality of life , has been studied from both architectural , planning and psychological perspective .", 'While the issue of visual pollution , as this phenomenon is commonly described , has been widely debated , there is as yet no clear conclusion as to how best to control commercial signage and whether different urban contexts and people from different background and culture have universal or distinct preference .', 'Several different commenrcial signage approach are currently applied to different historic city , but these initiative are 'Man-environment relationship of public square case study in dutch square melaka .', 'The square is one of the major constituent element of open public space in urban design .', 'It is seen as the core of a city which function as a focal point in the public space network , providing a space for the community social interaction .', 'However , many of the new public space in the 20th century has been a void setting and unsuccessful to create a public open space for social interaction that is vibrant with life .', 'The notion of square was adopted from the European culture as far back as 17th century and has been adapted in Malaysia .', 'This could be seen in today ’ s square design in Malaysia .', 'However , the behaviour pattern indicate otherwise as the present day square design does not respond to the local climatic context with lack of shaded area .', 'Hence , people tend to avoid social interaction in public square during daytime due to undesirable weather condition .', 'Therefore , the aim of this study is to determine the positive aspect of traditional square that has been successful in supporting the community social interaction , and establishing a general guide for the design of new square as a public open space in Malaysian context .', 'Amongst the consideration to be derived from this adaption is the Malaysian local context in term of historical significance , culture and climate .', 'Dutch Square in Melaka Historical Town was chosen as the case study , because it represents a model of traditional square as a public open space that still functions in term of attracting people to this day .', 'A combination of quantitative and qualitative approach were used in this study .', 'Behavioral mapping allowed for statistical analysis where as observation and still photography as the descriptive to support the outcome of behavioural mapping .', 'Therefore , the data collected are more reliable and able to be cross checked for further examination of the finding .', 'Finding showed that the relationship of the urban context and social behaviour are associative with one another .', 'The square plays an important role to provide a setting in the built environment and the behaviour pattern and activity to determine the success of the square as an open public space .', 'The aim is to provide an appropriate public open space in the built environment that is robust and meaningful to the community .', 'Selected Problems of Implementation of Standards for Unified System of Tactile Indicators .', 'The Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities is intended to allow independent functioning and full access to all realm of life to all people with disability .', 'The Convention imposes an obligation on the state to ensure that all person with disability have access to physical environment , mean of transport , information and communication , including ICT technology and system , as well as other tool and service , commonly accessible or assured , both in the city and in the countryside , on equal basis .', 'Having this in mind , together with the voice of the person with blindness or having greatly reduced vision , and taking into account the chaos in the marking in public space that were supposed to improve the way the person with disability move , it is necessary to design and implement the adequate standard on the road and in the street .', 'It is estimated that about 5 % of the total country population in Poland are person with disability .', 'About 1.8 million of them are people affected by blindness , partial blindness or low vision , who at the same time are active participant of the public space and of the road traffic .', 'However , the lack of any systemic solution regulated by law that improve safety in the road traffic is a serious problem in enabling access to culture , as well as free and safe movement for person with poor vision .', 'The article presents the design failure , executive error and an impact of the usage of the unified warning system that is obligatory countrywide for the safety of person with disability in public space .', 'Change in the contemporary public space : Library .', 'Contemporary library is no longer silent study hall filled with book and limited , small work-spaces , complemented by huge , closed storage room for almost inaccessible book .', 'It is more of a welcoming public space , dedicated to culture and opened for all user .', 'Designer create interesting form , bringing people together and at the same time symbolizing knowledge and wisdom .', 'The workspace are ergonomic and provide people with sufficient space and friendly environment , allowing spending a whole day in the interior .', 'This article was devoted to present finding on change that have occurred in the contemporary public space of library , aiming at architecture humanization .', 'The study were carried out on example , i.e .', ': “ Harold Washington Library Center ” in Chicago ( USA ) , TU Delft Library ( Nederland ) , Library of Faculty of Architecture of TU Delft ( Nederland ) , Wroclaw Municipal Library “ Grafit ” ( Poland ) , Library of Faculty of Architecture WrUST ( Poland ) , “ Muntpunt ” library and information centre Brussels ( Belgium ) , etc .', 'Formulation of design criterion based on recognition and comparison of user pattern of behavior , emphasizing on the role of climate in urban public space , case study : Shahr-E-Kord and Bushehr .', 'Introduction : Climate has always been one the main factor of designing urban space in Iran since past century .', 'By analyzing urban space it can be concluded that different city have different urban space due to climate difference .', 'One of the main reason of the difference in the type and orientation of urban space is the climate as one of the key factor in designing these area .', 'Regarding climate in designing is equivalent to involving the user of the space , basically because climate adjustment can encourage more people to use the designed space .', 'Hence , it can be said that climatic space are humanistic space as well .', 'Therefore , climate directly influence culture and plays a decisive role both in the body and behavior of the user .', 'Thus , it could have a very effective role in how people use or how they behave in designed space .', 'Material and method : A mix of several method has been used for more compatibility with research purpose .', 'This used library document and has a comparative-analytical method .', 'The basic data and the research background information have been gathered through documentative method and from library resource .', 'For the fieldwork , the descriptive method ( describing the phenomenon ) has been used .', 'Then , people pattern of behavior were studied by an interpretative-qualitative method in each climate to analyze and infer the discussion in order .', 'And at last , a comparative method has been used to analyze the result in order to set out urban design criterion .', 'In this comparative method , it was tried to compare people pattern of behavior in two cold-mountainous , and hot and humid climate , and to analyze its result to elicit criterion for urban space design considering the effect of climate on the user behavior .', 'In this research , the people behavior were studied , analyzed and compared in two different season of the year ( the hottest and the coldest season ) by the use of serial photography .', 'Thus , people different pattern of behavior in different climate and the way they use the space were investigated , by the observation a set of design criterion could be developed to be applied in the design/redesign of urban space to improve their quality .', '( Figure Presented ) The theory In general , people us of urban space may have two stage : 1 .', 'Presence in urban space .', '2 .', 'Tendency to continue to stay in the urban space .', 'There are two kind of quality in urban environment .', 'First , the quality which are the main requirement of people presence in public space , i.e .', 'primary quality .', 'Second , the quality encouraging people to stay in the space for a longer time .', 'Meanwhile , there are some quality like climatic comfort which play effective role in both primary and secondary quality .', 'This very important factor is in full adaptation with human physical characteristic and is the main requirement of people presence in the space .', 'It also plays an undeniable role in the way people use the space and behave there .', 'Climatic comfort can increase the number of opportunity to use the space .', 'If the space is designed with consideration of all aspect , including the user behavior , it can be used by all people in various period of time during the day , and in different season .', 'Result and discussion : Design guideline in hot and humid climate are formulated .', 'They emphasize on the role of climate to determine people pattern of behavior .', 'Here , regarding the achievement of local observation and the recognition , the design criterion are proposed at two different scale , the city scale and the site scale .', 'A ) The city scale : Location of the space in the shade : This is the most important factor affecting the use of space in hot and humid climate .', 'If the open space includes shaded part , people preference to stay there will increase .', 'Therefore , location in the shade can be considered as an important requirement for people use of space in this climate .', 'Other factor is natural ventilation and the space orientation parallel to the wind flows : This is the second factor affecting the use of public space in hot and humid climate .', 'Natural ventilation of open space happens by the airflow coming from the sea .', 'It helps the local reduce the high unpleasant humidity in this climate , so it encourages passersby to stop and stay in the space .', 'B ) The site scale : • To avoid designing vast urban open space in hot and humid climate .', '• Making orientation of the open space toward the sea to moderate the hot weather and reduce the humidity by the sea airflows .', 'Local observation also verify that successful space in this climate have perpendicular orientation to the sea to benefit from its cool airflow for natural ventilation .', 'Formulating design guideline in cold and mountainous climate emphasizes the role of climate to determine people pattern of behavior : Local observation in Shahr-E-Kord show that the two fallowing factor have determined the role of people use of space in cold and mountainous climate .', '1-Maximizing the direct sunshine : It is a positive point for the open space in the cold winter weather of mountainous climate , because it helps the space to be more welcoming and favorable for people .', '2-Not to be windward : This factor also has direct effect on how people attend and behave in the space .', "The researcher 's observation and note in cold and mountainous climate show that the space which are exposed to direct wind flow are not favorable for people .", 'A ) The city scale : • For designing open space and its proposed land uses , it is better to locate attractive us at the southern and east-southern side of the space , because it helps to provide favorable sunlight for the space during cold winter day and facilitates the use of space for people .', '• In the cold and mountainous climate , it is better to design urban space in form of small square because it reduces the entrance of wind flow and provides people with climatic comfort .', 'It must be mentioned that vast square in this climate can benefit from the increased direct sunlight and heat .', 'But the effect of the increased airflow in these space is highly unfavorable and disturbs the climatic comfort .', 'Thus , they are not recommended .', 'B ) The site scale : • It is better to design crowded space as semi-open space , because enclosed and covered space are more favorable in all season for their shelter from the sun , wind , rain and snow .', '• In cold climate , it is important to use type of plant which prevent space from undesired wind , while not casting shade during cold season , since tree can provide favorable shade for summer time .', 'Conclusion : The result and finding of this research are presented in a set of operational and applicable recommendation , some of which might seem unimportant .', 'But they are undeniably essential .', 'Simple solution for ordinary problem of existing urban space can lead to significant improvement in the space vitality and people social life .', "William White expresses the extract of his long term study in one sentence : `` people seat where the seating exists . ''", 'This sentence might seem clear and typical , but it is very important and can notably change the life of a city .', 'Thus , the simplicity of change does not mean that they are inconsiderable .', 'It might be possible to change the destination of a space simply by adding shelter and awning or providing sunny space in cold and mountainous climate and shaded space in hot and humid one .', public space within a city centre .', "People 's perception and behavior pattern in Amman 's public park and plazas .", 'This study aims to research the behavioral pattern in the various area public .', 'Conversely , this research aims to identity the behavior and need of the user by introducing the hypothesis that the behavioral pattern in any designed space relies on the designer personal ['Evaluating the behaviour of different thermal index by investigating various outdoor urban environment in the hot dry city of Damascus , Syria .', 'Consideration of urban microclimate and thermal comfort is an absolute neccessity in urban development , and a set of guideline for every type of climate must be elaborated .', 'However , to develop guideline , thermal comfort ranges need to be defined .', 'The aim of this study was to evaluate the behaviour of different thermal index by investigating different thermal environment in Damascus during summer and winter .', 'A second aim was to define the lower and upper limit of the thermal comfort range for some of these index .', 'The study was based on comprehensive micrometeorological measurement combined with questionnaire .', 'It was found that the thermal condition of different outdoor environment vary considerably .', 'In general , Old Damascus , with its deep canyon , is more comfortable in summer than modern Damascus where there is a lack of shade .', 'Conversely , residential area and park in modern Damascus are more comfortable in winter due to more solar access .', 'The neutral temperature of both the physiologically equivalent temperature ( PET ) and the outdoor standard effective temperature ( OUT_SET * ) were found to be lower in summer than in winter .', 'At 80 % acceptability , the study defined the lower comfort limit in winter to 21.0 °c and the upper limit in summer to 31.3 °c for PET .', 'For OUT_SET * , the corresponding lower and upper limit were 27.6 °c and 31.3 °C respectively .', 'OUT_SET * showed a better correlation with the thermal sensation vote than PET .', "The study also highlighted the influence of culture and tradition on people 's clothing as well as the influence of air conditioning on physical adaptation .", 'Assessing the sustainability of Spanish city considering environmental and socio-economic indicator .', 'The conception of urban metabolism has considered the perspective of environmental sustainability in the framework of city .', 'In this context , city can be regarded complex entity driven by material and energy flow that entail consumption of resource and production of waste material in the pursuit of economic welfare and social progress .', 'According to a sustainability perspective , environmental , social and economic indicator must also be integrated into urban planning process .', 'However , methodological advance regarding the definition and development of sustainable city are required since a consensus of indicator , weighting and data management is still lacking .', 'In this paper , a multi-criteria approach that combine three methodology : Material Flow Analysis ( MFA ) , Life Cycle Assessment ( LCA ) and Data Envelopment Analysis ( DEA ) has been developed and applied to a sample of 26 representative Spanish city with different characteristic ( i.e.', ', population , location , demands , economy , topography and culture ) .', 'The combined approach allows identifying the non-sustainable city considering an offset of indicator from the three pillar of sustainability .', 'With this purpose , the mentioned item are implemented in a DEA model of efficiency , being the inefficient city with an efficiency score lower than 100 % defined as non-sustainable one .', 'Finally , this multi-criteria method allows setting the target value for the assessed indicator ( benchmarked value ) , which become objective for the non-sustainable city to evolve toward a more sustainable performance .', 'The outcome from the analysis have identified six city that ranked worse , with efficiency score ranging from 57.9 % to 85.8 % .', 'According to the target of socio-economic indicator , attention should be paid to AROPE rate ( people at risk of poverty and social exclusion ) , unemployment rate and number of crime , meanwhile lower level of electricity consumption , municipal solid waste and on-site greenhouse gas emission are desirable from an environmental perspective .', 'These outcome are of potential interest for politician , government and inhabitant to aid in the identification of the metabolic flow .', 'Applying social norm to high-fidelity pedestrian and traffic simulation .', 'Smart city are founded on complex interaction among architectural and urban design , sensor , actuator and crowds of city in order to verify the impact of public policy and this study the importance of public engagement in governance : identify talent retention strategy and analyze the socio-economic development .', in Indian prospective .', 'The world is facing problem in their urban life which could be resolved by moving the city towards smarter urban space using modern technology .', 'A city that uses living are categorized as Smart city .', 'India aims to develop its city into a smart city but due to its different economic and diverse culture the implementation of its Smart city Mission ( SCM )
