transformation to smart city .', 'The method of livable environmental evaluation based on remote sensing technology .', 'Livable environment is one of the hot topic within the realm of the international research in urban science , and it recently becomes the focus of global government and city resident .', 'The evaluative content of a livable city came out more earlier in developed country , and got rapid development.Presently , the developed country have set up one and another representative of livable city , while China is still in the process of urbanization and industrialization.When we are cheering the tremendous success during the reformation , we should also realize the harm as a result of those achievement to environment.So , a livable city has become the development target by more and more cities.When evaluating a livable city , we should make sure the evaluation index system.Presently ?', 'relevant research of theory about the evaluation index from home and aboard are based on economic , society , environment , landscape , culture , safety and so on .', 'Those data are gathered either statistic or through questionnaire and investigate .', 'While livable city is a complex system with biological integrality , just one or two outstanding index can not show that the residential environment is on a high level.Therefore , the paper sets up the evaluative framework and method of a livable city focusing on remote sensing data .', "Then discusses how to gather and choose information with RS and GIS technique , confirm the definition , quantify all the index to make them meaningful and comparative.And when we are choosing their index , we should take account of the way of how to get these data , the method of handling and quantifying those information.The index system based on multi-scale remote sensing information includes content as follows : traffic density and convenience , distribution and volume ratio of urban building , analysis on the landscape pattern of urban green-space and ecological construction , spatial configuration of urban city , urban heat effect , monitoring and evaluation of wetland area , assessment of ecological environment and security , vegetation fraction estimation , distribution of infrastructure , land use and land cover , terrain and physiognomy , geological disaster-prone area analysis , water conservation district , urban open area and so an.And the paper integrates these information with that of non-remote sensing , such as people 's identify with the residential environment , amenity of nature environment , convenience of public establishment , satisfaction of human relation and so on.After analyzing , quantifying and evaluating those data , the paper then brings forward a comprehensive index system.Moreover , the paper presents the comprehensive evaluation model aiming to assess the residential environment of Chongqing city .", 'The model includes a large amount of factors-factors on remote sensing and other assistant factor coming from statistic data.When building the model , we should take the consistency and standardization process between different remote sensing data , and between remote sensing data with non-remote sensing data into account , also the independence , representative and importance of these factors.Therefore , we should analyze and evaluate all the factor to make sure the remarkable one , eliminate redundancy information , and make certain the power of the factor which are used in the model.Thus , the paper sets up the comprehensive evaluation model , and does research and evaluation on the residential environment .', 'At last the paper puts forward the measure about how to improve human settlement , and give suggestion for the urban planning , reformation and development for a livable city .']

['The transnational capitalist class and contemporary architecture in globalizing city .', 'The focus of this article is on the role of the transnational capitalist class ( TCC ) in and around architecture in the production and marketing of iconic building and space , in global or world city .', 'The TCC is conceptualized in term of four fraction : ( 1 ) Those who own and/or and control the major transnational corporation and their local affiliate ( corporate fraction ) .', 'In architecture these are the major architectural , architecture-engineering and architecture-developer-real estate firm .', 'In comparison with the major global consumer good , energy and financial corporation the revenue of the biggest firm in the architecture industry are quite small .', 'However , their importance for the built environment and their cultural importance , especially in city , far outweighs their relative lack of financial and corporate muscle .', '( 2 ) Globalizing politician and bureaucrat ( state fraction ) .', 'These are the politician and bureaucrat at all level of administrative power and responsibility who actually decide what gets built where , and how change to the built environment are regulated .', '( 3 ) Globalizing professional ( technical fraction ) .', 'The member of this fraction range from the leading technician centrally involved in the structural feature of new building to those responsible for the education of student and the public in architecture .', '( 4 ) Merchant and medium ( consumerist fraction ) .', 'These are the people who are responsible for the marketing of architecture in all its manifestation .', '( There is obviously some overlap between the membership of these fraction . )', '.', 'My conclusion is that many global and aspiring global city have looked to iconic architecture as a prime strategy of urban intervention , often in the context of rehabilitation of depressed area .', 'The attempt to identify the agent most responsible for this transformation , namely the TCC , and to explain how they operate , suggests that deliberately iconic architecture is becoming a global phenomenon , specifically a central urban manifestation of the culture-ideology of consumerism .', 'Space , culture and urban design in late modernism and after .', 'Among the question underlying recent debate about the architecture of the city , two are perhaps more fundamental .', 'The first concerns the legitimacy of architectural practice : can we be assertive about how we should design our city without seeking to enforce social assumption which are ultimately authoritarian ?', 'The second concern architectural theory itself : can we be specific about what architecture does without being reductive about what society is ?', 'This article identifies and criticizes two kind of recent response to these question : the first is to defend an architecture of localism and containment in some new and some old way ; the second is to retreat into relativism , sometimes supported by the assertion that architecture is of limited consequence because society is increasingly independent of space .', 'The article defends the view that we can and must be assertive about the architecture of city in global rather than local term .', 'The experience of genuinely urban environment is about meeting , though not necessarily interacting with , other people , mostly unknown , who can be of recognizably different class , status , race or ethnic origin ; it is also about exploring the strange , and becoming aware of , though not necessarily participating in , other way of life .', '-from Author', 'City and design .', 'City , initially a product of the manufacturing era , have been thoroughly remade in the image of consumer society .', 'Competitive spending among affluent household has intensified the importance of style and design at every scale and design profession have grown in size and importance , reflecting distinctive geography and locating disproportionately in city most intimately connected with global system of key business service .', "Meanwhile , many observer still believe good design can make positive contribution to people 's life .", 'ities and Design explores the complex relationship between design and urban environment .', 'It traces the intellectual root of urban design , presents a critical appraisal of the imprint and effectiveness of design profession in shaping urban environment , examines the role of design in the material culture of contemporary city , and explores the complex linkage among designer , producer and distributor in contemporary city , for example : fashion and graphic design in New York ; architecture , fashion and publishing in London ; furniture , industrial design , interior design and fashion in Milan ; haute couture in Paris and so on .', "This book offers a distinctive social science perspective on the economic and cultural context of design in contemporary city , presenting city themselves as setting for design , design service and the 'affect ' associated with design .", 'Urban infrastructure as materialized consensus .', 'Abstract : Infrastructure that shape and facilitates daily life , such as pathway , conduit and boundary wall , constitutes one of the most dynamic form of architecture in both ancient and modern city .', 'Although infrastructure is conceived and designed with particular goal and capacity , its temporal and spatial scale means that it is a constant work in progress that engages numerous agent : civic authority design and implement infrastructure ; designated agency maintain and repair infrastructure ; and ordinary people utilize , modify , ignore or destroy it .', 'Infrastructure can be thus analyzed as a materialization of ongoing communication , in which there are often conflicts among different constituent to achieve consensus .', 'The linguistic concept of expert language and turn-taking are utilized to assess three brief case study : historical New Orleans ; a multipurpose micro-park in Vienna , Austria ; and the archaeological city of Sisupalgarh , India .', 'Introduction modern architecture and the middle east : The burden of representation .', 'The essay in this volume investigate the contribution that local Middle Eastern context make to discourses in international modernism .', 'The essayist define modernization not only as the extension of industrialized building process and urban infrastructure , but also as the spread of ideal of progress and standard of comfort-which is to say , modernization is the ideology as well as the built framework for the administration of industrial society .', 'Architecture can help consolidate identity by providing both a degree of social cohesion and iconic form that can become a source of pride for community .', 'Yet , for others , such architectural form can become stereotype that flatten culture into amere sign.Throughout these essay , one discerns an abiding concern for question of representation , for how building and monuments-or in some case , the lack of them- acquiremeaning , harden conviction , and set the spatial infrastructure for subsequent generation .', 'The Middle East , with its diverse social , religious , and national history , has often been seen by architect and academic as rich in traditional architecture but poor as a resource for understanding the Modern period .', 'European have idealized the Middle East as an almost timeless place , a region that stands in distinct and didactic contrast with the disruptive displacement and disillusionment that has resulted from its own industrialization.1 These essay describe the unique way by which Middle Eastern country have invented their own version of modernism , sometimes aligned and sometimes at odds with more familiar European version , and in varying relation with larger pattern of imperialism and colonialism .', 'When individual designer and decision maker crossed national border to build or to learn , to provide aid or extract resource , as architect , teacher , or tourist , the dichotomy of modern-traditional orWestern-Eastern did not truly hold .', 'Our goal here is to build into the study of transnational architectural exchange the widest consideration of constituency and the most extended opportunity for input.contributors examine awide range of cultural encounter in term of institutionalization of relationship , dynamic interaction of bureaucratic structure , and pattern of patronage amid debate over design and urban planning .', 'Even local history aremultiple , often disputed in their formation , and inevitably shifting over time .', 'Taken together , they illustrate the various strategy that set national policy and decidewho is housed and who goes wanting , who is remembered and who is forgotten , and who is empowered to remake the built landscape .', 'Several essay profile the individual who helped realize certain specificallyMiddle Eastern form of modernity .', 'Some of them , such as European art historian and expatriate architect and archeologist , positioned themselves as the arbiter of Western knowledge , while others were seen as importingWestern ideal and technology to theMiddle East .', 'In other case , institution , such as government or development agency , assumed these role .', 'In many instance , however , cultural authority was as much a matter of dynamic transition in political or architectural sympathy as it was the result of official credential .', 'These essay call attention to circuit of intention and response , which inflamed allegedly objective depiction of technological progress into heated debate regarding the nature of modernity itself .', 'Modernism and the Middle East contextualizes the challenge facing building effort today by placing themwithin a larger historical trajectory stretching from colonialism and the rise of nation-states to the present postcolonial search for local identity.By detailing howarchitecture has been integral to complex political ambition and economic program , the contributor make evident the historical role played by competing vision of the built environment , as form of representation and as ameans of directing capital and labor flow .', 'With such attention to its deep tradition and rapidmodernization , the Middle East emerges as a rich setting for the study of modern architecture .', 'Modernism and the Middle East begins at the cusp of the twentieth century amid the decline of colonialism and the rise of independent nation-states in region once ruled by theottomans ( r. 1290-1924 ) in present-day Turkey and North Africa , and the Qajars ( r. 1779-1924 ) in Iran ( see fig .', "I.1 ) .2 Under the dynastic leadership of the Sultan , overseer of the holy site of Mecca andMedina and the supreme ruler of the Sunni Islamic world , the relatively stable and unified Ottoman Empire had administeredmuch of today 's Middle East .", 'But this administrative unity and geographic cohesion was eroded greatly during the nineteenth century , and it dissolved completely in the twentieth.3 Beyond the actual loss of land , Ottoman rule was disrupted by major infrastructure development , most notably the Suez Canal ( 1854-69 ) , which brought French and , later , English capital and technology to Egypt.4 By the twilight of World War I , in 1918 , Istanbul had itself come under Allied control , and the six-hundred-year-oldOttoman Empire came to an end , its former land divided into area administered by the French ( Syria and Lebanon ) and the British ( Iraq and Palestine ) .5 Even as newnations emerged with at least nominal sovereignty from the Mandate period , the idea of a coherent , if not exactly cohesive , Middle East was reinforced .', 'The Mandates carved new political entity , such as Palestine and Iraq , out of former Ottoman administrative zone , but it kept these nation from being fully independent , and left them wanting in term of industrial development .', 'At the same time , European occupation sparked nationalist movement in neighboring Turkey and Iran , resulting in the overthrow of puppet monarchy and the rise of charismatic military leader , who threwoff century of imperial rule and modernized in the name of national progress .', 'The advent of Mustafa Kemal in Turkey ( 1919 ) and Riza Khan in Iran ( 1921 ) brought new mode of judicial and educational reform ( often based on European model ) , in an effort to forge homogeneous , if fictive , native identities.6 The characterization of entire people by their position along the trajectory of history and modernization was asmuch embraced by regional leader as it was imposed by European power and ideology .', 'Oil came to be written into this idea of a cohesive Middle East as much by its discovery there as by the increasing industrial thirst for source of fuel .', 'The image of Arab state unified by ocean of oil lying unseen beneath their soil emerged in the nineteenth centurywith the advent of a British-controlled Anglo-Persian oil company .', 'It was extended as new field were discovered , such as those in Iraq in the 1930s and those in Kuwait and Saudi Arabia by 1945 .', "With the institution of the American 's Marshall Plan ( 1948-52 ) , the European economy was reconfigured according to American precept , resulting in an emphasis on continued growth in productivity and an even greater dependence on oil .", 'The Middle East thus moved to the center of foreign-policy strategy for a number of Western nation , becoming also a site of contentious ideological positioning between the Soviet Union and the United States , with both nation acting out their political difference through technical aid and development project as well as cultural export .', 'Although some small Persian Gulf monarchy enjoyed considerable advantage over their oil-poor neighbor , towesterners the regionmaintained its conceptual integrity as a site of superpower struggle and vast economic opportunity.7 The creation of the state of Israel , on May 14 , 1948 , also helped consolidate an idea of the Middle East , albeit in a way unanticipated by mostWestern politician .', "Although Jewish immigration to the area in the first half of the twentieth century had profoundly accected the economic and demographic character of Mandate Palestine , the United Nations ' 1947 plan to partition the area into Jewish and Arab state , whichwas rejected by the Arab League , formed in 1945 , seemed only to reassert Western colonialism at the very moment it was breaking apart elsewhere .", 'Within this context , theMiddle Eastmust be historically situated as a place defined both by European colonial interest and by the specific imperial configuration that had existed in the region .', "Just as the specter of essentialism hovers over the term `` Middle East , '' one may argue that it also haunts the idea of a homogeneous `` Europe '' ; nonetheless , as Dipesh Chakrabarty has argued in another context , these term highlight , rather than obfuscate , the problematic of domination and intellectual dependency that permeates any discussion of these two entities.8 The interdependency of Europe and the Middle East can be seen in the unfolding of an `` Oriental '' supplement to European identity : what was understood by nineteenth-century policymakers as the `` Eastern question '' had to do less with the inhabitant of these region than with the raw currency of human labor and material wealth promised through imperialism .", 'Virtual study abroad and exchange studio .', 'The digital design studio has an area of application where conventional medium are incapable of being used ; collaboration in learning , design and dialogue with people in place other than where one lives .', 'This distinctive opportunity has lead the author to explore a form of design brief and virtual design studio ( VDS ) format not well addressed in the literature .', "Instead of sharing the same design brief , student in this alternative format design a project in the other student ' city and do not collaborate on the same design .", 'Collaboration with other student takes the form of teaching each other about the city and culture served by the design .', 'The author discovered these studio produce a focus on site context that serves our pedagogical objective - a blend of architectural , landscape architectural and urban design knowledge .', 'Their student use a range of commercial CAD and computer supported collaborative work ( CSCW ) software common to that used in many VDS experiment reported on in the literature .', 'However , this conventional use of technology is contrasted with a second distinctive characteristic of these studio , the use of custom software tool specifically designed to support synchronous and asynchronous three-dimensional model exchange and linked attribute knowledge .', 'The paper analyzes some of the virtual design studio ( VDS ) work between the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology , the University of Toronto , and the University of Melbourne .', 'The author articulate a framework of VDS dimension that structures their teaching and research .', 'Julius Caesar in Western Culture .', 'This book explores the significance of Julius Caesar to different period , society and people from the 50s BC through to the twenty-first century .', '• This interdisciplinary volume explores the significance of Julius Caesar to different period , society and people .', '• Ranges over the field of religious , military , and political history , archaeology , architecture and urban planning , the visual art , and literary , film , theatre and cultural study .', '• Examines representation of Caesar in Italy , France , Germany , Britain , and the United States in particular .', "• Object of analysis range from Caesar 's own commentary on the Gallic war , through Shakespeare 's Julius Caesar , and image of Caesar in Italian fascist popular culture , to contemporary cinema and current debate about American empire .", '• Edited by a leading expert on the reception of ancient Rome .', '• Includes original contribution by international expert on Caesar and his reception .', 'Planned to be reclaimed : Public design strategy for spontaneous practice of spatial appropriation .', "Several contemporary study on public space focus on its loss , in relation to an increase in people 's disengagement from these type of space .", "Since the 1960s , a considerable part of urban culture has attempted to develop strategy for people to re-appropriate public space and to 'inhabit the city again . '", 'This has defined a line of research that , although now consolidated , is still little known in its complexity .', 'In the effort to create a unified framework for the different attempt through which architecture has historically responded to the rise of spontaneous form of urban creativity , this paper outlines a short history of design strategy aimed at enabling and encouraging different form of spatial appropriation .', 'It also highlights a gradual shift from prescriptive and repeatable rule to site-specific approach , prompting a new disciplinary convergence between urban planning and design , interior architecture , industrial design and public art .', 'Structural beauty : A structure-based computational approach to quantifying the beauty of an image .', 'To say that beauty is in the eye of the beholder means that beauty is largely subjective so varies from person to person .', 'While the subjectivity view is commonly held , there is also an objectivity view that seeks to measure beauty or aesthetic in some quantitative manner .', 'Christopher Alexander has long discovered that beauty or coherence highly correlates to the number of subsymmetries or substructure and demonstrated that there is a shared notion of beauty—structural beauty—among people and even different people , regardless of their faith , culture , and ethnicity .', 'This notion of structural beauty arises directly out of living structure or wholeness , a physical and mathematical structure that underlies all space and matter .', 'Based on the concept of living structure , this paper develops an approach for computing the structural beauty or life of an image ( L ) based on the number of automatically derived substructure ( S ) and their inherent hierarchy ( H ) .', 'To verify this approach , we conducted a series of case study applied to eight pair of image including Leonardo da Vinci ’ s Mona Lisa and Jackson Pollock ’ s Blue Poles .', 'We discovered among others that Blue Poles is more structurally beautiful than the Mona Lisa , and traditional building are in general more structurally beautiful than their modernist counterpart .', 'This finding implies that goodness of thing or image is largely a matter of fact rather than an opinion or personal preference as conventionally conceived .', 'The research on structural beauty has deep implication on many discipline , where beauty or aesthetic is a major concern such as image understanding and computer vision , architecture and urban design , humanity and art , neurophysiology , and psychology .', 'Exploring City and Country of the World .', 'Volume 3 .', 'This edited volume consists of six chapter that describe the culture , lifestyle , and perspective of people living all over the world , as well as the design of urban space , historical city center , and tourist destination .', 'Chapter One offers an ethnography of the social attitude , small-scale economy , political construct and technological adaption of hillside family in southeastern Haiti .', 'Chapter Two analyzes the way in which senior museum administrator in Italy respond to falling attendance from a branding perspective .', 'Chapter Three presents the challenge encountered while developing design strategy for historical city center and construction project over two case study .', 'Chapter Four discusses narration as a design methodology as well as a means of representation and present example of proposed urban design project for five different city .', 'Chapter Five describes how the people in Costa Rica perceive edible flower , if and how they consume them , how they buy them and how much they are acquainted with possible health risk associated with their consumption .', 'Finally , Chapter Six focuses on the need to change governance strategy of tourist destination due to globalization and technological development and proposes a methodological framework to responsibly manage stakeholder involved in tourism destination .', 'Visitor Voice in Historic Sites Interpretation Centres in Bahrain .', 'Throughout the past decade , a number of site interpretation centre , such as site museum , visitor centre , site exhibit , have grown in Bahrain , a country that is seeking international recognition through culture .', 'This specific typology of museum intends to explain the nearby historical site through the use of multiple interpretation strategy .', "Understanding the visitor ' expectation is an important component in the success of cultural institution .", 'Exploring the component of a visitor experience and expectation within site interpretation centres has , so far , received limited attention .', "Hence , this research intends to analyse the visitor ' experience and expectation in a specific site interpretation centre in Bahrain : Qalat al Bahrain Site Museum .", "The visitor 's experience and expectation were assessed through two stream of feedback .", "First , an analysis of the comment recorded on the visitor ' book .", "These comment addressed the visitor ' reflection , expectation , experience , and the type of activity undertaken within the premise .", "Second , the online TripAdvisor from 169 valid return , 200 TripAdvisor comment and an overview of the visitor ' written comment , different type of emotional and spiritual experience expectation were extracted for further analysis ...", "In parallel , this research analysed visitor ' behaviour through observation inclusive of different timing during the day and during the year to understand the impact of climatic condition on the visitor ' experience and expectation for validation purpose .", 'Finally , some related scholarship discussion and suggestion were proposed based on visitor voice and reflection underlining the reason why people choose to visit site interpretation centre with reference to personal and social demand .', 'Une ville des jardins : The consiglio d ’ ornato and the urban transformation of nice ( 1832-1860 ) .', 'This article examines the urban transformation of Nice in the early nineteenth century .', 'It does so using the paper of the Consiglio d ’ Ornato ( 1832-1860 ) , an urban planning committee charged with overseeing the development of the city at a time of demographic and economic growth brought about by tourism .', 'This article argues that the Consiglio cooperated with private speculator to create a city rooted in a series of myths—Orientalist , Greco-Roman , and early Christian—that both shaped and were shaped by the expectation of world-wearied tourist .', 'Nice was turned into a commodity whose purpose was to provide tourist with a feeling of fleeing a modern world characterized by instability and inauthenticity .', 'Paradoxically , as a direct result , Nice became one of the earliest city to experience a modern form of consumer capitalism in which people , place , culture , and nature itself were packaged and peddled to the leisured class .', "In the context of globalization , calligraphy 's function in constructing `` poetic dwelling '' urban environment .", 'With the accelerated urbanization process , the spiritual life of human being faced unprecedented difficulty .', 'The high density of population , rapid pace of urban living environment , the emergence of a whole moral decline and belief in the doldrums , mind impetuous and so on .', "In fact , if we can do `` coexistence of human and nature '' , `` poetic dwelling '' , the contradiction between urban development can be solved .", "As a `` core '' of our traditional culture , the art of calligraphy is undoubtedly a good medicine to ease modern urban people 's mental issue , like feeling impulsive , mental fatigue and fragile psychology .", "Calligraphy art plays an important role in the process of constructing `` poetic dwelling '' urban environment , it can help city dweller to create a simple short calm , timeless and elegant and refined mood long , a quiet indifferent way of life ."]

['Development and implementation of Mobility-as-a-Service – A qualitative study of barrier and enabling factor .', 'Mobility-as-a-Service ( MaaS ) has been argued as part of the solution to prevalent transport problem .', 'However , progress from pilot to large-scale implementation has hitherto been slow .', 'The aim of the research reported in this paper was to empirically and in-depth investigate how , and to what extent , different factor affect the development and implementation of MaaS .', 'A framework was developed , with a basis in institutional theory and the postulation that formal as well informal factor on different analytical level ( macro , meso and micro ) must be considered .', 'The research was organised as a multiple case study in Finland and Sweden and a qualitative approach was chosen for data collection and analysis .', 'A number of factor with a claimed impact on the development and implementation of MaaS was revealed .', 'At the macro level , these factor included legislation concerning transport , innovation and public administration , and the presence ( or not ) of a shared vision for MaaS .', 'At the meso level , ( the lack of ) appropriate business model , culture of collaboration , and assumed role and responsibility within the MaaS ecosystem were identified as significant factor .', "At the micro level , people 's attitude and habit were recognised as important factor to be considered .", 'However , how the ‘ S ’ in MaaS fit ( or not ) the transport need of the individual/household appears to play a more important role in adoption or rejection of MaaS than what has often been acknowledged in previous paper on MaaS .', 'The finding presented in this paper provide several implication for public and private sector actor .', 'Law-making authority can facilitate MaaS development by adjusting relevant regulation and policy such as transport-related subsidy , taxation policy and the definition of public transport .', 'Regional and local authority could additionally contribute to creating conducive condition for MaaS by , for example , planning urban design and transport infrastructure to support service-based travelling .', 'Moreover , private actor have key role to play in future MaaS development , as both public and private transport service are needed if MaaS is to become a viable alternative to privately owned car .', 'Thus , the advance of MaaS business model that benefit all involved actor is vital for the prosperity of the emerging MaaS ecosystem .', 'Improving traffic behaviour and safety through urban design .', 'Recent experiment in mainland Europe and more recently the UK have found that removing the traditional separation between traffic and people in urban area can make street safer and less congested .', 'Removing standard kerb , barrier , highway sign and road marking force motorist to use eye contact with other road user and pedestrian , for which they need to be travelling at less than around 30 km/h .', 'As this paper report , the result is slower , more careful traffic , increased safety for cyclist and pedestrian and a more attractive urban environment overall-in which local architecture and culture prevails over standard traffic infrastructure .', 'Urban planning in Qatar : strategy and vision for the development of transit village in Doha .', 'Doha , the capital city of the State of Qatar , has went through a fast growth in its economy and transformation of its built environment .', 'Currently , major urban public transit system are under construction .', 'This paper looks at Souq Waqif station and its surrounding neighbourhood as one of the new transit hubs of Qatar .', 'The district is located in the core of Doha and plays a significant role in the social , economic and particularly culture , as a way of life , of the people in Qatar .', 'Within the context of Doha , there is an urge to implement transit village , also defined as transit-oriented development ( TODs ) , in most of the existing centre along the rail network .', 'A TOD is a mixed use commercial and residential area designed to maximise access to public transport and to encourage transit ridership .', 'Therefore , it is critical to understand the benefit and impact that TODs would invite in this context before investing large fund in developing them .', 'The research empirically investigates the level at which transit village can be implemented and also formed within the built environment of Doha .', 'It is argued that this strategy and vision would encourage sustainable development by supporting better transport integration and land use .', 'The aim is to assess and promote sustainable development integration in the city of Doha through controlling increasing traffic and planning for transit village .', 'In order to develop a strategy for intervention , the existing TOD case study of Yeerongpilly in Australia was analysed , followed by the exploration of the condition of the existing Souq Waqif area .', 'The assessment of the Souq Waqif allowed judgment of the existing development to be made , which in turn lead to the draft of potential recommendation and suggestion for the formation and implementation of transit village in Doha .', 'An introduction to sustainable transportation : Policy , planning and implementation : Second edition .', 'City around the globe struggle to create better and more equitable access to important destination and service , all the while reducing the energy consumption and environmental impact of mobility .', 'An Introduction to Sustainable Transportation illustrates a new planning paradigm for sustainable transportation through case study from around the world with hundred of valuable resource and reference , color photo , graphic and table .', 'The second edition build and expands upon the highly acclaimed first edition , with new chapter on urban design and urban , regional and intercity public transportation , as well as expanded chapter on automobile dependence and equity issue ; automobile city and the car culture ; the history of sustainable and unsustainable transportation ; the interrelatedness of technology , infrastructure energy and functionality ; and public policy and public participation and exemplary place , people and program around the globe .', 'Among the many valuable addition are discussion of autonomous vehicle ( AVs ) , electric vehicle ( EVs ) , airport city , urban fabric , urban heat island effect and mobility as a service ( MaaS ) .', 'New case study show global exemplar of sustainable transportation , including several from Asia , a case study of participative and deliberative public involvement , as well as one describing life in the Vauban ecologically planned community of Freiburg , Germany .', 'Student in affiliated sustainability discipline , planner , policymakers and concerned citizen will find many provides practical technique to innovate and transform transportation .', 'Investigating learning and diffusion strategy for sustainable mobility .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to examine the concept of learning and diffusion within the context of urban development and sustainable active mobility .', 'A model is proposed , which treats learning as a diffusion process in a dynamic way , so that key strategy and their effect are investigated over time .', 'Specifically , the question being examined is how learning and information technology strategy can change the mindset of people to be more physically active in their mobility around a city .', 'This is carried out by developing a system dynamic ( SD ) computer simulation model , where learning strategy that promote walking can be tested prior to implementation .', 'Design/methodology/approach : Based on the specific key stage of knowledge , persuasion , decision , implementation and confirmation , the proposed SD model incorporates individual citizen and group level learning and diffusion process in a unified integrated approach .', 'The SD model gives a clear picture on how learning and changing mindset occur in the context of a city , whereby we can explore the main driver to learn new sustainability related habit .', 'A case study is used to contextualize and demostrate the active mobility issue , in order to develop practical scenario for promoting a walking mindset .', 'This is done in order to demonstrate the capability of the model and show its practicality .', 'Through the model we investigate the relationship among variable such as awareness , contact , communication and adoption and evaluate their impact on city policy to promote a walking mindset .', 'Finding : The developed SD model exhibit important dimension , such as social learning , motivation to change behaviour and an analysis of the effect of plausible strategy for promoting sustainable active mobility .', 'The author have proven that through simulation experimentation , we can significantly accelerate the shaping and diffusion of a walking mindset , by influencing individual and community learning via the introduction of Information and Communication Technology in conjunction with an awareness campaign strategy .', 'Research limitations/implications : The diagrammatic representation and the quantification of the factor that contribute to active mobility give rise to better understanding of how policy maker could promote a walking culture in a city .', 'The implication are that the proposed SD model could be used by city planning authority as a framework for shaping mindset towards active and sustainable mobility .', 'Originality/value : This paper contributes to the further understanding of learning , diffusion of new idea and strategic planning within the city context .', 'Through the proposed SD model , a number of strategy are formulated and tested using scenario planning , sensitivity analysis and optimization , in order to develop a walking mindset and an urban culture of sustainability .', 'Where do you live and what do you drive : Built-environmental and spatial effect on vehicle type choice and vehicle use .', 'The carbon footprint of daily travel for an individual household is based on the type of vehicle that the household owns , their fuel efficiency , and the number of mile traveled ( Federal Highway Administration , 2009 ) .', 'Therefore , the type and usage of vehicle a household owns are informational to overall sustainable planning .', 'This study develops a multinomial logit model for vehicle type choice and a spatial autoregressive ( SAR ) model for vehicle use for Ohio household using the most recent Household Travel Survey ( HTS ) collected in the Cincinnati metropolitan area .', 'The developed vehicle choice model identifies the effect of the built environment characteristic on vehicle type based on vehicle size , controlling for socio-economic attribute .', 'People residing in neighborhood characterized with higher density in population , employment , and intersection and with fewer single detached housing are more likely to own smaller vehicle as compared to the one living in suburban area .', 'A good transit accessibility would decrease the probability of owning pickup truck .', 'The SAR model reveals how the vehicle a household owns is used is still slightly positively associated with his/her neighbour ’ s vehicle use after controlling for the effect of the built environment and socio-economics .', 'The model will enable decision maker to estimate potential change in vehicle fleet composition under changing built environment scenario and neighborhood culture in using private vehicle .', 'Although the model result and estimated coefficient may be different for different urban area , the methodology is transferable to other community , locally and nationally .', 'Transit-oriented-development ( TOD ) suitable for China .', 'Transit-oriented development ( TOD ) combines transit infrastructure with urban land utilization in way that optimize the long-term benefit of urban mass transit ( UMT ) .', 'TOD has been successfully implemented in the USA , Europe , Singapore , Hong Kong and many other place ; however , its practice in China is so uncommon that few people understand it well .', 'Although it is worthwhile to study the foreign TOD model , Chinese city can not simply copy these example because of how its politics , economic condition , and regional culture differ from the country where TOD has previously been used .', 'Chinese city should analyze the successful TOD case to determine how the various aspect of TOD apply to condition existing in China and ultimately develop TOD design and procedure appropriate for China .', 'Eco-mobility Approach for a Sustainable Neighbourhood Road Infrastructure within a Mixed-use Community : The Searchlight on Festac Town , Amuwo Odofin , Lagos .', 'In major city in Nigeria , the current mode of transportation are generally chaotic and unsustainable .', 'We therefore have to rethink how to adopt the seamless integration of sustainable transportation alternative .', 'Poor maintenance is one of the factor adduced to be responsible for the current deteriorated state of mobility corridor and the existing road infrastructure .', 'Overpopulation and increasing socio-economic activity of Festac Town exerts undue pressure on the infrastructure , thereby accelerating deterioration .', 'The study is underpinned by Eco-mobility principle .', 'This study is aimed at assessing the eco-mobility approach for a sustainable neighbourhood road infrastructure within a mixed-use community .', 'Developing a sustainable mobility strategy that brings the neighborhood streets back to the people is an objective which this study pursue .', 'A multi-staged sampling technique was adopted for the study .', 'On-site qualitative approach was majorly employed through the interview conducted assessing the major mobility corridor and street from 1st to 7th avenue .', 'A sample frame of 15 major road with outdoor open space along the selected road all within the selected avenue and major street road .', 'The instrument for data collection were oral interview and personal/physical observation .', 'The activity profile , locational data and geospatial coordinate of each avenue were imported into ArcGIS ( Version 10.5 , ESRI ) for various land-use analysis .', "The sustainable eco-mobility strategy will reduce transportation impact , create civilized street that meets environmental design standard of commuter 's safety and comfort that are compatible with the unique urban structure and culture of metropolitan Lagos .", 'This study evaluated the issue relating to sustainable eco-mobility , the connection between climate change and transportation system , the impact of urban mobility on public health and wellbeing .', 'It further outlined policy framework to be considered in other to have a sustainable neighbourhood street mobility network within a mixed-use community .', 'Impact of rail technology in 21st Century U.S. Cities .', 'This presentation analyzes the impact of transit technology on the urban environment and evaluates land use , station design , and transit cost as a means of projecting the best option for intermodal station and transit-oriented development .', 'Several commuter rail , AMTRAK , and freight rail corridor may be used in the future to accommodate heavy , light and/or high-speed rail system in the United States .', 'Diesel/electric locomotive , which populate urban rail corridor , have heavy load requirement and are industrial and/or utilitarian in appearance .', 'However , diesel multiple unit ( DMUs ) with lighter weight , increased fuel efficiency , ease of accessibility , additional capacity , enhanced performance and lower cost are competing for their market share .', 'Currently , monorail , people mover , and streetcars - along with the traditional light and heavy rail system - have public acceptance to enrich the urban environment surrounding the existing corridor , and enhance commuter experience .', 'Many city , however , are at a crossroad regarding transitioning from an automobile culture to a rail culture .', 'Therefore , local city willingly embrace opportunity for better environment .', 'Inter-organisational co-operation in improving access to activity centre by public transport .', 'The accessibility to city centre and large attraction park increasingly becomes an issue of concern for location owner .', 'They seek possibility to offer transport service as an alternative to car use .', 'In doing so , co-operation with public transport company is important .', 'These company do not yet have the culture and opportunity to develop tailor-made service .', 'Institutional change yielding more market incentive and good information sharing should help to bridge the gap between these party .', "In particular a shared view on the service level to be offered , based on investigation of visitor ' preference , should be the starting point for inter-organisational co-operation ."]

['Historical and contemporary cultural ecosystem service value in the rapidly urbanizing city state of Singapore .', 'Cultural ecosystem service are a function of people and place , so may change as a location transition from rural to urban .', 'Singapore has undergone rapid urbanization after its independence in 1965 , with a concomitant decline in natural habitat extent and accessibility .', 'Using coastal mangrove forest as a case study habitat , changing cultural value were explored with a novel array of technique , including qualitative archival analysis ( photographs , oral history ) , current source ( publically uploaded social medium photographs ) , and survey of ( a ) the general public and ( b ) visitor to publically accessible mangrove .', 'Cultural value changed through time , with a significant transition from intrinsic , intrapersonal value ( spiritual , cultural heritage ) to instrumental , interpersonal value ( recreation , education ) .', 'Additionally , cultural value varied between different mangrove depending on their public accessibility , and the evolving degree of human interaction with the ecosystem as urban development occured .', 'Cultural value change as development transition , though mangrove still play an important cultural role in a heavily urbanized environment .', "Reading landscape meaning : State construction and lived experience in Singapore 's Chinatown .", "The term 'landscape '' embodies multiple level of meaning : it articulates the ideological intent of the powerful who plan or shape the landscape in particular way and at the same time reflects the everyday meaning implicit in the daily routine of ordinary people associated with the landscape .", "Through an analysis of four theme constituting the landscape of Singapore 's Chinatown , we unpack two different but interdependent version of landscape reality : the construction of social meaning from the state 's perspective and those derived from the lived experience of Chinatown 's inhabitant .", "In our first theme , we explore the multiplicity of meaning invested in Chinatown 's housing landscape .", 'For the state , urban renewal and public housing scheme in Chinatown represent the redrawing of landscape along modernist line informed by efficiency and rationality of land use , in tandem with the larger goal of nation-building .', 'Among resident , however , the vision of modern living in everyday life was only a reality for a few ; others experience the landscape in more contradictory way .', 'Second , in the landscape of community building , we show that state-initiated effort at inculcating a sense of community have replaced the old spontaneous , interpersonal tie and the strength of organised vernacular association .', 'Inadvertently , these state strategy have in some way actually been damaging and deleterious to community tie .', 'In our third theme , we show how the state has , to a large extent , successfully rewritten the socially and physically polluted landscape of Chinatown .', "Yet , there are example of resistance where the state 's vision of an unpolluted landscape has been punctured .", "Since the mid-1980s , a fourth imperative has emerged in the state 's management of the Chinatown landscape in the form of attempt to conserve the landscape as a `` historic district '' , a repository of the nation 's tradition , history and culture .", "We show that there are different interpretation of the state 's effort to revitalise Chinese culture in the conserved landscape and its attempt to cast Chinatown in the role of a `` common bond place '' for all Singaporeans .", "Singapore 's Chinatown is thus a multicoded landscape inscribed with a multiplicity of meaning .", 'It is neither used entirely as an ideological tool for manipulative end nor does it fully embody the authenticity of daily experience .', 'Reclaiming the city : Waterfront development in Singapore .', "In its quest to be a world city , many of Singapore 's urban space have been subjected to constant redevelopment .", 'Derelict waterfront and ageing neighbourhood have been given new life , enjoying their reincarnation as landscape of economy and leisure .', "A prevalent theme in Singapore 's transformation has been the reclamation of landscape to cater to new user , activity and agenda .", 'Adopting a case study of the Singapore River waterfront , this paper analyses three form of urban reclamation .', 'They include reclaiming functionality , aimed at infusing the waterfront with new land uses ; reclaiming access , as a way of opening up the landscape to more people ; and reclaiming the local , as a way to commemorate local culture and history .', 'While government planner and private enterprise are intent on developing a world-class environment , Singaporeans and visitor respond to this urban vision in different way with some praising the dynamism of worldly transformation and others criticising them as a prelude to a soulless city .', 'While some degree of worldliness is essential in any redevelopment , a fine balance has to be sought between the excess of global urbanism and the parochialism of vernacular concern .', 'On the waterfront : Globalization and urbanization in singapore .', "Although many city aspire to `` global-city status , '' few have been as explicit as Singapore in its quest to create urban landscape to project its global aspiration .", "This paper presents the case of the Singapore River development zone as a `` hyper-symbol '' of Singapore 's global urbanism .", "By creating a world-class riverfront not unlike the acclaimed waterfront of London , Sydney , or San Francisco , Singapore 's urban planner hope to project the city as a venue worthy of world-class tourism and leisure activity , an important node in international circuit of capital , and a vibrant city for both foreign visitor and local resident .", "Our paper , however , also argues that local force and influence play a significant role in the waterfront 's development .", 'The Singapore River landscape is the negotiated outcome of both globalism and localism—a dialectical landscape formed by dominant global influence on the one hand , and emerging local process on the other .', 'Fieldwork comprising a questionnaire survey , in-depth interview , and on-site observation provide evidence of such global-local interaction .', 'The paper contends that the challenge at the river are symptomatic of the broader Singapore experience as the city-state grapple with issue of national identity , local empowerment , and community right in the midst of a global convergence of tourist , capital , people , and culture .', 'Key concept in event management .', 'In recent year we have seen an enormous growth of festival and event activity and the literature within the field is consequently huge .', 'In order to make sense of this rapid and dynamic development , student are dependent on a book that can lead them through the myriad of theoretical framework offered.This book naturally situates itself in the middle of this need , offering a comprehensive and illuminating account of the festival and event field .', 'Written with academic rigour yet accessible at the same time , Quinn proves herself to be an outstanding communicator and stimulator of knowledge.International in content and timely in its up to date coverage of key topic , this will be an invaluable reference source for student from Event Management , Tourism and Leisure study .', 'It will also be of great use for Quinn has a PhD in Human Geography from University College Dublin .", 'She currently lectures and research in the Department of Tourism at the Dublin Institute of Technology .', 'The nature and meaning of festival and festivity in contemporary society is one of her key research interest and her work on the topic has been published in a number of international journal including Urban Studies , Social and Cultural Geography , Tourism Geographies , Event Management and the Journal of Policy Research in Tourism , Leisure and Event .', 'Other research interest include the relationship between culture and tourism , leisure and social inclusion and contemporary form of tourism mobility .', 'Publication on these topic have appeared in the Annals of Tourism Research , Gender , Place and Culture and Leisure Studies as well as in various edited book collection .', 'Her teaching interest mirror her research interest and she is involved in undergraduate and postgraduate tourism management and event management programme teaching module related to cultural tourism , international festival environment , tourism study , and tourism and event policy.AcknowledgementsMy long-standing interest in festival and event has been shaped by many people , both practitioner and academic , over the year .', 'These people are too many to mention by name , but I owe all of them a debt of gratitude .', 'While writing this book I was very fortunate to be able to draw on the expertise of colleague , particularly Lucy Horan and Ruth Craggs , as well as the support and encouragement of my other colleague at the Dublin Institute of Technology .', 'Finally , a huge thank you to John , Muireann and Aoife for absolutely everything.IntroductionIn 1991 , Getz wrote that festival and holiday event represented nouveau , alternative tourism ( cited in Lee et al.', ', 2008 ) .', 'How time have changed !', 'Such an assertion is simply unimaginable today when , more than 20 year later , finding a city or town without at least one annual festival or planned event would be quite a challenge .', 'Does this constitute progress ?', 'How do festival and event contribute to contemporary society ?', 'What has the remarkable rise in festival and event meant for the development of tourism destination ; for the development of economy , be they local , national or international ?', 'These and many other question preoccupy what is now an extremely large , international community of scholar from a range of discipline who adopt a variety of research approach to study the complex and profoundly important communal celebration at the heart of the diverse festival and event treated in this volume.While it is difficult to calculate the size of festival and event activity , academic , policy and industry commentator everywhere concur that its recent growth across the world in term of number , diversity and popularity has been enormous ( Getz , 1991 ; Finkel , 2009 ; Thrane , 2002 ) .', 'In the USA it is estimated that there were 10,000 festival per year , attracting over 31 million visitor by the mid-1990s ( Janiskee , 1996 ; TIA , 2004 ) .', 'In Australia , the government notes that festival have become ubiquitous , with hundred being held every year ( Australian Government , 2012 ) .', 'In Europe , the growth has been similarly dramatic .', 'According to the International Festival and Event Association ( IFEA ) , the special event industry is estimated to comprise between 4 and 5 million regularly occurring event ( Wood , 2012 ) .', 'This significant growth in the practice of festival and event brought a parallel increase in the emergence and development of the festival and event management profession .', 'It soon also brought a rise in academic interest : closely allied to the development of tourism study , academic began to take an interest in charting development in the sector and the literature has burgeoned over the last 20 year .', 'Much of the research is published in tourism study and specific event-oriented journal , but it also finds expression in a wide range of journal dedicated to management and marketing , urban and place study , art and cultural policy , as well as many social sciences-oriented journal .', 'In the majority of case , festival and special event are presented as broadly positive phenomenon .', 'Throughout the literature , opening paragraphs emphasise the important role they play in advancing local and regional economy , branding place , attracting visitor , extending the tourism season and fostering community spirit .', 'Yet , festival and special event , the subject matter at the heart of this book represent a very substantial , complex and dynamic set of activity that can be both deeply rooted and rapidly changing in country throughout the world .', 'In academia , they are studied from diverse management , social science and humanity perspective .', 'As such , interpretation of their impact and contribution to contemporary economy and society as well as approach to valuing , managing and shaping appropriate policy for their advancement are multiple and at time conflicting.The literature in the field is now enormous and growing all the time .', 'Increasing familiarity with the literature brings an increasing awareness of the unevenness of knowledge , the fracture between academic discipline and the continuous emergence of new sub-fields .', 'The literature on the Olympic Games , for example , is now in and of itself very substantial , yet the extent to which knowledge generated on this particular event translates across into the study of other event that differ by scale and type is very unclear .', 'Getz and Andersson ( 2010 ) explained that festival tourism has been studied by many researcher from many perspective : impact ( of varying type ) , place marketing , travel pattern , displacement effect , motivation , market segmentation , quality and satisfaction , regional development , relationship to urban renewal and development , and link to culture and community .', 'However , this sector is nothing if not dynamic and while knowledge gap are closing in some area , they continue to open up elsewhere all the time .', 'This book tries to take cognisance of this dynamism in including concept that would seem very important in term of future development .', "The concept of ‘ risk management ' , so important from an applied perspective , and that of ‘ emerging economy ' , so important from a geographical perspective , are two example of this.This volume is tasked with introducing , defining and reviewing the current state of knowledge of the key concept in the contemporary study of festival and event .", 'While this involves reviewing literature that is either part of , or closely associated with , tourism study , in reality , it is a multi-disciplinary task that draws on a wide breadth of discipline area .', 'It is well recognised that festival and special event are important from community , social , cultural , political and economic perspective .', 'Despite the growth and popularity of festival and special event , researcher were initially slow in directing research beyond economic impact and motivation ( Gursoy et al.', ', 2004 ) .', 'However , this imbalance is now being corrected .', 'The recent evolution of the academic study of festival and event can not be understood in isolation from the simultaneous evolution of the academic study of tourism .', 'As theme of enquiry have emerged and developed within tourism study , they virtually always evolve into a new theme of enquiry within festival and event study .', 'This link between the two area of study is very strong , with tourism study the primary field of enquiry and festival and event a large and distinct sub-field within.The task of advancing knowledge about the meaning , practice and policy associated with festival and event remains ongoing .', 'As this volume will show , the understanding of core concept remains uneven , and our knowledge of certain dimension of festival and event activity far exceeds that of others .', 'Some of the extant gap are recent , emerging only when contemporary political and societal debate begin to highlight particular concern .', 'The concept of innovation is a case in point : question as to the role that the festival and event sector plays in promoting , adopting and managing innovation are now coming to the fore in the literature .', "Others , such as the sustainability of the sector 's activity have been an issue for longer .", 'Most recently of all , the question as to how festival and event activity are affected by global recession has begun to be investigated ,
