young people in urban Chiang Mai construct an identity at the intersection of global capitalism , state ideology , and local culture .', 'Drawing on over 15 year of ethnographic research , the book explores the impact of rapid urbanisation and modernisation on contemporary Thai youth , focusing on conspicuous youth subculture , drug use ( especially methamphetamine use ) , and violent youth gang .', 'Anjalee Cohen shows how young Thai people construct a specific youth identity through consumerism and symbolic boundary – in particular through enduring rural/urban distinction .', 'The suggestion is that the formation of subculture and “ deviant ” youth practice , such as drug use and violence , are not necessarily form of resistance against the dominant culture , nor a pathological response to dramatic social change , as typically understood in academic and public discourse .', 'Rather , Cohen argues that such practice are attempt to “ fit in and stick out ” in an anonymous urban environment .', 'This volume is relevant to scholar in Thai Studies , Southeast Asian Studies , Anthropology , Sociology , Urban Studies , and Development Studies , particularly those with an interest in youth , drug , and gang .', 'The outstanding universal value of the historic colonial centre of the city of gracias ( Honduras ) .', 'This paper analyses the outstanding universal value , integrity , and authenticity of the city of Gracias ( Honduras ) , as well as its protection and heritage management tool .', 'The main objective is to demonstrate that Gracias meets the UNESCO requirement to qualify as a candidate for inclusion in the International List of the World Heritage Convention ( 1971 ) .', 'Gracias is a colonial Spanish city , founded in 1536 , in the region of Lempira .', "It had great productive , strategic and administrative importance in Central America , demonstrated in part by its hosting of the 'Audiencia de los Confines ' .", "The 'Audiencia ' was the highest court of the Spanish Crown with jurisdiction over the current republic of Guatemala , Belize , El Salvador , Honduras , Nicaragua , Costa Rica and the region of Chiapas .", 'The aim of this court was to represent the interest of the indigenous people in these area .', 'An on-site analysis , diagnosis and assessment of the heritage element was carried out from architectural , urban planning , historical , and intangible heritage perspective .', 'Additionally , other similar site in Central America have been analysed for comparison .', "Result show that this city meets criterion iv of the World Heritage Convention : 'an outstanding example of a type of building , architectural or technological ensemble or landscape which illustrates ( a ) significant stage ( s ) in human history ' .", 'Furthermore , the city´s heritage asset are well-preserved and most of them remain functional ; the indigenous culture is alive ; and planning , conservation and managing tool are in use .', 'Currently , Gracias maintains its harmony and life and its respect for the natural environment , creating a cultural landscape that has been maintained for almost 500 year .', 'CC BY 4.0 License .', 'Songkram River Basin : Floating Vernacular Architecture .', 'Songkram river basin is located in the Upper North Eastern of Thailand ( so called Isan ) .', 'As a part of the 4 factor , one of the vernacular architecture of Songkram river basin , “ Pae Sadung Yak ” , the unique local fishery raft that strongly shown the sense of simplicity and wisdom .', 'This research extract new design concept of vernacular architecture which will transform this bamboo fishing raft into the new application as a floating resort .', 'The result of this research are not only preserving the intangible heritage local wisdom of this particular “ Rock Salt ” , but also the creation of circular economy which could elevate the wealthier status of the people in the area and attract people from different culture such as the outsider or tourist and lead them to experience the new “ Isan lifestyle ” which handcrafted design for sustainable tourism .', 'Contribution for the Rehabilitation of the Castro da Senhora do Bom Sucesso-Mangualde ( Portugal ) .', 'Portugal is undoubtedly , a destination for the practice of Nature Tourism , containing a vast and rich natural , historical and cultural heritage .', 'This settlement , Castro of Senhora do Bom Sucesso is a place where the surrounding landscape stands out with several mountain around it , in an environment where the flora and fauna , characteristic of this region , stand out .', 'The whole history of the place , refers to a certain period of the past , valuing it and able to make the experience that the Nature Tourism can provide even better .', 'Being one of the highest place in the central region of Portugal , it is for many people , a special place of enjoyment and relaxation .', 'In this place , hundred of year ago , there were between 80 and 100 house of ancient people from the Celtic culture .', 'Later , due to the abandonment by Men , these house became disused , falling into a rapid decay process with the collapse of wall and roofs , making the road impassable and the place covered with vegetation .', 'Thus , in this work , in methodological term , based on literature review , the collection of cartographic element of the place , and in the field and cabinet study , it was possible to develop an investigation on the Military Heritage of the region , in order to analyze in detail , the relation of the nature of the place with the architecture .', "This work resulted in a proposal for the site of the former Castro do Bom Sucesso , with the main objective of creating an Ecotourism Park , around the Celtic culture and autochthonous nature , organized in the following main equipment : I ) Reception of the Ecotourism Park ; ( ii ) `` Celtic Bungalows '' iii ) Celtic Interpretation Center ; iv ) biological pool and v ) Camping .", 'The paper presents the main element developed , from the design to the form and location of the equipment that , to be built , is believed to improve the regional economy through a scientific , didactic , cultural and sustainable tourism .', 'South Chile - Extreme Architecture .', 'Typhoon , earthquake , volcanic eruption on the one hand , and the lack of road due to the inaccessibility of mountain area and the extended coastline , combined with the harsh climate of both hot and polar , on the other , make designing and building in Chile an extreme task .', 'It is and always was also hard to design and build in Chile due to the isolation of this country from the rest of the South American continent thanks to the difficulty to overcome the barrier formed by the Andes .', 'Can these unique condition be used to create a unique architecture that brings new quality to global heritage ?', "Perhaps all these `` threat '' are also a significant potential for creation , using beautiful landscape and pure nature .", 'In the beginning , there was the Word .', 'Architectural culture requires faith and extreme sacrifice .', 'For this reason , the presentation begins with a project to which its architect devoted their life and decided to become men of the cloth .', 'Building devoted to religious worship often exceed the utilitarian dimension of architecture , becoming the determinant of direction that architecture will follow .', 'An example of this heroic expression of architecture is the construction of the Benedictine Church in Les Condes , a suburb of Santiago , in 1962-1964 .', 'Can Theatre be a cure allowing people to overcome trauma ?', 'The programme of reconstruction of the city of Concepción in Chile after the destruction wrought in 2010 by the tsunami , included not only the restoration of previously existing housing and infrastructural function , but also the introduction of new cultural function .', 'In 2011 , an architectural competition for the design of the Regional Theatre was announced , which was won by three Chilean architect Smiljan Radić , Eduardo Castillo and Gabriela Medrano .', 'The building was put into use in 2018 and is not only a monument of the past , but also a sign of a new beginning ( Figure 1 ) .', "One of Chile 's greatest natural resource is its diverse landscape .", 'Difficult accessibility of many area , low population density and unfavourable climate are the main factor that have caused large area of land to remain in their natural state .', 'Along with the development of society and the popularisation of tourism , a need arose to build the right background for exploring these natural value .', 'The history tourism in extreme condition is not long .', 'In Poland , for example , it dates to 1850 , when the first winter expedition to the Valley of Five Ponds in the Tatra Mountains took place .', 'In Chile , the first tourist expedition to Patagonia took place in 1879 and was described in the book by its organiser and participant , Lady Lorance Dixie ( Dixie , 1880 ) .', 'These extremely hard natural condition have created a unique opportunity to create modern architecture in interaction with the natural landscape .', 'We will examine this problem on the example of 5 hotel and 5 way of interacting with the landscape and study these architectural idea .', 'Floating Village Cua Van : Promoting Climate-Adaptive Ecotourism with Principles of Living Spaces .', 'Ha Long Bay—the United Nations Educational , Scientific and Cultural Organization ( UNESCO ) World Heritage Site on Vietnam ’ s northeastern seacoast—is often considered one of the world ’ s most beautiful bay .', 'This bay is also famous for many floating fishing village where the people live together on the sea as a community .', 'However , due to rapid population growth in the floating village , the present situation shows lack in urban planning , waste management and development of infrastructure .', 'Ha Long Bay had suffered the pressure of environmental pollution and resource degradation .', 'Since 2014 , in order to protect the UNESCO World Heritage Site , the local authority has planned a project to demolish the floating village and move these community to the mainland .', 'In fact , the demolition project has caused the loss of cultural heritage and a tourist attraction in Ha Long Bay .', 'The goal of this study is to propose a sustainable concept of living space organization for Cua Van , the largest floating village in Ha Long Bay , in order to preserve , revive , and promote floating community as a unique heritage culture and tourist attraction .', 'Therefore , a detailed analysis of environment and socio-cultural , economic , architectural characteristic of Cua Van is provided in this study .', 'The analysis does not only accumulate precious traditional value that need to be preserved and developed in the proposed concept but also illustrate its weakness that need to be addressed to optimally design the future sustainable floating village .', 'Based on these study , as well as on general principle of a sustainable floating community and promoting ecotourism , the study proposes a living space concept for Cua Van , including solution to both a sustainable floating community adapting to climate change and ecotourism development .', 'The proposed concept would ensure stable and permanent living on the water for water dweller and reduce human-induced impact on the environment as well as an increasing livelihood income by tourism development .', 'Life in Long Beach .', 'Long beach , with almost a half a million people is the second largest city in the Los Angeles basin .', 'The city has grown into a modern center of culture , entertainment , and commerce .', 'It is best known for its wide beach extending from harbor , next to shore-line village to south along the coast .', 'The city is constitutes diverse cultural group and consists of largest Cambodian community outside Cambodia .', 'The long beach is connected to Los Angeles by light-trail trollys , which connects other trolley and subway line .']

['Autonomous adaptation to global environmental change in peri-urban settlement : Evidence of a growing culture of innovation and revitalisation in Mathare Valley Slums , Nairobi .', 'The growth of peri-urban area is increasingly recognised as a dominant planning and urban design challenge for the 21st century .', 'In burgeoning poor urban settlement growing on city margin , autonomous adaptation strategy are often the only measure to respond to increasing climatic and compounding stressor .', 'Yet , in both research and practice there remains lack of understanding regarding the dynamic of adaptation and risk reduction at the level of the community .', 'In this paper , we argue urban slum are ideal place to consider adaptation because they offer example of more extreme social-ecological stress than one finds in more established community - the kind we can anticipate more broadly in the face of climate change .', 'A framework for identifying local adaptation processes is presented and applied to analyse the case of Mathare Valley Slums in Nairobi , Kenya - a densely populated suburb , where resident are regularly exposed to flooding from heavy rainfall .', 'Finding reveal that slum , often viewed as illegitimate , makeshift , and temporary settlement , are place experienced by many resident as permanent community characterised by rapid environmental change .', 'Process of adaptation in Mathare have become institutionalised through time , as a new generation of people imagine themselves staying and ( re ) organise to achieve a higher level of functioning through various strategy to reduce risk .', "Innovative and revitalising adaptation occurs as resident shift from employing more generic and expected coping strategy , such as evacuating home or economic diversification , to creating `` gated '' community and saving scheme to maintain and improve the settlement , despite uncertain tenure .", 'Both formal and informal institution , such as youth group , play an important role in governing such heterogeneous locality , incrementally upgrading the slum and providing critical public service .', "Long-term resident ' increasing recognition of the permanence of the slum community and its stressful condition appears to lead to more collective action toward adaptation pathway .", "However , this is in marked contrast to the dominant non-local perspective of Mathare 's status as both impermanent and illegal , which prevails among government official .", 'As such , strategy are generally not incorporated into planned intervention .', 'While progressive policy designed to reduce risk exist , they remain nascent in their establishment and fail to benefit slumdwellers .', 'The case illustrates the need to incorporate the wealth of knowledge , technique , and experience extant at the community level in the development of adaptation planning .', 'Moving young life : Mobility , immobility and inter-generational tension in urban Africa .', "This paper explores young people 's experience and perception of mobility and mobility constraint in poorer urban area of Ghana , Malawi and South Africa within the specific context of inter-generational relation .", "Drawing principally on qualitative research finding from a study involving both adult and child researcher , our aim is to chart the diversity and commonality of urban young people 's mobility experience in the everyday - how they use and experience the city - developing a comparative perspective across three urban study site which links young people 's mobility with the power relation that operate to shape their movement in individual location .", "In particular , we consider how positive and negative image of young people 's mobility play out in term of the inter-generational friction and negotiation generated by their mobility performance .", "We also reflect on the developmental implication , in term of young people 's access to service and income and their participation in the social network and peer culture which may shape their life trajectory .", 'Three theme are explored in detail : mobility as challenge , mobility as temptation and mobility control .', 'Slum upgrading and inclusive municipal governance in Harare , Zimbabwe : New perspective for the urban poor .', 'The story of the urban poor in Harare and Zimbabwean city in general is a story of eviction , fear and misery .', 'In May 2005 , at the behest of the Government of Zimbabwe the infamous Operation Restore Order , a house demolition campaign left more than 700 thousand people homeless .', "Nearly a decade later , there are increased opportunity for improvement and change in the life of the urban poor in Harare , Zimbabwe 's capital city .", 'The purpose of the paper is to present how the Harare Slum Upgrading Programme is creating and strengthening municipal and community partnership to tackle city challenge in an inclusive manner .', 'This research indicates the housing struggle of the urban poor and the emerging City-community engagement in urban service provision ( water , sanitation , tenure security and road ) and changing municipal attitude towards the urban poor .', 'In particular , the article presents participatory urban planning and development , slum upgrading institutional structure , profiling and enumeration , and slum upgrading impact ( resilience of the urban poor , living in slum without fear , expansive pool of beneficiary , review of planning regulation and land ownership ) as major issue promoting inclusive municipal governance .', 'Inclusivity is implemented through incremental development , which is allowing people to settle on land first and access municipal service gradually over time .', 'Two main factor explain such positive step towards inclusive governance in Harare .', "First are indication of gradual institutional change in which the City of Harare 's governance culture is changing through 'opening up ' and embracing the urban poor .", 'Second , over the year , the urban poor have built a strong and vibrant alliance which is acting as a medium of participation in City governance .', 'The paper concludes that slum upgrading sustainability at city-wide level requires active City participation and institutionalisation as opposed to a project based approach .', 'Lastly , addressing concern of the urban poor is susceptible to political contestation , requiring strong impartiality to counter such force .', 'Intellectual of empire : Eric Dutton and hegemony in British Africa .', 'This essay examines the career of Eric Dutton in five British African colony from 1919 to 1952 , with case study of his work in Lusaka and Zanzibar .', "In analyzing Dutton 's career , I use a Gramscian conception of the role of intellectual in creating colonial hegemony , against the backdrop of recent research on the relationship of geography to colonial discourse .", "Dutton worked and corresponded with key player in Britain 's African empire .", 'He was a major force behind early urban-planning program in East and Central Africa and author of four geographical book .', 'Permanently disabled by war wound , he was also permanently infatuated with the moral rightness of British imperial culture .', "A concern for geography 's professional relationship with , and the geographical legacy of , colonialism has emerged in recent scholarship on Africa , largely through study of travel writing , fiction , and nineteenth- or early twentieth-century exploration geography .", "Later scholar-officials like Dutton sought to apply their knowledge to the shaping of space to serve the Empire 's direct and immediate need in Africa , even while trying to win the heart and mind of its subject people .", "Around Timothy Mitchell 's ( 1988 ) concept of `` enframing , '' I build an analysis of the spatial project with which Dutton is most associated and show how Lusaka and Zanzibar were enframed by his plan .", 'Through his publication and correspondence , as well as his seemingly omnipresent service , Dutton has an important legacy that has neither been articulated nor analyzed , one which points to the importance of contextualized biography for analysis of colonial discourse .', 'I argue here for seeing Dutton as an intellectual in the service of colonial hegemony and its enframing spatial discourse , although the character of his agency exemplifies why that attempted hegemony failed .', 'Borrowing from the past to sustain the present and the future : indigenous African urban form , architecture , and sustainable urban development in contemporary Africa .', 'Urban spatial expansion resulting from urbanization in Sub-Saharan Africa ( SSA ) is not going to stop or stabilize in the near future .', 'Effort should therefore be concentrated on accommodating this phenomenon through the promotion of sustainable urban planning and development .', 'Relying on secondary data , this paper examines model of indigenous African urban form and architecture to understand these form and their characteristic , and how these model and associated management , design , and planning principle can be adopted in contemporary SSA urban development in the quest to achieve sustainable urban development .', 'This paper argues that planning is culturally and contextually defined and the specificity of a place are critical in planning .', "Developing strategy based on indigenous urban form which embody local people ' culture , aspiration , experience , and value is consistent with the concept of sustainable urban development .", 'The article concludes that there exist clear element of socially , politically , economically , culturally , and environmentally sound and responsive sustainable planning principle to be derived from indigenous urban form and architecture which can inform current urban development process in SSA .', 'Unexplored elasticity of planning and good governance in Harare , Zimbabwe .', 'The state of the city of Harare in term of its present general outlook and critical analysis of its carrying capacity as a colonial city tends to perpetuate an ingrained myth among urban planner and the common people alike that planning has failed the former so called sunshine-city .', 'Yet such a view treats with amnesia the wealth in the elasticity of planning as an instrument for change as well as a strategic force to command and direct the trajectory of city .', 'It is in this context that this paper discusses the elasticity of planning of Harare as anchored on a complex but well-knit constellation of the factor of good urban governance and political will .', 'These can allow for urban reform and smart transformation .', 'A close look at the city after 1980 shows that the city of Harare has been subjected to much bickering , contestation and intergovernmental imposition of policy hence it exemplifies policy from above as opposed to policy from below .', "This is largely explained by the central government 's hard and fast wrenching control in directing the affair of the city hence negating the role of the resident ' need and wants .", 'Recently the city has been facing several challenge , more than ever before , and the more critical challenge now is the adopted culture of colonial blaming rather that solving the deep seated problem of poor management approach .', 'The present study is skewed towards assessing the historical and contemporary socio-economic and political dynamic as far as they have inspired , championed , ignored , and arm-twisted planning .', 'This has largely been to the detriment of the city .', 'Thus , a vortex and maelstrom over the relevance of planning has been created which now requires planning to exonerate itself by proving its worthiness to the citizen and investor whose creed and needs it has betrayed over the year .', 'Resonating the ‘ culture ’ debate in urban planning .', 'In this era of rapid urbanisation , an understanding of the role of culture in advancing urban planning and development is important for effective urban management , especially in Africa where the culture of informality is dominant .', 'Yet , there is a dearth of research on the relationship between the culture of informality and urban planning in Africa .', 'The purpose of this paper is twofold : ( i ) to analyse the influence of the culture of informality on urban planning and development in Kumasi , a rapidly urbanizing city in Ghana ; and ( ii ) to explore how local people perceive and consider their culture of informality in the context of urban planning as a tool for development .', 'Using mixed method research approach ( survey , agency interview , document review , and participant observation ) , finding indicate that four out of five identified value of the culture of informality have statistically significant positive influence on urban planning and development .', 'However , there is institutional neglect of the culture of informality in urban planning due to limited understanding of the relevance of informality in urban development , contributing to environmental and socio-economic challenge ( e.g.', ', slums proliferation , extinction of green space ) .', 'Colonial architecture , urban planning and the representation of portuguese imperial history .', 'This article proposes a critical analysis of recent interpretation made to the history of architecture and urban planning in the Portuguese colonial context in the twentieth century , particularly in the former African territory .', 'More generally , it intends to explore how the internal history produced by specific field of activity , such as architecture or urbanism , can reinforce the logic of a national and nationalized history .', 'This effect is due partly to the fact that the legitimacy of these field is largely dependent on the national identification in the context of activity that are internationalized .', 'I will argue that the specific field of activity , while creating this internal discourse , can directly or indirectly produce representation of the nation , its history and its people on a larger scale , penetrating popular culture and influencing a shared common sense .', 'In the case in question , the internal discourse on architectural and urbanistic work , on author and style , eventually reinforces an idealized and idyllic image of Portuguese colonialism .', 'Of pirate driver and honking horn mobility , authority , and urban planning in late-colonial accra .', 'This article attempts to bridge two literatures—the African history of urban life and the colonial history of urban planning—in order to better understand the politics of African mobility .', 'In doing so , it situates colonial history of urban planning and emerging African culture of auto-mobility within a broader critique of colonial technology and infrastructure .', 'This article argues that the reality of indirect rule—the autonomy of African urban resident and the weakness of colonial authority and infrastruc-ture—raised new question and problem for colonial official who were tasked with turning ideology into policy and practice .', 'In particular , mobility politics allow us to trace the way that “ average ” people negotiated colonial politics within and outside of the formal , elite structure of elected Town Councils , Legislative Assembles , or chieftaincy politics .', 'Within the colonial bureaucracy and the Town Council , African elites negotiated their own prestige and status alongside the interest and demand of the city ’ s lower-and middle-class population .', "Overcoming politically induced resistance to payment for water in South Africa 's urban area .", 'The difficulty faced by South Africa in achieving reasonable level of payment for water supplied in urban area are in many respect similar to those applicable throughout the world .', 'In some respect , however , the problem are very different .', 'Decade of having to endure a politically offensive system has created negative attitude in the bulk of the population towards authority , and indeed towards service provider .', 'These attitude will not easily change .', 'As the majority of people had not real involvement in governance in the evolving political system during the nineteen eighty they increasingly regarded all authority as illegitimate .', 'An illegitimate system quite naturally had to be resisted and replaced .', 'The objective of resistance was to make the country ungovernable and hence open to change .', 'By withholding , initially , housing rental repayment to the State and , later , service payment to local authority a powerful weapon was brought into play .', "But with it came many other attitude change , currently referred to as a 'culture of non-payment ' , which the new democratic government is now forced to grapple with .", "The degree to which the level of payment for water service can be improved to acceptable level will be dependent in a general sense upon government 's success in changing attitude and , in particular , on water authority persuasiveness in inducing customer to take responsibility for paying for service rendered ."]

['Town planning in postcolonial India , 1947-1965 : Chandigarh re-examined .', 'The objective of this article is to reassess the new town building movement in India from 1947 to 1965 through a re-examination of the making of Chandigarh , to show how nationalism , modernism , and local regional influence affected the design and building of new town .', 'Chandigarh emerged as part of the post-Partition need for a new capital for the Punjab , and involved the effort of several people and level of government .', 'The context of newly achieved nationhood became important in the way it shaped the ideal of both national and local political leader , who wanted architect to transfer these into built form .', 'How successful the architect were in this enterprise was shaped by their professional ideology and understanding ( or lack of it ) of the local .', "Much scholarship exists on issue such as early decision about Chandigarh 's establishment , the Mayer and Le Corbusier plans for the city , and the building comprising the Capitol complex that were designed by Le Corbusier .", 'Much less attention has been given to the residential area of Chandigarh and all that lay beyond the Capitol complex and constitutes the actual town .', 'How did the idea of modernism , the requirement of the nationalist state , and concern for the local shape the built environment ?', 'Was a Western urban design simply replicated here or were there modification to suit locality and culture ?', 'Disruption , resilience , and vernacular heritage in an Indian city : Pune after the 1961 flood .', 'This paper offers insight into production of vernacular architectural heritage that result from disruption caused by disaster such as a flood in a city .', 'To understand the complexity surrounding vernacular heritage , this paper proposes a conceptual approach derived from Lefebvre ’ s theory of production of space constituting the triad of spatial practice , representation of space and representational space .', 'The strength of this approach in explaining resilience and vernacular architectural heritage is illustrated by examining rehabilitation settlement that evolved after the devastating flood of 1961 in Pune ( a city with a population of 4.5 million ) .', 'The paper focuses on the rehabilitation process that was undertaken in response to the flood and relies on secondary data and primary field observation in the rehabilitated settlement .', 'It was found that these settlement had twofold characteristic ; externally , they directed the trajectory of growth and expansion of the city owing to their strategic location in the periphery around the old core , and internally within , they contributed to reshaping of urban form and vernacular architecture as the affected people reconstructed their house and everyday life .', 'A significant contribution to the making of these rehabilitation space was the state ’ s provision of land for rehabilitation and encouragement to the mechanism of Cooperative Housing as a representation of space incorporating contemporary planning ideology .', 'These settlement comprised the ‘ architecture of the dispossessed ’ where material culture and imagery informed different and hybrid form of house but these were a departure from the past as they needed to accommodate rebuilding and expansion while serving aspiration of those affected .', 'Space as a resource .', 'At the micro level of a shelter programme , space is the most important commodity , which needs to be optimally used not only for upgrading the immediate and overall environment but also for reason of the economics , finance , life style , tradition and culture of the people who are expected to live there .', 'The author , one of the leading architect and planner in India today , brings out the futility of a cosmetic approach to planning idea , where significant resource are ignored and which remain untapped and unutilized but which could make our living environment more congenial and desirable .', 'This paper highlights the most intimate relationship of man with the immediate environment in our settlement .', 'The author has made suggestion which can integrate and transform the space we are wasting as an invaluable resource for upgrading the quality of life in human settlement .', '( Ed . )', '.', 'Continuity in tradition : A narrative on the cultural heritage of para and adda in Kolkata .', "'Para ' and 'adda ' are two unique example of intangible cultural resource of the Indian state of Bengal and Bangladesh .", 'Para signifies a community or neighbourhood that share close spatial proximity and similar emotional ideology , whereas adda denotes an exchange of casual or intellectual discussion among people .', 'Para refers to a spatial connotation with a neighbourhood , but the physical manifestation is not the only pre-requisite to form a para .', "Para reflects a networked social cohesion as the continuous affection concretely demonstrated in people 's decision about where to live , how to work and with whom to engage in their daily life .", 'Culture , ethnicity , language , food habit , mutual feeling of belongingness and robust social networking within a neighbourhood contribute to the growth of a para .', 'Adda propagates the intensity of social networking and influence the development of para .', 'The paper uses narrative to comprehend the co-evolution and correlation of para and adda as an unwavering tradition among the Bengali community in Kolkata .', 'A study of built morphology and cultural imagery—a case of bengaluru pettah : Historic core of the city .', 'City are composition of complex matrix of neighbourhood held together by the movement network .', 'The local neighbourhood is very important to understand how people conceive the city in their mind .', 'The representative memory captures the element related to spatial identity of a place , but more often than not , these representation are pictorial image superimposed upon the fabric resulted from the standardized tool used for analysing the spatial quality and its attribute .', 'The recognition of the finding to capture element related to experience of spatial identity problematizes from well-established urban design spatial theory .', 'On the other hand , Indian city is a collective of people , place and event .', 'These neighbourhood may not be central to social or business relationship nor centre for historic monument , but the activity , user , event , location and spatial condition that support them are very different—together key to the legibility of the city .', 'More often than not , the impact due to the city ’ s regeneration process sustain the test of time and manifest into a deeper system for building an image of the place .', 'Hence , embedded meaning and meaningful association over time become crucial for the built morphology .', 'One such neighbourhood is Pettah1—the old core of city of Bangalore .', 'Bengaluru was one of the key trading centre of the south during the pre-colonial era .', 'The idea of a town structured around Pettah ( market ) , Kote2 ( fort ) , Kere3 ( lake and tank ) and Totha4 ( garden and park ) was an unquestionable matrix of natural occurrence and cultural practice .', 'Decade to follow many influence on to the town added a layer of new structure , and every stage of progress enunciated the past with a new skin of element .', 'It is this value of city ’ s memory that lie buried within us carrying forward our past into its present fabric .', 'Hence , the study reveals the need to radically departure from the routine of recording legibility and imageability through mental , sensory and visual mapping and to record in term of space , event , time , activity as well as sense of public-ness .', 'Ultimately , the finding also brings optimism into urban design practice , offering new insight into how to record mosaic of an area in an Indian city that will capture the strong perceived and conceived imagery of a place and hence sensitive responsive proposal that will aid to carefully conceive a system for the future .', 'The Delhis within Delhi .', 'Concept and technique of human settlement can not be divided from social and economic reality in which they are located .', 'One of the most important factor is the development of the historical force .', 'This is shown in the case of Delhi .', 'Today , Delhi is not one single city anymore .', 'Apart from the complexity that all similarly sized urban area show there are many district with their unique background , character , personality and culture .', "To improve living condition in the old area of the city , while still retaining their character , the `` conservative surgery ' approach may be adopted , rather than extensive re-development scheme .", 'The people for which shelter is designed must be met with confidence and their real participation must be sought .', 'For achieving all this , planning has first to start from outside Delhi , and the National Capital Region plan , the recommendation of the National Commission of Urbanization , and the National Housing Policy all have an impact .', 'In the foreseeable future , Delhi is going to be a city of flat .', 'Maybe this is the only workable solution .', 'To achieve culturally the best result , this kind of development should preferably be done through co-operatives rather than government office .', '-from Author', 'Neoliberal urban sustainability in Old Kolkata , India : Case study of contested development .', 'Neoliberalism , a contemporary form of liberalism , advocates supremacy of market economic valuation in the social choice and decision .', 'Expectedly the neoliberal political-economic compulsion have opened up scope for capitalistic investment in the city of Kolkata .', 'But , due to lack of decentralized urban facility and a typical outlook of the people to stay in the “ core ” area , construction of high-rise building replacing the traditional structure and associated culture in the old and heritage area is prominent .', 'Cost of living in the urban core has been increasing rapidly due to the advent of the affluent family , having more purchasing power parity ; and thus , the people living for generation as old-settlers have to give up their possession of land to drift towards the periphery or sustain by compromising their opulence .', 'As observed , the middle-income group are badly affected by the consequence of post-liberalized development .', "This study has been done on the basis of the author ' participant observation , and review of different published literature to build a theoretical framework , followed by perception survey of the diverse resident to understand the problem and validate the proposition .", 'It is argued , that unlike the traditional socially clustered neighbourhood , especially in old Kolkata , the renewed vertical extension of the gated habitation is promoting more social segregation and exclusion in which interdependence and cohabitation in urban governance may not be truly representative , and therefore , unsustainable in future .', 'The research can add significant knowledge in the domain of urban governance and appropriate designing of the cultural cityscape of Kolkata .', 'Spectacle of the Temporal City : An Analysis of the Effect of Festival on Identity in an Urban Context .', 'City around the world are becoming complex system wherein every city possess unique identity manifested through its people and activity that occur in its urban space .', 'The sense of urban space is an ever-changing concept and to understand the fabric of urban space , knowledge of the concept of space and its interrelation is required .', 'Reading a city in a time where change is the norm , with urban space gaining new meaning and function with change in cultural practice conveys the hybrid urgency of metropolitan India .', 'An analysis is thus , particularly relevant in India , as in the post-industrial scenario , city in India have become some of the largest urban conglomerate with a dualist identity of static and kinetic pervading their urban landscape .', 'The static city is the conventional physical entity of a city whereas , the kinetic city is perceived as a city in motion , temporary in nature and the emerging symbolic image of urban India .', 'Understanding these multitude of identity in the backdrop of traditional event and festival , as temporal transformation of urban space will thus highlight the dominant visual culture of Indian city .', 'This Temporal City enables a better understanding of the blurred line of contemporary urbanism and the changing role of social space in the urban fabric .', 'This study focused on the ancient festival of Ambubachi in the historic Kamakhya Temple in Guwahati , India , through visual ethnography , participant observation , open-ended interview , photography and document analysis .', 'The central concern of this paper is to develop a critical stance on understanding the identity of city through the study of urban spectacle such as festival in a bid to illustrate the fluid and dynamic aspect of one ’ s identity that is being constantly redefined and reconstructed with time , space , activity and context .', 'Through the analysis of this ancient festival of Ambubachi in the light of ‘ identity ’ and ‘ place attachment ’ of the festivalgoers , the emerging notion of identity will be explored .', 'The fieldwork sought to analyse two major aspect : The first was the generic , spatial characteristic of festival space and the second was the temporal , fleeting event that occur in their physical setting following the parameter of event-space relationship by Frenchman in a bid to understand how such eventful urban space manifest in the negotiation of one ’ s identity .', 'Uncanny and dystopian city : An analysis of Siva .', "With rapid urbanisation and people 's migration from rural to urban area in search of work , education and other opportunity , urban conglomeration in India are rapidly growing .", 'A city is marked by diversity , modernity , high-rise building , modern infrastructure and consumerism .', 'Popular culture is one of the many resource for understanding the cityscape .', 'The city is not just about physical and material space but also includes the lived experience , interaction , contestation , exclusion and power relationship .', 'Many urban geographer opine that cinema reflects and represents these issue as well as the discourse about the city .', 'There is little or no research on the Cinematic City of Hyderabad .', 'This article analyses the movie Siva , which captured the essence of the city of Hyderabad .', 'The discussion maps out its urban space by using semiotic and discourse analysis , and addresses the different theme that the discourse reveals .', 'In sum , Siva captures the anxiety , violence and evolution of a dystopian city and provides insight to the potential fate of similar urban conglomeration .', 'Divided we stand : The Indian city afer economic liberalisation .', 'In the wake of economic liberalisation in the early 1990s , the Indian city has displaced the village in public imagination as the quintessence of India as rising , modern global power .', 'The nature and rate of urbanisation and urban growth have elicited multiple interpretation , notwithstanding an emerging consensus about the importance of the city in India ’ s future .', 'With city , especially larger one , being seen to propel economic growth in post-liberalisation India , they have come to be the focus of extensive , and arguably unprecedented , development policy .', 'If urban development policy have seen a sea of change in post-liberalisation period , these have been matched with the introduction of new form of urban governance .', 'Indian city are often represented as a melting pot of people , space and culture .', 'City , as configured by institution , practice and idea of governance , relating to both private and state actor , remain exclusionary space from the perspective of the poor , despite the upsurge of ‘ inclusion ’ as a stated public commitment .']

['Brain culture : Shaping policy through neuroscience .', 'This unique book offers a timely analysis of the impact of rapidly advancing knowledge about the brain , mind and behaviour on contemporary public policy and practice .', 'Examining development in behaviour change policy , neuroscience , architecture and urban design , education , and workplace training programmes the book analyses the global spread of research agenda , policy experiment and everyday practice informed by ‘ brain culture ’ .It offers an alternative , geographically informed set of explanation for what matter in explaining how people behave and how citizen ’ behaviour should be governed .', 'It will be of interest to student and academic across the social and behavioural science .', 'Extending boundary with meta-design and culture of participation .', 'Human-computer interaction ( HCI ) has refocused many research effort within computer science from a technology-centered view to a human-centered view .', 'The development so far , however , have seen human mostly as user and consumer rather than as active contributor and designer .', 'This paper provides a conceptual framework based on meta-design and culture of participation that democratize design and allows all stakeholder to evolve system to fit their need .', 'It establishes a new extended discourse for HCI research in which information technology are interwoven with human life in all aspect of our existence ( at home , working , teaching , learning , and being a citizen ) .', 'Specific socio-technical environment instantiating the framework in different application domain are described , including : ( 1 ) environment for people with cognitive disability , ( 2 ) table-top computing system for framing and solving complex urban planning problem , ( 3 ) modeling the building of the world in 3D , and ( 4 ) using Smart Grids to support energy sustainability .', 'These example show how metadesign and culture of participation are design approach that allow researcher and practitioner to extend boundary by allowing all stakeholder to have more control over their artifact and by providing opportunity to encourage and to support contribution by many people in personally meaningful activ ities .', 'Designing urban smart furniture for facilitating migrant ’ integration : The co-design workshop as approach for supporting inclusive design .', 'European city are changing due the immigration of people from different culture .', 'There are many issue related to the integration and dialogue between culture .', 'Urban design plays a key role in how migrant participate in their host community and it is an important driver for the inclusion process .', 'Facilitating the participation of resident in designing public space and their use helps to create a better sense of belonging .', 'Promoting in public space the interaction of different culture becomes a crucial element to facilitate social cohesion and living together .', 'The research project explores an innovative approach in the use of public space , through the design of smart urban furniture .', 'Based on a survey of the user ’ s need , and on co-design activity , the project investigates innovative solution for facilitating migrant ’ integration and the dialogue between different culture , through the design of innovative urban furniture , with smart technology embodied inside .', 'The project , based on the co-design approach of rapid prototyping , creates different kind of new interaction among urban space and people , and between user of different social or cultural background .', 'The result presented in this paper , were conducted by the research unit of the University of Florence , in cooperation with the Human Tech Institute and the School of Management of the University of Applied Sciences and Arts Western Switzerland .', 'The Development of a Web-Based Urban Soundscape Evaluation System .', 'Acoustic quality is one of the important aspect of urban design .', 'It is usually evaluated based on how loud the urban environment is .', "However , this approach does not consider people 's perception of the urban acoustic environment .", 'Therefore , a different method has been developed based on the perception of the acoustic environment using the concept of soundscape .', 'Soundscape is defined as the acoustic environment perceived by people who are part of the environment .', 'This approach considers the relationship between the sound source , the environment , and the people .', "The analysis of soundscape considers many aspect such as cultural aspect , people 's expectation , people 's experience of space , and social aspect .", 'Soundscape affects many aspect of human life such as culture , health , and the quality of life .', 'Urban soundscape management and planning must be integrated with the other aspect of urban design , both in the design and the improvement stage .', 'The soundscape concept seeks to make the acoustic environment as pleasant as possible in a space with or without uncomfortable sound source .', 'Soundscape planning includes the design of physical feature to achieve a positive perceptual outcome .', 'It is vital to gather data regarding the relationship between human and the component of a soundscape , e.g.', ', sound source , feature of the physical environment , the function of a space , and the expectation of the sound source .', 'The data can be measured and gathered using several soundscape evaluation method .', 'Soundscape evaluation is usually conducted using in-situ survey and laboratory experiment using a multi-speaker system .', 'Although these method have been validated and are widely used in soundscape analysis , there are some limitation in the application .', 'The in-situ survey needs to be done at one time with many people at the same time because it is hard to replicate the acoustic environment .', 'Conversely , the laboratory experiment does not have a problem with the repetition of the experiment .', 'This method requires a room with a multi-speaker reproduction system .', 'This project used a different method to analyse soundscape developed using headphone via the internet .', 'The internet system for data gathering has been established ; a website has enabled to reproduce high-quality audio and it has a system to design online questionnaire .', 'Furthermore , the development of a virtual reality system allows the reproduction of virtual audio-visual stimulus on a website .', 'Although the website has an established system to gather the required data , the problem is the validation of the reproduction system for soundscape analysis , which needs to be done with consideration of several factor : the suitable recording system , the effect of headphone variation , the calibration of the system , and the perception result from internet-based acoustic environment reproduction .', 'This study aims to develop and validate a web-based urban soundscape evaluation method .', 'By using this method , the experiment can be repeated easily and data can be gathered from many respondent .', 'Furthermore , the simplicity of the system allows for the application by the stakeholder in urban design .', 'The data gathered from this system is important for the design of an urban area with consideration of the acoustic aspect .', 'Human sensory assessment linked with geo-and mobile-data processing method in urban planning exemplified on different culture in Germany and Egypt .', "Human sensory assessment is a new approach to objectively gather subjec-tive data concerning human ' perception of space and emotional reaction towards space in real-time .", 'The resulting data enables urban planner to get a more comprehensive view of interdependency between people and their urban environment .', 'This paper shows the methodical framework be-ginning from gathering over processing and analyzing to visualizing emo-tional reaction of selected participant .', 'The research aims to optimize and automatize the processing between human sensory assessment , geo-and mobile-data .', 'The challenge lies in joining and processing the generated various data type to gain visual tangible result .', 'In order to apply the complete methodical repertoire , different case study and exemplary anal-yses were conducted in Germany and Egypt , dealing with the exemplary research question `` How do people of different culture perceive their envi-ronment in different country ?', '`` .', 'Designing a DNA for adaptive architecture : A new built environment for social sustainability .', 'The paper explores innovative environmentally responsible and socially proactive way to build in developing country .', 'The proposed methodology was tested with the design of a Smart Village in Egypt , awarded the second prize in an international competition .', 'Our design approach is based on environmental and social sustainability and works as a genetic algorithm .', 'This process generates the sustainable architecture of the village using the behaviour of biological creature in artificial system .', 'The design ultimately ensures that our architecture is nurtured by renewable energy and built with re-cycled material .', 'The disposition of public space and the flexible organization of different function are conceived in order to stimulate social sustainability , allowing the community to be interdependent as much as an ecosystem .', 'Local culture , typology , material and climate build the DNA of both the village and its building .', "We apply concept from artificial life , using `` creature '' that follow simple low-level rule in order to get high-level group behaviour .", 'By combining the principle of artificial life and architecture , we get both high energy-efficiency and optimal placement of built unit on a specific site .', 'As in any ecosystem , a fractal , coherent , continuous fluctuation at every scale of the system is vital , and this kinetic flexibility is achieved at four level : 1 ) decentralized urban planning ; 2 ) reconfigurable space ; 3 ) modular building block ; 4 ) kinetic structure that respond to light , climate and people .', 'Smart energy dorm : Social and environmental analysis of Studentato San Bartolomeo .', 'European energy politics , usually focused on the single building scale , are now broadening their field of interest towards a wider context , defining more adequate intervention strategy aiming at facilitating virtuous relationship between building at district , city and region level .', 'Themes related to human comfort are properly considered as well , both at physical and social level , namely relational comfort between people living in the same built environment .', 'Again , relationship is the key word .', 'In this context , university student residence have been often studied as large building hosting several and complex function , where people with different habit , education , origin and culture live together .', 'Besides , dorm have particular relationship with the city , often acting as place for urban regeneration .', 'The study presented here concerns the analysis of the recent San Bartolomeo student dorm , performed with focus group with the occupant and questionnaire , on-site monitoring survey and energy modelling in transient state .', 'The purpose is to present a comprehensive study on the constructive and energetic aspect of existing building complex , in order to define a possible procedure aimed at considering the overall comfort level of the living community and the interaction with the urban surrounding from an operational and social point of view .', '3rd International Conference on Civil Engineering and Transportation , ICCET 2013 .', 'The proceeding contain 175 paper .', 'The special focus in this conference is on Civil ['Place , culture , and the social amplification of risk .', 'This article investigates the role of culture in the social production of risk and risk communication surrounding industrial development in a region located at a rural-urban interface .', 'A case study examined a public consultation that was undertaken to inform local resident about an eco-industrial development proposal being planned near Edmonton , Alberta , Canada .', 'The research employed the social amplification of risk framework ( SARF ) to examine the relationship among culture , place , and socially constructed risk .', 'A total of 44 in-depth , semi-structured interview were carried out with 33 landowner ( farmer , acreage owner ) , public official ( municipal politician , administrator ) , journalist , and industry representative .', 'Analysis revealed that risk communication occurred in relation to situated experience of place that were based on conflicting cultural worldviews .', 'The research shows that place is a useful component of the SARF , providing a spatial explanation for why some people amplify , and others attenuate , risk in locally contentious environmental debate .', 'Greater Portland : Urban life and landscape in the Pacific Northwest .', 'It has been called one of the nation ’ s most livable region , ranked among the best managed city in America , hailed as a top spot to work , and favored as a great place to do business , enjoy the art , pursue outdoor recreation , and make one ’ s home .', 'Indeed , year of cooperative urban planning between developer and those interested in ecology and habitability have transformed Portland from a provincial western city into an exemplary American metropolis .', 'Its thriving downtown , its strong neighborhood , and its pioneering effort at local management have brought a steady procession of journalist , scholar , and civic leader to investigate the “ Portland style ” that values dialogue and consensus , treats politics as a civic duty , and assumes that it is possible to work toward public good .', 'Probing behind the press clipping , acclaimed urban historian Carl Abbott examines the character of contemporary Portland-its people , politics , and public life-and the region ’ s history and geography in order to discover how Portland has achieved its reputation as one of the most progressive and livable city in the United States and to determine whether typical pressure of urban growth are pushing Portland back toward the national norm .', 'In Greater Portland , Abbott argues that the city can not be understood without reference to its place .', 'Its river , hill , and broader regional setting have shaped the economy and the cityscape .', 'Portlanders are Oregonians , Northwesteners , Cascadians ; they value their city as much for where it is as for what it is , and this powerful sense of place nurtures a distinctive civic culture .', 'Tracing the way in which Portlanders have talked and thought about their city , Abbott reveals the tension between their diverse vision of the future and plan for development .', 'Most citizen of Portland desire a balance between continuity and change , one that supports urban progress but actively monitors its effect on the region ’ s expansive green space and on the community ’ s culture .', 'This strong civic participation in city planning and politics is what gives greater Portland its unique character , a positive setting for class integration , neighborhood revitalization , and civic value .', 'The result , Abbott confirms , is a region whose unique initiative remain a model of American urban planning .', 'Bike lane are white lane : Bicycle advocacy and urban planning .', 'The number of bicyclist is increasing in the United States , especially among the working class and people of color .', 'In contrast to the demographic of bicyclist in the United States , advocacy for bicycling has focused mainly on the interest of white upwardly mobile bicyclist , leading to neighborhood conflict and accusation of racist planning .', "In Bike Lanes Are White Lanes , scholar Melody L. Hoffmann argues that the bicycle has varied cultural meaning as a `` rolling signifier . ''", 'That is , the bicycle ’ s meaning change in different space , with different people , and in different culture .', 'The rolling signification of the bicycle contributes to building community , influence gentrifying urban planning , and upholds systemic race and class barrier .', 'In this study of three prominent U.S. cities-Milwaukee , Portland , and Minneapolis-Hoffmann examines how the burgeoning popularity of urban bicycling is trailed by systemic issue of racism , classism , and displacement .', 'From a pro-cycling perspective , Bike Lanes Are White Lanes highlight many problematic aspect of urban bicycling culture and its advocacy as well as positive example of people trying earnestly to bring their community together through bicycling .', 'Latino community in the United States : Place-making in the pre-world war II , postwar , and contemporary city .', 'Scholarship on Latino community in the United States has yet to catch up with the rapid growth of this ethnic population in the country .', 'Understanding the Latino urban experience and developing plan to better respond to both the need of Latino community and their integration within society is not only relevant , but also urgently necessary .', 'Using the city of Los Angeles as a main lens , in addition to a general look at the urban Southwest , we contribute to the scholarship on the subject with a review of literature on Latino community .', 'We structure the review as an assessment of the various challenge and opportunity for urban Latinos in the pre-war , postwar , and contemporary city .', 'Focusing on space , culture , economy , and governance , we chart the various role both the private and public sector play in meeting these challenge .', 'Our reading of the literature shows that particular government action in the economic and governance domain in the past had positive impact on Latino integration , and we call for a similar effort today in addressing contemporary challenge .', 'We conclude by suggesting that future planning scholarship on Latino community engage the wider urban study literature , focus on emerging form of urbanization , and call on planner to sustain increased academic and practical interest in the topic .', "Imagining Portland 's urban growth boundary : Planning regulation as cultural icon .", "Problem : In the 30 year since its creation , has Portland , Oregon 's , urban growth boundary ( UGB ) become something more than a regulation ?", 'Spirited debate about its impact on land us and value has inspired vivid description by both supporter and critic and spurred the imagination of artist and creative writer .', 'Purpose : The UGB has become a symbol , metaphor , and touchstone , as people read complex meaning into it that go beyond its simple legal function .', 'This article looks at the UGB as a cultural icon .', 'It explores the increasingly complex way in which people have tried to describe , understand , and interpret the UGB as part of the regional landscape as well as the regulatory system .', 'It examines metaphorical description of the UGB as well as the growing body of depiction in nature writing , poetry , novel , photography , performance art , song , and other exercise of the artistic imagination .', 'Method : We review how supporter and critic of the UGB have described it and how artist have depicted it in various media.results and conclusion : Although many planning project have become icon , few planning regulation have done so .', 'Artistic interpretation have familiarized and humanized the UGB and embedded it in the consciousness of everyday life .', 'Artist thus make the invisible more visible or legible .', 'Acting as a viewfinder , the UGB offers an opportunity for conversation and interpretation from multiple perspective .', 'Takeaway for practice : In the world of 21st-century planning theory there is a strong assumption that many voice engaged in overlapping conversation can help shape more equitable and sustainable city .', "Creative depiction of Portland 's UGB show the role of cultural actor in shaping and enriching such conversation .", 'Property right and landscape planning in the intermountain west : The Teton Valley case .', 'Non-participation in landscape planning presents a formidable challenge to sustainable development .', 'We hypothesize that even when people hold negative attitude toward unplanned development , natural property right value ( favorable evaluation of property as an inviolable and pre-political right ) prevent them from acting on their concern .', 'We chose an intermountain west community as a case study to evaluate our hypothesis regarding natural property right value .', 'All group were equally and strongly opposed to continuation of rapid unplanned growth , but those with natural property right value were also adamantly opposed to land use planning .', 'We used a multiple logistic regression model to evaluate the relationship between support for landscape planning and a natural property right value .', 'An overall significance test of the regression equation indicated the independent variable were significantly predictive of the dependent variable ( χ2 128 , 8 d.f.', ', p & lt ; 0.001 ) and had high ( 88.7 % ) predictive capacity .', 'Natural property right value was the most important predictor variable , but income was also significant .', 'Sustainable landscape planning requires uncoupling property right from inviolable and pre-political natural right .', 'Our result suggest a conversation focused on theme associated with loss of local culture , hypocrisy of building practice , and market control over development could facilitate the aforementioned uncoupling and development planning that promotes both security for land owner and public welfare .', "If strategic `` planning is everything , maybe it 's nothing '' .", 'Collectively designing new image of a city to translate it into priority for investment is really too demanding .', 'It is rarely possible to do that , a special context and culture is needed , for instance , a republican culture , orienting people and decision-makers toward some common value and target , is a precondition .', 'After decade of individualism , to reconstruct a republican culture might be necessary , but it very difficult and not a short-term objective .', 'It should be kept in mind that while strategic planning and planning in general are opportunity for the government and dependent on political will , land-use planning , even in a simplified zoning form , is a necessity : the urban market needs it ; there is no way of managing city growth without some form of grid and regulation .', 'This makes a big difference between strategic planning and land-use planning .', "Integrative analysis of city system : Bangkok 'man and the biosphere ' programme study .", 'This paper argues that integrative analysis of city system helps us to see beyond their current environmental and social problem to underlying cause , and it suggests different opportunity for possible intervention .', "Focusing on a single aspect of a city or its people without understanding its context risk intervention which treat symptom rather than cause and whose short-term 'solution ' often means that the problem return in the same or perhaps a different form .", 'Our integrative analysis of Bangkok suggests that the root of its environmental ( and some social ) problem lie in decision-making structure and a political culture which has historically fostered self interested decision by stakeholder rather than the public interest .', 'This has produced a land use and built environment configuration that largely ignores the functioning of the natural flood plain ecosystem and the well-being of resident .', 'People adapt their behaviour to their environment but often in way that have serious cumulative impact on the city .', 'This analysis suggests that problem need to be addressed at their source : the nature of decision-making by stakeholder , at every level .', 'This requires the engagement of all party inside and outside government , the elite and otherwise .', 'To the extent that planning has a viable role , the focus needs to be on the source of the impact , such as national development planning , rather than in sector such as transport , where the problem are evident .', 'Chicago sociology and urban planning policy - Sociological theory as occupational ideology .', "This account has provided one illustration of the possibility of an alternative approach to the sociology of knowledge other than the `` reductionist '' analysis of idea as mere epiphenomena of material interest .", "If the sociology of knowledge can not be pursued in any other fashion , the field 's oft-lamented neglect seems entirely justifiable .", 'But sociologist of knowledge can choose to define the purpose of their work , not as the exposure of perceptual distortion conditioned by social position , but as the elucidation of factor which lend certain formulation plausibility within a given socio-cultural context .', "Ironically , such explication of the relationship of ideology to work has been consonant with the developing Chicago tradition , although not unique to it , for Chicagoans have been concerned to elucidate the mean by `` which people respond creatively to the limitation of their institutional context . ''", 'As we have seen , the pre-World War II manifestation of that tradition has permitted urban bureaucrat to maximize their possibility for action within the constraint of their formal obligation .', 'Not only has their faith in the accuracy of evolutionist prediction sustained civil servant in the belief that they have maintained value-neutrality , but it has also allowed them to enjoy the pleasure of power and concrete accomplishment .', 'For the city is conceptualized as an ever-expanding frontier , perpetually subjected to cycle of devastation and construction .', 'Hence , while ostensibly acting as instrument of inexorable historical force , urban bureaucrat are constantly provided with opportunity to raise tangible monument to their personal authority .', "And evolutionist sociology has sanctioned a viable occupational strategy for the bureaucrat qua bureaucrat , for it justifies the civil servant ' favored relationship with powerful client , allowing them to negotiate their continued occupational survival .", 'Although Chicago sociology has proved useful to planning professional , I do not mean to suggest that its creator would have approved of the consequence of bureaucratic activity .', "In fact , both in method and substance the practice of government agency have violated the human ecologist ' ideal ; Chicagoan Louis Wirth deplored planner ' operational category , arguing that they should be replaced with more sophisticated sociological one .", "More importantly , federal official used Chicago sociologist ' projection to support policy counter to the Chicagoans ' prescription for civilized society .", 'Government policy has been effectively anti-urban .', "Based on the Chicago evolutionist ' model , and in the name of sound business practice , central city decline has been assured and suburban expansion facilitated .", 'Chicago sociologists saw conflict arising from large-scale urban migration and rapid industrialization , but they accepted conflict as necessary to progress ; the highest development of civilization required diversity and an urban milieu .', 'Within the city various group created homogeneous community , but heterogeneity of the population as a whole was essential to urban culture .', "Federal agency , while adhering to the sociologist ' premise , turned the model on its head ; they sought to minimize conflict by eradicating social heterogeneity , and encouraged the growth of homogeneous suburban neighborhood in which resident were protected from alien person and lifestyle .", 'Constructing the dynamo of dixie : Race , urban planning , and cosmopolitanism in chattanooga , tennessee .', 'What can local history of interracial conflict and collaboration teach us about the potential for urban equity and social justice in the future ?', "Courtney Elizabeth Knapp chronicles the politics of gentrification and culture-based development in Chattanooga , Tennessee , by tracing the root of racism , spatial segregation , and mainstream `` cosmopolitanism '' back to the earliest encounter between the Cherokee , African Americans , and white settler .", 'For more than three century , Chattanooga has been a site for multiracial interaction and community building ; yet today public leader have simultaneously restricted and appropriated many contribution of working-class community of color within the city , exacerbating inequality and distrust between neighbor and public official .', "Knapp suggests that `` diasporic placemaking '' -defined as the everyday practice through which uprooted people create new community of security and belonging-is a useful analytical frame for understanding how multiracial interaction drive planning and urban development in diverse city over time .", 'By weaving together archival , ethnographic , and participatory action research technique , she reveals the political complexity of a city characterized by century of ordinary resistance to racial segregation and uneven geographic development .', 'An integral lens on Patrick Geddes .', 'Patrick Geddes is a significant figure in the landscape and urban planning canon .', 'In addition to situating city within a regional context and advancing a socioecological understanding of urbanization , he viewed city as the principal artifact of , and theater wherein , human culture evolves .', 'This expansive view of city may be one of the more challenging aspect of Geddes ’ legacy to assimilate .', 'Working during a late 19th and early 20th century period when the limitation of modernity were becoming increasingly apparent , much of Geddes ’ aspirational thinking can be seen as an effort to create what he described as a “ larger modernism.', '” In this regard , Geddes can be counted amongst those whom we portray as integrative holistic thinker , people whose worldview draws them toward meaning-making narrative and framework that include the many dimension of the human condition .', 'Today , a new generation of holistic approach called “ metatheories ” – and “ integral theory ” in particular – provides an orienting lens through which to review , assess , and potentially extend the work of Geddes in the 21st century .', 'Towards that goal , this article first provides an introductory primer to some of Geddes ’ noteworthy “ thinking machine ” as well as integral theory .', 'We then assess correspondence between the two , focusing on Interdisciplinary Holism ; Evolution , Development and Complex Systems ; Human Agency and Ethics ; and Spirituality .', 'A closing discussion addresses prospect for future research , and suggests that the holistic , evolutionary , and generative orientation of our principal subject may have particular relevance in an anthropogenic biosphere characterized , in part , by significant environmental challenge and the concentration of human in city .', 'How urban forest manager evaluate management and governance challenge in their decision-making .', 'Decision about urban forest are critical to urban liveability and resilience .', 'This study aimed to evaluate the range of position held by urban forest manager from local government in the state of Victoria , Australia , regarding the management and governance challenge that affect their decision-making .', 'This study was based on a Q-method approach , a procedure that allows researcher to evaluate the range of position that exist about a topic in a structured manner based on the experience of a wide group of people .', 'We created statement on a wide range of urban forest management and governance challenge and asked urban forest manager to rate their level of agreement with these statement via an online survey .', 'Manager generally agreed about the challenge posed by urban development and climate change for implementing local government policy on urban forest protection and expansion .', 'However , there were divergent view about how effective solution based on increasing operational capacity , such as increasing budget and personnel , could address these challenge .', 'For some manager , it was more effective to improve critical governance challenge , such as inter-departmental and inter-municipal coordination , community engagement , and addressing the culture of risk aversion in local government .', 'Urban forest regional strategy aimed at coordinating management and governance issue across city should build on existing consensus on development and environmental threat and address critical management and governance issue not solely related to local government operational capacity .', "Lewis Mumford 's Urbanism and the Problem of Environmental Modernity .", 'This essay reconsiders the early career of Lewis Mumford and the assumption that modernity has been disastrous environmentally .', 'Might it be possible to see Mumford , especially in his writing of the 1930s , as an early exemplar of green urbanism ?', 'Within environmental history , Mumford has been treated mostly as a regionalist - sometimes even as an opponent of the city .', "This essay argues that in fact his path toward ecological `` balance '' led directly through the city , not out of it .", "Indeed , he gives us access to modernity 's ambivalence and complexity by accompanying his trenchant critique of modern city with a positive vision for how people might design and occupy urban space more sustainably .", "To rediscover Mumford is to reconsider the city not just as a site of erasure and hubristic `` renewal '' but also as a landscape full of what he called `` remnant '' and `` persistents '' ; it is to rediscover modernity 's environmental possibility , in line with current trend in urban ecology and design , and with the new momentum in urban environmental history to combine material and cultural perspective .", 'The World Urban Forum III : Vancouver .', "`` Better information for better city ! ''", 'is the call that leads this special issue .', 'Urban indicator and performance measurement are the answer , aiming to improve local performance on key trend and contribute to solving global
