problem .', 'Better information , according to the rational model that predominates in urban policy , is the surest path to improve action .', 'The World Urban Forum ( WUF ) III , meeting in Vancouver in June 2006 , considers dimension , challenge , and practice in the use of urban indicator in the Vancouver region .', "Patrick Geddes , writing in the early day of the town and regional planning movement , insisted upon the value of what he called a synoptic view , `` a seeing of the city and this as a whole ; like Athens from its Acropolis '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. 6 ) .", 'Working from a synoptic view did not simply mean gazing down on the city from atop a hill .', "Geddes strove to help people express `` simultaneity '' of their own being .", "Understanding that people living in a given region have a multitude of different perspective , simultaneity of being meant `` one-ness with the social ideal , the scientific development and the physical condition of [ their ] own time and place '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. x ) .", 'He believed a region could be created and planned to aid people in accomplishing all these thing .', "As one of the forefather of town and regional planning , Geddes himself was a maker of `` great map and diagram and chart '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. xiii ) -but his most lasting contribution to the profession and practice of planning was his notion of the Civic Exhibition .", "Geddes was less concerned about expert training to make great plan and planner than he was `` concerned that the ordinary citizen should have a vision and a comprehension of the possibility of his own city '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. xi ) .", "A periodic Civic Exhibition , during which citizen could gather in a festive atmosphere to peruse plan , gaze at large map and model , discuss and interpret these publicly , was one part of Geddes 's key contribution to this goal .", "The other part was his drive to create a permanent and public centre for Civic Studies in every town in the form of an `` Outlook Tower '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. xi ) .", "The Outlook Tower was to be the `` incipient Civic Observatory and Laboratory together '' in which the Science of Cities was advanced to its proper rank amongst academic and life pursuit ( Geddes , 1949 , p. 96 ) .", "The institution Geddes sought to create placed `` its effort towards correlation of thought and action , science and practice , sociology and moral , with its watchword and endeavour of `` Civic Survey for Civic Service '' '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. 69 ) .", "Fastforward to late 2004 , when the Urban Studies Program at Simon Fraser University 's downtown campus initiated the Regional Vancouver Urban Observatory ( RVu ) , with a vision akin to that of Geddes .", "In the context of the new millennium , RVu was established as the first local observatory within UN-Habitat 's Global Urban Observatory network in a developed country .", "The Global Urban Observatory was established in 1997 to institutionalize UN-Habitat 's pioneering work in the generation and tracking of urban indicator , initiated with the Urban Indicators Programme in 1993 .", 'Following the creation of the Habitat Agenda at the Habitat II Conference in Istanbul in 1996 , the mission was set for the Global Urban Observatory-to create and maintain a Global Urban Indicators Database that would permit UN member state and their city to monitor and report on urban trend on a regular and reliable basis .', 'The Millennium Development Goals , established by UN member state in 2000 , and the indicator established for tracking these eight goal in 2003 , update the mission of the Global Urban Indicators Database ( UN-Habitat 2004 ) .', 'The MDGs represent a global compact for poverty alleviation and sustainable development , to be attained by 2015 .', "RVu 's work to date is being presented to the international community for the first time at the World Urban Forum III .", 'The work thus far has constituted both expert-based and public participatory component .', 'Expert affiliated with RVu have conducted regional and international research on urban indicator-related work , with some bearing on the Vancouver region and on specific indicator used by a range of project in the major area of urban capital : health , economy , environment , governance , culture , and infrastructure .', 'Work in progress toward these research article was presented at the first RVu public event , Focusing ouR View , in October 2005 ; and the best finished result are presented in this issue of Cities .', 'Key to the design of Rvu , and in particular its public participatory process , are presented in the first article in this issue , Urban Indicators and the Integrative Ideals of Cities , by Meg Holden .', "The paper presents the practice in progress of RVu 's stance on urban sustainability as a community-based struggle to learn , indicator as a means for long-term learning , and the role of value-based citizen participation , within a theoretical perspective .", "Sustainable development , as a framework for long-term planning , has value in the Vancouver region for its `` constructive ambiguity '' ( Robinson , 2004 , p. 374 ) , its pointer toward greater linkage among environmental , social , and economic priority , without forcing a premature set of quantitative trade-off .", 'This integrative , vague , idealistic thrust also leaves sustainable development open to clash with incremental , specific , and realist demand competing for time on the public agenda .', 'Indicator can help bridge the gap ; the article in this issue begin to explain how .', 'One article presents a bridge from the perspective of environmental economics , illustrating the complexity of measuring natural capital but also the need and precedent for this .', 'The next article presents a way of thinking about indicator of governance for sustainable development from a starting point of allocating equal value to democratic inclusion of each citizen .', 'Moving from the individual to the group , the final two article ask for greater attention to socially , culturally and demographically-specific case : new immigrant and Aboriginal people .', "Nancy Olewiler offers an economist 's perspective on the design and utility of an urban indicator project , with a particular focus on natural capital .", 'Her article , Environmental Sustainability for Urban Areas : The Role of Natural Capital Indicators , expands on one of the theme from Holden , the difference between descriptive indicator , which proliferate in policy contexts , and diagnostic indicator , which are rare .', 'Olewiler presents the Driving Force-Pressure-State-Impact-Response framework and reminds us of the need to consider different indicator at each point in the chain .', "Her treatment of natural capital indicator issue locally includes useful information on Greater Vancouver 's adjacent Fraser Valley Regional District .", 'She looks south to the city of Santa Monica , California for an example of natural capital indicator development and institutionalization .', 'Building on a theme introduced by Holden , Olewiler reminds us that indicator alone are not enough ; effective indicator are those presented in a reasoned context with a clear path to action .', 'Indicator belong at the beginning , not the end , of a good governance process .', 'The next article specifies much more clearly what might be meant by the notion of good governance .', 'In Designing Good Urban Governance Indicator : The Importance of Citizen Participation and its Evaluation in Greater Vancouver , political scientist Kennedy Stewart makes the case for inclusion of governance consideration in any definition of sustainability .', "The political aspect of sustainability is poorly developed , compared to economic , environmental , and social aspect and this article moves the thinking ahead through treatment of democratic theory , along with work on defining 'good governance ' advanced by the United Nations .", 'Stewart draws on evidence of voting pattern in the Vancouver region to raise the spectre of systematic disenfranchisement , that seems to be on the rise .', "As Canada 's only unamalgamated major metropolitan region , led by municipal appointment rather than direct election , advance in sustainable development policy made by the Greater Vancouver Regional District are at risk if voting trend can not be reversed .", 'Stewart calls for stepwise moral reasoning , based on the premise of universal equal right to rectify this wrong .', "The final two article examine the limit of belonging to the project of sustainability in the Vancouver region , from the perspective of the region 's newest resident and its ancestral resident .", 'Robert Fiedler , Nadine Schuurman and Jennifer Hyndman , in Hidden Homelessness : An Indicator - Based Approach for Examining the Geographies of Recent Immigrant At-Risk of Homelessness in Greater Vancouver , focus on the dimension of risk of homelessness amongst one particularly vulnerable group , new immigrant .', 'This investigation brings to the fore the interaction of policy , economics , and culture in explaining the complexity of homelessness and immigration trend in the region .', "Since about half of the region 's population growth in the foreseeable future will come from international immigration , and an increasing proportion of new arrival face socio-economic difficulty upon arrival , understanding these interaction is key to sustainability in a context of increasing cultural diversity and decreasing affordability of housing .", 'First Nations researcher Nathan Cardinal puts an Aboriginal lens on indicator in his concluding article , The Exclusive City : Identifying , Measuring and Drawing Attention to Aboriginal and Indigenous Experiences in an Urban Context .', 'Along with immigrant , Aboriginal group constitute fast growing demographic cultural group in British Columbia .', 'Right to public space : Law , culture , and gentrification in the American west .', 'This book examines the role that public space play in gentrification .', 'Considering both cultural norm of public behavior and the municipal regulation of behavior in public , it shows how commonplace act in everyday public space like sidewalk , street , and park work to establish neighborhood legitimacy for newcomer while delegitimizing once authentic public practice of long-timers .', 'With evidence drawn from the formerly Latino neighborhood of Highland in Denver , Colorado , this ethnographic study demonstrates how the regulation of public space plays a pivotal role in neighborhood change .', 'First , there is often a profound disharmony between how people from different cultural complex interpret and sanction behavior in everyday public space .', 'Second , because regulation , code , urban design , and enforcement protocol are deliberately changed , commonplace activity longtime neighborhood resident feel they have a right to do along sidewalk and street and within their neighborhood park sometimes unexpectedly misalign with what is actually possible or legal to do in these publicly accessible space .', 'Shifting gear : The intersection of race and sustainability in Memphis .', 'Memphis is a city of dichotomy and disparity , a perplexing city of illustrative idiosyncrasy and instructive irony .', 'The city roils with a sweaty , gritty , creative energy , yet it has struggled to find a creative solution to overcoming its challenging past .', 'As a global center of commerce and trade , the prosperity of the United States relies heavily on Memphis , yet Memphis is home to some of the nation ’ s most impoverished community .', 'The city is stretched geographically , fiscally , and socially in so many direction that gaining a sense of unity around any shared cultural ideal is a daunting exercise , one that Memphis has only recently begun to undertake .', 'This chapter explores the emergence of “ sustainability ” in policy making and cultural perception in Memphis through conversation and controversy surrounding a proposal to institute a multi-use trail network across a geophysical landscape marked by socioeconomic and racial segregation .', 'As Wanda Rushing ( 2009 ) puts it , “ for more than one hundred year , changing view of space and place , conflicting value of ‘ progress ’ and preservation , as well as division of race , class , and gender have affected the physical and symbolic production of urban landscape in Memphis ” ( Rushing 2009 ) .', 'How does the concept of “ sustainability ” as a social ideal play into the policy and decision making that are going to shape the future of a global city mired in a history of especially poor race relation , white flight , and cultural isolationism ?', 'A conversation on “ sustainability ” can not occur without first dismantling a racialized “ culture of fear ” that impacts nearly every aspect of urban life in Memphis ( Glassner 2000 ) .', 'To accomplish this , we dissect the discourse and practice associated with “ community ” and “ safety ” as they relate to transportation policy , urban planning , and alternative transportation infrastructure project .', 'We demonstrate how “ safety ” and “ community ” take on different meaning , even in adjoining neighborhood , and provide ethnographic snapshot of people and community affecting ( or affected by ) various connectivity and livability project .']

['Urban sustainability transition .', 'The world ’ s population is currently undergoing a significant transition towards urbanisation , with the UN expecting that 70 % of people globally will live in city by 2050 .', 'Urbanisation has multiple political , cultural , environmental and economic dimension that profoundly influence social development and innovation .', 'This fundamental long-term transformation will involve the realignment of urban society ’ s technology and infrastructure , culture and lifestyle , as well as governance and institutional framework .', 'Such structural systemic realignments can be referred to as urban sustainability transition : fundamental and structural change in urban system through which persistent societal challenge are addressed , such as shift towards urban farming , renewable decentralised energy system , and social economy .', 'This book provides new insight into how sustainability transition unfold in different type of city across the world and explores possible strategy for governing urban transition , emphasising the co-evolution of material and institutional transformation in socio-technical and socio-ecological system .', 'With case study of mega-cities such as Seoul , Tokyo , New York and Adelaide , medium-sized city such as Copenhagen , Cape Town and Portland , and nonmetropolitan city such as Freiburg , Ghent and Brighton , the book provides an opportunity to reflect upon the comparability and transferability of theoretical/conceptual construct and governance approach across geographical contexts .', 'Urban Sustainability Transitions is key reading for student and scholar working in Environmental Sciences , Geography , Urban Studies , Urban Policy and Planning .', 'Population and climate change .. To review , the four broad dimension of any complex human problem , including climate change , are the human population , economics , culture , and environment .', 'These dimension interact with one another in all direction and on many time-scales .', 'From 2010 to 2050 , the human population is likely to grow bigger , more slowly , older , and more urban .', "It is projected that by 2050 more than 2.6 billion people ( almost 94 % of global urban growth ) will be added to the urban population in today 's developing country .", "That works out to 1.26 million additional urban people in today 's developing country every week from 2010 to 2050 .", 'Human alter the climate by emitting greenhouse gas , by altering planetary albedo , and by altering atmospheric component .', "Between 1900 and 2000 , human ' emission of carbon into the atmosphere increased fifteenfold , while the number of people increased less than fourfold .", 'Population growth alone , with constant rate of emission per person , could not account for the increase in the carbon emission to the atmosphere .', 'The world economy grew sixteenfold in the twentieth century , accompanied by enormous increase in the burning of gas , oil , and coal .', 'In the last quarter of the twentieth century , population grew much faster in developing country than in high-income country , and , compared with population growth , the growth of carbon emission to the atmosphere was even faster in developing country than in high-income country .', 'The ratio of emissions-to-population growth rate was 2.8 in developing country compared with 1.6 in high-income country .', 'Emission of CO2 and other greenhouse gas are influenced by the size and density of settlement , the size of household , and the age of householder .', 'Between 2010 and 2050 , these demographic factor are anticipated to change substantially .', 'Therefore demography will play a substantial role in the dynamic of climate change .', 'Climate change affect many aspect of the living environment , including human settlement , food production , and disease .', 'These change will affect poor people more severely than rich , and poor nation more severely than rich .', 'Yet not enough is known to predict quantitatively many detail that will matter enormously to future people and other specie .', 'Three kind of response are related to demographic issue that affect climate change : universal secondary education , voluntary contraception and maternal health service , and smarter urban design and construction .', 'These response may prevent , reduce , or ameliorate the impact of climate change .', 'They are as relevant to rich country as to poor , though in way that are as different as are rich country and poor .', 'They are desirable in their own right because they improve the life of the people they affect directly ; and they are desirable for their beneficial effect on the larger society and globe .', 'They are effective response to the twin challenge of reducing poverty and reducing greenhouse gas emission .', 'Human futuristics and urban planning .', 'Human futuristics , as a study of future cultural alternative , limitation , and choice , will not be another branch of “ science ” in the traditional sense .', 'Its function-will differ from that of science in many respect .', 'First , future culture are not existing “ object ” to be observed , analyzed , and explained .', 'Second , future culture can not be predicted by extrapolating the past pattern of change , the past rate of change , or even past rate of acceleration of change .', 'There are too many unprecedented innovation taking place which render extrapolation invalid .', 'Third , culture change do not just happen .', 'People make them happen .', 'Therefore culture change are subject to people ’ s goal , imagination , will , and choice .', 'Mental map of the city : Element of visual argumentation and creativity in modern city planning [ Miesto mentalinis žemėlapis : Vizualinio argumentavimo elementai ir kūrybiškumas šiuolaikinio miesto planavimo procese ] .', 'Lewis Mumford in The City in History ( first edition in 1961 ) emphasises that the structure of modern city is partially responsible for many social problem seen in Western society .', 'Urban planning should concentrate on an organic relationship between people and their living space .', 'The city is a product of Earth , a fact of nature , man ’ s method of expression , Mumford writes in his The Culture of Cities ( first edition in 1938 ) .', 'This also means that both the designer and the user must have a high degree of creativity in order to design and utilise the built environment .', 'By analysing the definition of the city Mumford examines its change during history from ancient time to recent planning method .', 'He criticises the most dominant design process of the 20th century : the functionalist and mechanical urban design .', 'He is an advocate of the organic method in planning and understanding city .', 'The organic approach requires an active and creative approach as opposed to mere passive reception .', 'This organic approach by Mumford to understanding city is based on the theory of Kevin A. Lynch .', 'We may distinguish 3 normative way of city planning theory : ( 1 ) the cosmic , ( 2 ) the mechanic and ( 3 ) the organic model .', 'In my paper I will first apply the onion model of culture developed by Geert Hofstede for the city and its analysis , and also for the appearance of creativity in them .', 'After that I am going to examine the city with a special , architectural based mind map theory : the five element by Lynch .', 'Lynch suggests that these five element ( path , edge , district , node , landmark ) create the mental map for readability .', 'Finally , I will investigate a usage of mental map in modern city planning ( Le Corbusier ) and works on the process of “ debabelisation ” ( Otto Neurath ) .', 'Future metropolis .', 'Florida is an American urban study theorist , head of the Martin Prosperity institute at the Rotman school of Management , university of Toronto , and a doyen of the urban planning sector , so when he speaks the community listen .', 'Modern city are at the heart of economic growth , driving innovation and delivering a breeding ground for culture .', 'With greater size comes enhanced efficiency , but for large city to maximize this potential they need to attract innovative people and investment to make the idea happen .', 'They need to find a way to leverage the benefit big city bring , while managing the inevitable challenge they face .', 'Social and economic pressure , plus these technological opportunity , create challenge for city that engineer working in a multidisciplinary environment are well placed to address .', 'These are simple example of city system being made more efficient through an integrated approach and the use of technology .', 'This is a growing opportunity for the engineering community to work collaboratively and innovatively with technology partner to find real world solution .', 'Research on historical district soundscape and city design .', "This paper study the soundscape and the surrounding environmental characteristic in a large urban historic district of Guangzhou - `` Xiguan Area '' , explores people 's perception on the soundmarks in this region and estimate the surrounding environment through method of soundwalk and on-site interview .", "The study result show that : the local language and drama - Cantonese and Cantonese song are the most important soundmarks in this region ; the sound of chess entertainment inside the small street , as well as the sound of production at workshop truly reflect the urban cultural ecology and people 's lifestyle in city ; the sound of business activity in multiple location and different period reflect the localization to this region in city planning .", 'According to the characteristic of sound and environment , this paper proposes an urban design strategy by combing the soudnscape element historic district characteristic and connotation of historic culture life .']

['Community of trust : A socio-cultural approach for community planning and the case of Gaza .', 'This paper defines Community of Trust as socio-spatial setting in which there are substantial trust relationship among people and where they feel defended ( safe ) from internal risk .', 'Our scheme suggests five category of condition that together create Community of Trust : Shared place , shared daily-life practice , shared basic beliefs , and shared perception of community interest and risk .', 'This scheme was examined in five community in Gaza city .', "Data were collected first by informal talk with resident and local decision-makers and then by mean of 973 personal interview in resident ' home .", 'Undoubtedly , the human condition of the people of Gaza are among the worst in the world .', 'Living condition in the city have been difficult for the past century due to a number of factor , including : wave of incoming Palestinian refugee of the War of 1948 , and decade of Israeli occupation .', "In spite of difficult housing condition , poor service and the pressure of lasting internal risk , this study found livable community and strong trust relationship among people of Gaza 's community .", 'This article explains this by the high level of agreement on basic beliefs , the shared daily-life practice , the strong shared perception towards external risk and a few common interest , which were found within each studied area .', 'The last part of the paper is related to the issue of generalizing from the case of homogeneous urban community in Gaza to the frequently heterogeneous community of Western city .', 'This study concludes that trust relationship are the corner-stone upon which community are based anywhere in the world .', 'Hence , in order to sustain community , planner should support trust relationship among resident .', 'This requires culture-sensitive planning .', 'Human Nature , Society and the Home .', "The New Psychology ' , which combines biology , psychology and the social science , is now generating considerable insight and debate .", "Such work gives special emphasis to 'the expressive order ; people 's own understanding and statement deriving from the innate drive affecting their behaviour as well as the socially-constructed culture of which they are part .", 'Housing and urban study , this paper suggests , should be part of these development .', 'Involvement in such issue should , for example , help us address question which have recently been raised in Housing Study by Saunders and Williams .', 'They underlined the fact that the home is of central significance to the life of individual and they suggested that the significance of the home for contemporary social change has been underestimated .', "The intention of the present paper is to suggest that the new synthesis of ethology , sociobiology , social psychology and sociology might be one mean of establishing the home 's wider significance and its centrality to people 's life and identity .", 'This paper concludes by arguing that housing study could make major contribution to this emergent combination of the natural and social science .', 'Plug & play place : Lifeworlds of multilocal creative knowledge worker .', 'In post-industrial society more and more people earn an income in creative knowledge work , a highly flexible labour market segment that demands a geographically mobile workforce .', 'Creative knowledge work is based on an understanding of language , culture and symbolic meaning .', 'This can best be obtained through local and national embeddedness .', 'Yet , this necessity for embeddedness stand in contrast to the demand in geographical mobility .', 'How is this contradiction solved by individual ?', 'What new form of place attachment does this bring about ?', 'This book introduces a showcase of 25 multilocal creative knowledge worker , who live in different country at the same time .', 'It investigates how continuous mobility becomes part of their lifeworld , and how it changes their feeling of belonging and practice of place attachment .', 'Applying an innovative methodological mix of social phenomenology , hermeneutics and mental mapping , this book takes a detailed look at biography and the role of place in mobile lifeworlds .', "Plug & Play Places brings forth the idea that place have to be understood as individual item , which are configured and then plugged into the 'system ' of the own lifeworld .", "They can be 'played ' without great effort once an individual need to make use of them .", 'This new type of place attachment is a form of subjective standardization of place , which complements the well-known model of objective standardization of place .', 'Plug & Play Places is relevant for scientist who deal with mobility and its impact on individual lifeworlds , with transnational multilocality and with flexibilized labour market .', 'Furthermore , the book provides a detailed qualitative perspective which can enrich the explanation of quantitative research in the same field .', 'It is an interesting reading also for practitioner engaged in urban planning , housing and real estate development .', 'What is the urban without physical mobility ?', 'COVID-19-induced immobility in the mobile risk society .', 'Since the World Health Organization ’ s ( WHO ) declared the Coronavirus outbreak a global pandemic , the virus has invaded life around the globe .', 'The ongoing health , social and economic crisis that followed forced urban life , business , culture , community etc .', 'into idle mode for week resulting from mandated immobility .', 'What was once taken for granted as the essence of urban experience such as cultural activity , meeting friend , relative and colleague in public space or in professional encounter , disappeared overnight .', 'Free movement became significantly restricted all over the world .', 'It seemed that immobility , social and physical distancing , and isolation were the only antidote to the fast-moving virus .', 'For many people , working from home while also schooling their child and providing social care at a distance , peak activity at maximum physical immobility became the “ new normal.', '” A culture emerged where rule and norm of mobility previously taken for granted were re-negotiated and re-defined .', 'Before the crisis and despite the negative ecological side effect , mobility has been positively connotated as a signifier for progress and success .', 'Under the Corona regime mobility turned into a life-threatening risk .', 'The theory of reflexive modernization , risk society and the mobility paradigm are used to discuss these contemporary shift and transformation .', 'Welcome city : Refugee in three German city .', 'Since late 2015 , the author have studied the refugee crisis in Europe .', 'In this article , we analyze local factor that are significant for urban planning to include in an integration plan through case study in three city in Germany .', 'We have chosen to study Germany because of the country ’ s touted Willkommen Kultur ( welcome culture ) , which was prompted in large part by Chancellor Angela Merkel ’ s “ Flüchtlinge Willkommen ” ( “ refugee welcome ” ) stance .', 'Now , three year after Chancellor Merkel ’ s declaration to the world , although international and national policy set many parameter for refugee integration , responses to the uncertainty of the situation are fundamentally informed by local contexts .', 'Germany has adopted a policy of distributing refugee to community throughout the country according to the so-called “ Königstein Key ” , which sets quota for each state according to economic capacity .', 'We have selected case study city and a county that are at different scale and region : Borken in Hessen ( 13,500 people ) , Kassel County ( 200,000 ) , and Essen , a larger city ( 600,000 ) .', 'Here we investigate the way in which German citizen and refugee interact and integrate , with a focus on the social-spatial aspect of refugee experience and the impact on urban planning policy , urban morphology , building typology , and pattern language formation .', 'Beyond crisis , we are looking at how refugee can and will try to integrate into their host country , city , and neighborhood and start a new life and how host community respond to refugee arrival .', 'Urban architecture project for housing and work opportunity that help the process of integration are part of this study .', 'Particularly , in this article , we investigate the reality on the ground of the positive Willkommen Kultur and the high expectation and implied promise that were set in 2015 by Chancellor Angela Merkel and German society .', 'Women ’ s behaviour in public space and the influence of privacy as a cultural value : The case of Nablus , Palestine .', 'The aim of this paper is to study how woman ’ s privacy need are met through the physical form of public space in both old and new urban design , using as a case study the city of Nablus , Palestine , which has been significantly influenced by the culture of gender separation .', 'The finding will help develop a better understanding of the relationship between woman ’ s privacy and the physical form of public space and will enhance the development of public space that woman can use comfortably and actively to participate in the urban life .', 'An environmental approach based on the concept of behavioural setting was used to examine woman ’ s privacy issue in the chosen public space .', 'Direct observation and questionnaire were used in the fieldwork , in addition to interview with woman and relevant people who influence the woman ’ s privacy .', 'Maps ( GIS ) , sketch and SPSS technique were used to interpret the data .', 'Urban cohesion vis-à-vis organic spatialization of “ Third place ” in Saudi Arabia : The need for an alternative planning praxis .', 'Many medium-sized middle-eastern city like Khobar in Saudi Arabia have become a popular destination for predominantly low-to semi-skilled expatriate worker from several South and South East Asian country .', 'The social spatialization of these working class people has been manifested in compartmentalized public space as specific ethnic oriented “ third place ” , such as Filipino market , Bangladeshi bazaar , and Pakistani neighborhood .', 'Yet , there is no research scholarship available on the nature and type of such third place and their importance and influence on plan making process in the middle-eastern context .', 'Certain ( re- ) defining theme , notably expressing and celebrating everyday culture , feeling of home being away from home , sense of place , and center place for socialization and integration emerge to brand these place as we explored empirical evidence with grounded theory centered socio-cultural lens .', 'Additionally , exploring spatio-temporal permeability of these third place using Space Syntax accessibility model helped us to draw critical insight about how such lesson and practice can challenge the contemporary city planning and design practice .', 'Critical planning intervention like collaborative governance of third place as proposed here can be adopted in making city like Khobar cohesive .', '( Re ) framing spatiality as a socio-cultural paradigm : Examining the iranian housing culture and process .', 'With rapid change in urban living today , people ’ behavioural pattern and spatial practice undergo a constant process of adaptation and negotiation .', 'Using “ house ” as a laboratory and everyday life and spatial relation of resident as a framework of analysis , the paper examines the spatial planning concept in traditional and contemporary Iranian architecture and the associated socio-cultural practice .', 'Discussion are drawn upon from a pilot study conducted in the city of Kerman , to investigate way in which contemporary housing solution can better cater to the continually changing socio-cultural lifestyle of resident .', 'Data collection for the study involved a series of participatory workshop and employed creative visual research method , participant observation and semi structured interview to examine the interlacing of everyday socio-spatial relation and changing perception of identity , belonging , socio-cultural and religious value and conflict .', 'The inference from the study showcases the emerging social and cultural need and practice of people manifested through the complex relationship between resident , the place in which they live , and its spatial planning and organisation .', 'For a better understanding of this complex relationship , the paper argues the need for resituating spatiality as a socio-cultural paradigm .', 'Designing for small bathroom .', 'This paper will focus on how to design a series of bathroom product that work well for small bathroom using the principle of universal design .', 'In home culture research , Quitzau and Røpke has studied bathroom transformation from hygiene to well-being .', 'Bathroom are one of the room in apartment that do not have good solution for small space .', 'This is unfortunate since it is the bathroom that has the least amount of space in urban apartment .', 'This leads many people to have too little bathroom space due to furniture , toilet , shower , etc .', "In today 's society , the bathroom is no longer just a purpose room .", 'It is used for relaxation and wellness .', "This has led to a trend where large furniture , such as freestanding bathtubs , dominate today 's market .", 'This in turn allows the few solution that exist for small bathroom to remain poorly conceived .', 'The research question was therefore how to create solution for small bathroom to get the same sense of well-being as in larger bathroom through universal design principal .', 'The principle of universal design , observation and in-depth interview were used in the study .', 'This study can help to create a greater understanding of how to design small bathroom .', 'It will be relevant in a cross disciplinary field , including for professional in plumbing , product design and technical solution .', 'This will also increase the well-being of user of the bathroom .']

['Revanchist sanitisation or coercive care ?', 'The use of enforcement to combat begging , street drinking and rough sleeping in England .', "This paper examines recent response to 'problematic street culture ' in England , where increasing pressure has been exerted to prevent people from begging and street drinking in public space , with rough sleeping also targeted in some area .", "Drawing upon in-depth interview with enforcement agent , support provider and targeted individual , it assesses the extent to which the strategy employed are indicative of a 'revanchist expulsion ' of the deviant Other and/or an expression of 'coercive care ' for the vulnerable Other .", 'It concludes that , whilst the recent development appear , at first glance , to be symptomatic of revanchist sanitisation of public space , closer examination reveals that the situation is actually much more complex than a revanchist reading of the situation might suggest , and perhaps not as devoid of compassion .', 'Scale , regime , and the urban governance of Glasgow .', 'Over the last two decade , urban regime theory has become one of the most dominant paradigms of thought in urban study .', 'In particular , regime theory offers a complex account of urban governance , or how local government , the business community , and community organization gain the capacity to shape the policy that affect city , that is , govern .', 'Although regime theory is a dominant theory in urban study , it does , nevertheless , have its share of detractor , and one criticism has been its failure to take into account geographical scale .', 'While there is an acknowledgment in urban regime theory of wider economic process , such as the broad transformation in international and national trade , investment , finance , etc.', ', or the role played by federal or state government , the bias has remained mostly local , particularly in regard to urban governance .', 'In urban regime theory literature the policy and action of international and national institution either nicely conjoin with local interest or are nearly totally absent .', 'Due to this oversight , urban regime theory tends to underemphasize how the capacity to govern a city effectively is sometimes the result of the interaction of action of people at multiple scale .', 'This article attempts to address this oversight in an analysis of Glasgow , Scotland , during the 1980s .', 'By focusing on the role of the European City of Culture in the revitalization of the city , this article demonstrates how the capacity for a ruling coalition to transform the city and to govern effectively was the consequence of the policy and administrative action undertaken at other geographical scale .', 'The governance of homelessness in the European South : Spatial and institutional contexts of philanthrophy in Athens .', 'This paper aims at shedding some light , by contrasting the discourse and practice of shelter-providers and welfare agency which manage the homeless in Athens , on the way in which culture and power combine to produce segmented response to homelessness in the European South .', 'It is argued that central state , local state , church and voluntary agency resort to different understanding of pity in order to acknowledge responsibility for different group of homeless people and shape action in a variety of local setting .', "Official rhetoric address visible homelessness but conceals exclusion , selecting deserving from non-deserving client and 'clean-ups ' of public space .", 'Radical voice aim at revealing hidden homelessness and sustain inclusive practice such as street or community work , but they fail to secure access for the homeless to housing , income and good quality of care .', 'Why Gayborhoods Matter : The Street Empirics of Urban Sexualities .', 'Urbanists have developed an extensive set of proposition about why gay neighborhood form , how they change , shift in their significance , and their spatial expression .', 'Existing research in this emerging field of “ gayborhood study ” emphasizes macro-structural explanatory variable , including the economy ( e.g.', ', land value , urban governance , growth machine politics , affordability , and gentrification ) , culture ( e.g.', ', public opinion , societal acceptance , and assimilation ) , and technology ( e.g.', ', geo-coded mobile apps , online dating service ) .', 'In this chapter , I use the residential logic of queer people—why they in their own word say that they live in a gay district—to show how gayborhoods acquire their significance on the street .', 'By shifting the analytic gaze from abstract concept to interaction and embodied perception on the ground—a “ street empirics ” as I call it—I challenge the claim that gayborhoods as an urban form are outmoded or obsolete .', 'More generally , my finding caution against adopting an exclusively supra-individual approach in urban study .', 'The reason that resident provide for why their neighborhood appeal to them showcase the analytic power of the street for understanding what place mean and why they matter .', 'Young adult and the decline of the urban English pub : Issue for planning .', "The number of English public house or `` pubs '' have reduced significantly in the last two decade .", 'Politician have called on the planning system to resist their closure but , at the same time , demand further controls over high-street bar .', "This paper explores the reason for the decline and the rationale for supporting the continuation of the `` traditional '' English pub .", "Using evidence drawn from a wider study of the relationship between place and youth drinking culture , the paper discusses young adult ' use of pub .", 'While recognising the adverse effect of heavy drinking , argument are put forward in support of the traditional pub as a site for restrained and responsible social interaction for young adult .', 'The paper discusses the issue this raises for the UK planning system in the context of responsibility for social sustainability and public health .', 'Conflict Activity in the Neighborhoods of Quebec City ( Canada ) , 1989-2000 .', 'This research focuses on the analysis of the spatial distribution of 149 urban conflict occurring between 1989 and 2000 in Quebec City , Canada .', 'Specifically , the article explores the relationship between the spatial dynamic of the conflicts-in term of frequency , duration , and intensity-and the following four dimension of urban space : social composition ; built environment ; propensity to associate and to voice ; and accessibility to various urban resource .', 'The result of statistical analysis by mean of a Kruskal-Wallis test and a Mann-Whitney test show , regardless of the dimension considered , to what extent certain area are characterized by frequency , duration , or intensity of the conflict activity .', 'Specifically , the result suggest that the degree of involvement of local people in a conflict varies very much depending on the nature of the social composition .', 'Other finding show a relationship between area with a high propensity to associate and to voice and a conflict activity that is more intense , more frequent , but not necessarily longer .', 'These form of social practice are thus testimony to the existence of know-how , i.e.', ', a culture of conflict activity oriented towards efficiency .', 'Racial projection : cyberspace , public space , and the digital divide .', 'Scholar of critical race study , urban history , and information and communications technology ( ICTs ) share an interest in the relationship between spatial and racial disparity , including the quality of basic infrastructure , degree of connectivity , and participatory culture .', 'However , contemporary research on the digital divide struggles to link historical legacy of uneven development , as well as social justice strategy , with digital participation in urban space .', 'By examining contemporary digital art that critiques the spatial inequality encountered by U.S. racial minority , this article illustrates how public intellectual use ICTs in way that draw upon past strategy to territorialize space for political end .', 'It focuses on digital pop-up , open-air installation that cast image onto public space using projector .', 'Historicizing these new effort illustrates a continuity of tactic engaged by community of color in response to socio-spatial inequality in the urban United States , such as the 1970s mural movement ’ s effort to re-politicize space of exclusion .', 'While existing literature finds that digital inequality result in differential digital human capital , this research indicates that place-based claim , such as digital pop-up , are important site for combatting racial injustice and creating more inclusionary space , especially among youth adult .', 'Festive City : Multi-Dimensional Perspective .', 'Until recently there has been limited attention paid in urban study to feature that relate to sensory , not material feature , to consumption not production , pleasure not work , and to episodic rather than permanent characteristic .', 'However festival , episodic event lasting a few day , do provide such function .', 'They take people outside their routine behaviours of work , leisure and family , providing joy , excitement and new experience , sometimes linking to historical tradition .', 'Although such event have always been part of the life of the bigger place , new valuation of their utility have led to an enormous growth in such activity in recent decade , both in number within city , and many other urban place , adding to their vitality and often providing major economic return .', 'A review of the variety of festival show that most fall into six main type , linked to temporal or cyclical , religious , political , tradition-heritage , new culture and lifestyle function , although some may overlap the category and others have morphed from one type to another through time .', 'A multidimensional model of the nature of festival based on eight component provides a basis for assessing their varied character and reveals their often contradictory nature and conflicted consequence .', 'Hybrid coordination of city organisation : The rule of people and culture in the shadow of structure .', 'Under far-reaching reform , many city have delegated core task previously delivered by their administration to independent organisation that they formally own , e.g .', 'municipal company , or supervise , e.g .', 'municipal trust fund .', 'The coordination of these ( as we call them ) ‘ domestic ’ city organisation has proven challenging .', 'Extant literature argues that such coordination is achieved through a mix of various hierarchical , market and network mechanism .', 'Yet it is unclear how these mode are combined .', 'Addressing this gap , we ask : How do governance mode interact in the hybrid coordination of domestic city organisation ?', 'Analysing the case of Vienna , where 100 domestic organisation employ about 60,000 people , we find that while cultural mechanism , rooted in the network mode , are predominant , they unfold in the shadow of latent structural mechanism , which are associated with hierarchy and market .', 'In the background , structural mechanism keep cultural coordination effective , while cultural mechanism allow structural coordination to remain ( generally ) hidden .', 'This study aims to contribute to the literature on the governance of public organisation by exploring the relationship between governance mode as well as furthering urban governance study by applying insight from study on the coordination of public organisation to the city context .', 'Offending sight and urban governance : Expectation of city aesthetic and spatial response to the unsightly .', 'The problem of incivility seems to be considerably connected to the visibility of unsightly behaviour .', 'Factor such as urban attractiveness and visibility of the homelessness play important role in urban social control and have led to the sanitisation and gentrification of city centre .', 'Visual exposure is also relevant to how people perceive and respond to crime .', 'In time of Selfie Culture , where it seems particularly important to some people that the background of their image is beautiful and ( Insta ) grammable , the right to expose one ’ s unappetising vulnerability ( e.g .', 'homelessness ) to the public may clash with others ’ belief in their entitlement to not see anything ugly or with expectation for urban space to be ordered according to mainstream norm of aesthetic acceptability .', 'The chapter , first , addresses the visibility of incivility , framing the regulation of offending sight within the gaze-dependent culture .', 'Next , it looks at the contemporary urban response to the vulnerable group many deem unsightly , focusing in particular on the spatial-defensive measure aimed at removing certain marginal group , such as the homeless and youth , from urban space .', 'It then critically examines the wider societal and normative implication of such social control .', 'The chapter concludes with some reflection on defensive architecture within securitised society , and policy consideration .']

['Typhoid fever in child aged less than 5 year .', 'Background .', 'Calculation of the incidence of typhoid fever during preschool year is important to define the optimum age of immunisation and the choice of vaccine for public-health programme in developing country .', 'Hospital-based study have suggested that child younger than 5 year do not need vaccination against typhoid fever , but this view needs to be re-examined in community-based longitudinal study .', 'We undertook a prospective follow-up study of resident of a low-income urban area of Delhi , India , with active surveillance for case detection .', 'Method .', 'A baseline census was undertaken in 1995 .', 'Between Nov 1 , 1995 , and Oct 31 , 1996 , we visited 8172 resident of 1820 household in Kalkaji , Delhi , twice weekly to detect febrile case .', 'Blood sample were obtained from febrile patient , and those who tested positive for Salmonella typhi were treated with ciprofloxacin .', 'Finding .', '63 culture-positive typhoid fever case were detected .', 'Of these , 28 ( 44 % ) were in child aged under 5 year .', 'The incidence rate of typhoid per 1000 person-years was 27.3 at age under 5 year , 11.7 at 5-19 year , and 1.1 between 19 and 40 year .', 'The difference in the incidence of typhoid fever between those under 5 year and those aged 5-19 year ( 15.6 per 1000 person-years [ 95 % CI 4.7-26.5 ] ) , and those aged 19-40 year ( 26.2 [ 16.0-36.3 ] ) was significant ( p < 0.001 far both ) .', 'The difference between the incidence of typhoid at 5-19 year and the incidence at 19-40 year was also significant ( 10.6 [ 6.3-14.8 ] , p < 0 001 ) .', 'Morbidity in those under 5 and in older people was similar in term of duration of fever , sign and symptom , and need for hospital admission .', 'Interpretation .', 'Our finding challenge the common view that typhoid fever is a disorder of school-age child and of adult .', 'Typhoid is a common and significant cause of morbidity between 1 and 5 year of age .', 'The optimum age of typhoid immunisation and the choice of vaccine need to be reassessed.This study was conducted to measure the incidence of typhoid fever among preschooler .', 'It was suggested that child aged 5 year do not need vaccination against typhoid fever .', 'However , it is important to re-examine this view , particularly in infant and young child in the low-income urban area of Delhi , India , through active surveillance .', 'Blood sample were obtained from febrile patient , and those who tested positive for Salmonella typhi were treated with ciprofloxacin .', 'Finding revealed 63 culture-positive typhoid fever case , about 44 % of which were in child under 5 year of age .', 'Morbidity in child under age 5 and in older people was similar in term of duration of fever , sign and symptom , and the need for hospital admission .', 'The incidence of typhoid fever and the age distribution of the case varied between developing country .', 'Thus , the age pattern of typhoid fever observed in the urban study area may differ in rural area within India or in other developing country .', 'A reevaluation of the optimum age and vaccine of choice is needed .', 'Factor affecting compliance with residential standard in the city of Old Salt , Jordan .', 'The aim of this paper is to examine the factor which impact on the extent to which urban housing complies with residential standard in the city of Old Salt based in Jordan .', 'The research found that the level of compliance with residential standard is quite low and can vary from one standard to another and from one house to another due to difference in the socio-economic characteristic among people .', 'The finding of multiple regression analysis reveal that there is a good level of public awareness of residential standard , but this does not result in complete compliance with residential standard .', 'Factor , such as household income per month , household size , finance facility , municipal administration culture , monitoring , enforcement and the uncertainty of residential standard have a significant impact on the extent of compliance with planning standard .', 'Suggestion for improved urban planning practice which address these issue are summarised in the paper and include reassessed current residential standard through comprehensive legal framework , linking residential standard with urban design approach , changing planning practice , developing information system to produce effective monitoring system of construction process and enforcement mechanism , the development of local staff including planner , designer and environmental engineer , supported partnership between private and public sector , and the use of participatory planning and citizen involvement .', 'A sociotechnical approach to cause of urban blight using fuzzy cognitive mapping and system dynamic .', 'Urban blight often is prominent in urban environment .', 'It consists of real estate degradation to the extent that blighted residential property , unfortunately , may provide housing only for the poorest social class .', 'Urban blight reduces real property value in urban neighborhood and urban center , reduces business investment and increases unemployment .', 'Urban blight is not static , but continuously changing , either getting worse or improving .', 'Thus , it is an issue of growing concern for urban decision maker who may attempt to determine its cause .', 'Determining cause of urban blight facilitates the development of strategic measure for the prevention and potential eradication of this phenomenon .', 'This study seeks to bolster the identification of factor that cause urban blight and makes important contribution to both the academic community and society at large .', 'By combining fuzzy cognitive mapping and the system dynamic approach , our proposal facilitates the identification of urban blight determinant and the development of alternative to control and eradicate them .', 'Data used in our study were provided by a panel of urban blight expert , and allowed for the identification of the following major cause of urban blight : deficiency in sociability and/or culture ; unfavorable economic and financial factor ; policy and/or administrative shortage ; lack of urban regeneration ; insecurity for people and asset ; and building and/or surroundings defect .', 'The result of our decision-support system were analyzed and validated by an independent expert who works for the Lisbon City Council in Portugal .', 'Recommendation for future research are also provided .', 'Eco-development and environmental spatial planning .', 'Development is directly related to the spatial planning ( regional and urban ) .', 'Nowadays , humanity faces a multidimensional crisis , socio-economic crisis , cultural crisis , which is directly related to the environmental one .', 'In the last few decade , the current development model has been questioned by international organization and scientist of various specialization .', 'Sustainable development or ecodevelopment approaching interdisciplinary the problem explores the exit from the socio-economic and environmental crisis .', 'The purpose of this study is to comprehensively examine the content of ecodevelopment and to express it in simple word , so as to be understood by people .', 'In particular , it aims to review and clarify the concept of eco-development , defining its content in its entirety , considering it together with the role of spatial planning ( regional and urban ) and suggesting method of organization of society , to provide better quality of life and achieve the exit from the crisis .', 'A need to create a new model based on the concept of ecosystem arises from the research , where the law of nature and culture of each place will be seriously considered in formulating development policy .', 'A key-element for ecological spatial planning is the carrying capacity of ecosystem .', "The aim of spatial planning appears to be the sustainability of natural system in order to be able to sustain and supply the anthropogenic system , meeting the 'real ' human need .", 'For the implementation of these and the exit from the crisis of utmost importance the role of education is highlighted in creating active citizen , who are required to undertake , through self-organization [ 1 , 2 ] , to promote eco-development and eco-design .', 'The role of smart city application in the development of IDP area in war country .', 'The aim of this paper is the role that smart city application can play in the development and sustainability process in country that have been hit by crisis such as the Syrian Arab Republic , particularly Lattakia , which has been hit by a big displacement crisis .', 'The displacement has become a big challenge for host community and IDPs .', 'Together , such as pressing 011 basic service and changing social need , adopting smart application as a step 011 the Smart City road can provide this city with an impressive leap and opportunity to make a technological change aimed at developing and improving service in a systematic and thoughtful maimer .', 'In the post-war city , the challenge are difficult and often the maintenance of old infrastructure can not be abandoned because of the cost and time required to activate new system , and other consideration related to the response City and population for sustainable development , with the ability of these application to collect and sense a large amount of information and Population and their lifestyle , thought , culture and heritage and the preservation of community and nature of the characteristic , where the acceptance of the people of this development an important and decisive factor in the process of transformation towards a smart city .', 'A fuzzy approach for assessment of smart socio-cultural attribute of a historic urban landscape : Case study of Alwar walled city in India .', 'Smartness is a vague concept with different meaning for different people .', 'It is imperative to harness the latent potential of existing settlement for an inclusive smart urban development .', 'The study aims to assess the socio-cultural attribute of an Indian historic urban landscape with a thriving residential culture .', 'Since data collection of neighborhood-level urban community is not feasible in India , a structured questionnaire was used to conduct household survey .', 'Such real-world phenomenon have inherent imprecision and ambiguity associated with human judgment .', 'Therefore , the survey item are assumed as fuzzy linguistic variable , and the raw dataset is transformed into triangular fuzzy number .', 'Fuzzy arithmetic and weighted averaging operator are applied for the hierarchical evaluation of indicator and variable .', 'A robust algorithm is used for the dimension reduction of a fuzzy coded dataset while dealing with subjective response .', 'The aggregated fuzzy score show an overall better performance of traditional community with respect to their socio-cultural attribute , such as a sense of safety and collective efficacy .', 'The application of fuzzy logic in urban planning and allied behavioral study can effectively and pragmatically deal with the inherent uncertainty in a humanistic system .', 'Future researcher may explore fuzzy multi-criteria evaluation approach for ordinal scale datasets .', 'Residential environment evaluation system considering environmental quality and environmental load for sustainable development of residential district ( part I ) : Residential environment quality .', 'Residential environment is one of the most important element for the quality of life , as well as the main support for the activity of economy , culture and society .', 'However , the improvement of residential environmental quality also has been increasing the consumption of energy and the emission of pollutant .', 'First , a systematic methodology for the evaluation of sustainable residential environment is established , considering both the residential environmental quality ( Q ) and the residential environmental load ( L ) .', 'The part of Q is constructed by safety , health , amenity , convenience and community of residential environment .', 'The part of L is about the environmental impact of the lifecycle of housing and community .', 'Then , the region of Yangtze River Delta of China is selected as the research area , because it is the most highly-growing area of China and gives great influence on other city .', 'As the first part of the research , the author performed questionnaire survey in Hangzhou and Shanghai focusing on the residential environmental quality ( Q ) , and analyzed the residential environmental satisfaction of people .', 'In the next step , the study on the index part of environmental load ( L ) will be performed , and the weight of each factor will be determined .', 'A desirability of the author is to obtain the result contributing to the sustainable development and improvement of urban residential environment for the rapidly developing China .',
