system to measure on road driving pattern .', 'Urban concept of a healthy city : Case study - Tripoli , Libya .', 'At a time when there is a close relationship between the occurrence of many type of disease and a city urban environment it appears that a more positive approach is needed for the integration of urban development and healthy city issue in urbanized area .', "It is against this background that the Healthy City project was established in order to consider way in which health-based approach can take place in our new city ' planning policy .", 'This research , which is based on the proceeding of such concept will discuss the role of the urban planning process in the improving of urban environmental quality in Tripoli city as a case study .', "Tripoli city accommodates more than 35 % of the total country 's population and which , by now , can be regarded as almost the antinomy of such a concept .", 'In this respect , architect and urban planner will play a substantial role in the trend toward the improvement of environmental quality which in consequence would lead to undertaking to protect people from the hazard of environmental disease .', "According to world tendency oriented towards creating a healthy city , this research will be an attempt to evaluate the prospective of the urban concept of a healthy city in subtropical climate zone based on physical , social , and psychological environment supportive to health , keeping in mind the area 's local condition ( topographic , social and culture ) .", 'The development strategy of sustainable regional level water management plan : An agenda for Bangladesh perspective ..', 'In common with current global concern over wise use and effective management of water , the Government of Bangladesh is committed to exploring , developing and using its water resource to the benefit of all user .', 'To this end the Ministry of Water Resources published the first National Water Policy in 1999 , whereas the paper focuses the Regional Water Management Plan ( RWMP ) with the intention of guiding both public and private action in the future for ensuring optimal development and management of water that benefit both individual and the society at large .', 'This Paper aims to ensure progress towards fulfilling national goal of economic development , poverty alleviation , food security , public health and safety , decent standard of living for the people and protection of the natural environment .', 'The Plan is presented in three phase : in the short-term ( 2000-05 ) it is considered a firm plan of ongoing and new activity ; in the medium-term ( 2006-10 ) it is an indicative plan , and in the long-term ( 2011-25 ) a perspective plan .', 'Implementation of the plan is to be monitored regularly and it will be updated every five year ( IWRM , 2002 ) .', 'Water is central to the way of life in Bangladesh .', 'Indeed , the river system , many of which emanate from outside the country , have shaped much of the history , economy , literature and rich culture of the people .', 'However , with a burgeoning population of 129 million expected to rise to 181 million by 2025 and to 224 million by 2050 ( IWRM , 2002 ) , the country faces many challenge ahead in an era of increasing globalization .', 'Rapid urbanization is expected with 40 % of people living in the town and major city by 2025 , and 60 % by 2050 ( WARPO , 2001 ) .', 'Poverty is still endemic with over half the population classified as poor .', 'In addressing these and other related issue , this paper sets new paradigms for the water sector , which include : decentralized water management ; cost sharing and cost recovery ; private sector participation ; community participation ; nontraditional financing modality ; regulation separated from supply ; and new right , obligation and accountability .']

['Good looking : In defense of scenic landscape aesthetic .', "Among US writer on environmental aesthetic , it has become de rigueur to leverage Aldo Leopold 's legacy against the proliferation of `` popular '' landscape taste , which are typically seen to have their origin in 17th-19th century European tradition of landscape painting and aesthetic .", "These writer regard victim of popular or `` scenic '' landscape taste ( exemplified by Olmsted 's Central Park ) as intellectually shallow , motivated by momentary `` sensory pleasure '' , and passively and anthropocentrically drawn to `` naturalistic '' environment rather than actively and biocentrically engaged with natural environment .", 'This implicit refusal to grant sensory information and affective processing the power to catalyze and inform serious reflection is not new ; neither is the attribution of popular landscape aesthetic to the elite society of a limited culture and historical period surprising , given the current preponderance of post-modernist sensibility .', 'However , in the often highly-charged atmosphere of local environmental planning and management arenas , both position are needlessly polemical .', 'More importantly , there is good evidence to suggest that both position are founded on misconception about how the human mind work .', 'In this paper , we will review work that establishes the intellectual bona fides of visual imagery , the important contribution that emotion make to cognition , and the likelihood that explanation of environmental aesthetic rooted in European enlightenment-era landscape painting are inadequate .', 'This review suggests that frequent call for new normative environmental aesthetic based on a cognitive understanding of ecological sustainability are likely premature .', 'As social scientist , we suggest that attempt to impose prescribed environmental aesthetic ( albeit ecologically pure environmental aesthetic ) are inappropriate and may well be self-defeating .', 'Instead , we suggest that a thorough understanding of visual and non-visual environmental aesthetic is needed , including examination of the possibility that affect elicited by scenic encounter with preferred landscape can lead people to form emotional attachment to the land and thereby develop a greater appreciation for sustainability goal .', 'Vision of nature and landscape type preference : An exploration in The Netherlands .', "A survey was carried out among inhabitant of Gennep , a small-town municipality in the east of The Netherlands , questioning about ( 1 ) the type of nature that people distinguish and the level of naturalness ascribed to these type of nature ; ( 2 ) the image that people hold of the appropriate relationship between people and nature and the level of adherence to these image , and ( 3 ) people 's preference of broadly defined landscape type .", 'Type of nature inferred by mean of factor analysis were labeled arcadian , wild and penetrative nature , the last category comprising element such as mosquito and rat in the barn .', 'Factor analysis was used as well to infer image of appropriate relationship , which appeared to hinge around the concept of mastery over nature , responsibility for nature and participation in nature , respectively .', "Level of adherence to the responsibility and participation image were very high , indicative of a 'new biophilia ' mainstream in Dutch culture .", "Landscape type were defined , roughly , as ( 1 ) landscape made by and for people ; ( 2 ) park-like , arcadian landscape ; ( 3 ) wild , interactive landscape and ( 4 ) landscape `` in which one may experience the greatness and force of nature '' .", "Strikingly , more than half of the respondent expressed preference for this last ( 'deep ecology ' ) landscape type , with another third preferring the wild , interactive landscape .", "The highest preference of the 'greatness and force ' landscape was found among the respondent with high ascription of naturalness to the penetrative type of nature and respondent adhering to the participation-in-nature image of relationship .", 'Preference for landscape type as defined here should be distinguished from visual or behavioral landscape preference .', "Even if people may not select landscape of the 'greatness and force of nature ' in daily behavior , these landscape of wilderness and greatness do connect with human vision and desire .", 'Ethnic minority group and the design of public open scape : An inclusive landscape ?', '.', 'People from ethnic minority group have a range of experience of living in Britain , some of which are significantly different from those of white British people .', 'Previous research and case study suggest that the physical environment has a positive or negative role in perception of everyday life .', 'It is argued that landscape have a symbolic dimension , and aspect of landscape can be recognized as familiar or alien , welcoming or excluding .', 'A wide variety of case study in Britain are used to discuss design and management practice that reflect a range of cultural experience .', 'The need for landscape architect and manager to be aware of how place may be interpreted in different way by different ethnic minority group , and to work towards inclusive design , is highlighted .', 'Influence of hot arid climate on the use of outdoor urban space and thermal comfort : Do cultural and social background matter ?', '.', 'Climate-sensitive open space within city may have a positive effect on economic , social and environmental aspect of the urban environment .', 'Improvement of microclimatic condition in urban space can enable people to spend more time outdoors , with the potential to influence the social cohesion of a space and increase economic activity .', 'The wider aim of this research is to develop a better understanding of the complex relationship between the microclimate and human behaviour in open public space in hot arid climate .', 'Case study are selected in two different part of the world ( Marrakech in North Africa and Phoenix , Arizona in the US ) to represent a variety of user in a similar climatic context .', 'This enables the author to study the effect of socio-economic and cultural diversity on thermal comfort , behaviour and use of space .', 'Field survey include structured interview with a standard questionnaire and observation of human activity , along with microclimatic monitoring , carried out during the summer and winter of 2008 and 2009 .', 'The analysis consists of : microclimatic influence on thermal sensation , preference and people attendance ; effect of psychological adaptation on the subjective thermal evaluation of outdoor space ; and investigation of socio-economic and socio-cultural impact on the behaviour of people in outdoor space .', 'From urban national park to natured city in the global south : The quest for naturbanity .', 'This important volume focuses on the sensitive issue of interrelationship between national park situated near or within urban area and their urban environment .', 'It engages with both urban and conservation issue and and compares four national park located in four large city in the global South : Rio de Janeiro , Cape Town , Mumbai , and Nairobi .', 'Though primarily undertaken as academic research , the project has intensively collaborated with the institution in charge of these park .', "The comparative structure of this volume is also original and unique : each of the chapter incorporates insight from all four site as far as possible.The term `` naturbanity '' expresses the necessity for city endowed with a national park to integrate it into their functioning .", 'Conversely , such park must take into account their location in an urban environment , both as a source of heavy pressure on nature and as a nexus of incentive to support their conservation .', "The principle of non-exclusivity , that is , neither the city nor the park has a right nor even the possibility to negate the other 's presence , summarizes the main argument of this book .", "Naturbanity thus blurs the old `` modern '' dichotomy of nature/culture : animal and human being can often jump the physical and ideological wall separating many park from the adjacent city .", 'The 13 chapter and substantive introduction of this volume discuss various aspect of naturbanity : the history of park creation ; interaction between people and park ; urban governance and park ; urban conservation model ; wildlife management ; environmental education ; and so on .', 'This is a must-read for student and researcher interested in social ecology , social geography , conservation , urban planning and ecological policy .', 'Cognitive-Cultural Looping Mechanism of Urban Space Conceptualization .', 'A crucial point for urban design is the acknowledgement that urban material structure are not only constituting a set of cognitive-cultural affordances that shapes people ’ s behavior and experiential world , but likewise that the design process itself is an expression of cultural conceptualization possibly evoked by ongoing cultural practice and perception , thus forming a dynamic loop .', 'In this paper , we outline a framework for the study of material , cultural and social mechanism interacting with human cognition , behavior and emotion .', 'We attempt a conceptual model that integrates dynamic interaction between cognitive-cultural affordances and our conceptualization of the environment and provides a few illustrative case example .', 'The model proposes a set of dynamic relation between cognitive and cultural process at shorter time scale modifying conceptualization and environmental affordances on longer timescales , while these – in turn – come to guide and constrain process at the shorter timescales .', 'The model has important implication for our understanding of the role of environmental design , especially urban design , as bridging between aspect of human situated experience , behavior , social and cultural norm and material culture .']

['Ten question on the soundscapes of the built environment .', "Soundscape research represents a paradigm shift from noise control policy towards a new multidisciplinary approach as it involves not only physical measurement but also the cooperation of humanity and social science to account for the diversity of soundscapes across country and culture , with more focus on how people actually experience the acoustic environment ; and it considers environmental sound as a 'resource ' rather than a 'waste ' .", 'The ten question presented in this paper range from the very basic definition underlying the emerging soundscape science , to more applied topic about how to use soundscape as a design approach for the planning and management of the built environment .', 'Although significant research activity has been conducted so far , there is still a need to systematically provide the underpinning science and practical guidance in soundscaping .', 'Thus , the last question aim to identify the most crucial gap in soundscape research and set the agenda for future advancement in the field .', 'Comparison of community response to road traffic noise in Japan and Sweden - Part I : Outline of survey and dose-response relationship .', 'To investigate cross-cultural difference in the community response to road traffic noise , social survey were conducted in Gothenburg , Sweden , and Kumamoto and Sapporo , Japan , using the same questionnaire and noise measurement method .', 'Typical residential area with detached house and apartment were selected as the target area in each city .', 'The questionnaire comprised 40 question relating to environmental , housing and personal factor .', 'The key question concerned annoyance caused by road traffic noise .', 'The total number of respondent were 1142 in Gothenburg , 837 in Kumamoto and 780 in Sapporo .', 'The response rate were 68.8 , 69.3 and 57.5 % respectively .', 'After the questionnaire were completed , noise measurement were made in each area .', 'Community response were compared on the basis of the dose-response relationship .', 'There were no systematic difference between community response in Sapporo and Kumamoto , which have the same culture .', 'People living in detached house in Gothenburg were more annoyed by the same road traffic noise than the people living in Japanese city .', 'There were no systematic difference among the three city with regard to activity disturbance indoors , but significant disturbance of activity and resting in garden or on balcony was noted in Gothenburg .', 'The difference in activity disturbance was due to the difference between lifestyle in the two country .', 'People living in detached house were more annoyed by the house vibration caused by road traffic than those living in apartment and people were annoyed by the exhaust from road traffic to the same extent as noise .', 'Toronto and Vancouver bound : The location choice of new Canadian immigrant .', 'Ethnic clustering plays an important role in the location choice of new immigrant to Canada .', 'A concentration of people in the same geographic area who are of similar ethnic background , culture and language can be an important source of financial and personal support , information and guidance , and social more .', 'Evidence is found that , after controlling for a range of other observable and unobservable factor important to the location decision , the concentration of people of a particular ethnic group in a particular area has a significant effect on the chance that new immigrant of the same ethnic group will choose to live there .', 'The size of the effect , however , depends on the personal characteristic of immigrant .', 'The attraction of ethnic concentration of immigrant is significantly smaller for new immigrant with a university degree and for those who normally speak English at home .', 'Characteristic of the local ethnic community related to education and language profile are also significant determinant of location choice .', 'The urban fabric of Igbo architecture in South-eastern Nigeria in the 1990s .', 'This paper seeks to explore the extent to which local building tradition have been retained within modern urban housing development in primarily Igbo-speaking area of South-eastern Nigeria in the 1990s .', 'Its premise is that there are vestige of tradition which remain part of the urban fabric in most southern Nigerian town .', 'It is thought that these tradition can , and should , be developed further to ensure that there is a positive integration of the old with the new , in the physical form , aesthetic and theoretical interpretation of urban design .', 'Also as a development model , this integration approach has considerable relevance to other aspect of Nigerian urban life where there is the need for the accommodation of various culture and social background .', 'Relevant material , including documented data , will be used to discuss the premise and theory put forward .', 'Central to the main theme is the argument for a re-ordering of architectural design and urban planning in southern Nigeria to better accommodate the more traditional or cultural feature of life as the illustration shown will highlight .', 'The paper focuses specifically on the Igbo-speaking area of South-eastern Nigeria .', 'The development of its housing fabric has varied distinctly from that of Northern and South-western Nigeria , which both have the effect of Islamic influence and , in the latter region , Brazilian and European influence , on local culture to be considered .', 'Both these region have had more urbanised and cosmopolitan cultural indigenous development pattern than the south-east .', 'The text occasionally , however , draws architectural comparison with these Nigerian region and other developing area .', "It would seem that 'Igboland ' escaped these influence mainly due to its geographical location in the hinterland of South-eastern Nigeria .", 'Islam did not penetrate as far down from North-eastern Nigeria to the south-east as it had done from North-western Nigeria to the south-west .', 'This was partly due to the more tropical humid terrain which was detrimental to horse and mounted warfare and the way in which religious war or Jihad were traditionally fought .', 'Also , the acephalous societal organisation of the Igbos , when contrasted with the more hierarchical Northern Hausa and Western Yoruba society , were less predisposed to convert voluntarily from native individualised worship to a more structured heirarchic monotheistic religion .', 'Being away from the Atlantic coast of Nigeria meant that European influence took longer to affect hinterland Igbo lifestyles .', 'It also meant that the area had few settlement of repatriated and freed African slave who had made their way back to Nigeria from America and Brazil .', 'Called Saros and Agudas respectively , these returnees brought with them new cultural style and established residential settlement which were influential in the development of coastal town such as Lagos and Calabar .', 'Similarly , missionary and government enterprise reached the Igbo hinterland much later than the coast , thus Christianity and its cultural influence was felt much later in this area .', 'The text occasionally , however , draws architectural comparison with other Nigerian region and other developing country .', 'The socio-cultural dimension of housing : Quality in Osogbo Nigeria .', 'House-form has played a significant role in the socio-cultural adaptation of most people and society in Nigeria .', 'Specifically , within the Yoruba ethnic group of south-western part of Nigeria .', 'To them , the house represents a status symbol , which every member of a particular family identifies with .', 'The pattern and form of such dwelling have played vital role in shaping and influencing the lifestyle of the people .', 'The house to them is a place for moral and social formation as well as for physical and psychology reformation .', 'Unfortunately , the effect and infusion of western cultural contact through civilization , technological advancement and the unfolding world order of globalization on majority of African society and people have created loss of originality in housing form and pattern as well as loss of cultural value of the people .', 'This paper , which emanated from a previous resear ch by the Author , intends to evaluate the significance of house- form on housing quality as well as on the lifestyle of the Nigeria people .', 'Osogbo , a traditional as well as an urbanized township was used as case study .', '( The finding of the research are representative of the Housing situation in most Nigerian society ) .', 'The study , which identified three ( 3 ) zone of re idential and urban development revealed a significant relationship between House-form and Housing quality within the residential district of Osogbo .', 'It also affirmed the predominance of the Yoruba ethnic origin over other ethnic origin in Osogbo .', 'The paper submitted that any housing planning and de velopment that ignores the relevant socio-cultural form and pattern would invariably lack originality and relevance to the target population .', 'It , therefore , recommends that Government , housing planner and developer should take house-form of the different sub-cultures into consideration before embarking on future housing development .', "'Auraldiversity ' : Defining a hearing- centred perspective to socially equitable design of the built environment .", 'Historically , sound , soundscape and human hearing have collectively received litt le att ention in the design of urban space and place , particularly with regard to the psychological and sociological impact of hearing on the experience of individual in the built environment .', "It is proposed that the sonic consideration which have been made in urban design are commonly developed within an assumption of otologically normal hearing , and , more broadly , without the acknowledgement of the actual diversity in people 's auditory and sensory ability .", "Existing consideration of sound and hearing within inclusive design research , particularly in the built environment , are grounded in an 'auraltypical ' perspective where the primary focus is hearing individual or those with hearing loss .", "This position supposes to some degree that an idealized otological profi le and consistent model of hearing profi ciency is shared amongst all citizen and engenders a culture of urban design driven by 'good/bad ' ear and homogenized sonic interaction .", "This paper introduces the theoretical paradigm of 'auraldiversity ' - an emerging agenda that acknowledges the diversity of human hearing and the multitude of element that place the hearing modality within a state of constant fl ux .", "The paper situates this theoretical perspective within the context of the built environment through the mapping of three 'auraldivergent ' hearing profi le .", 'Each profi le charts the lived sonic experience of a d/Deaf or disabled individual in the built environment .', 'The paper concludes by positioning the auraldiversity paradigm as a catalyst in the development of a hearing-centred approach to inclusive design research , a new agenda where the opportunity for more socially and sonically equitable design of the built environment is established .', 'Noise , music , and the meaning of modernity .', "Emily Thompson has shared her view on a revised version of a talk from 'The Soundscape of Modernity : Architectural Acoustic and the Culture of Listening in America ' that was presented to the Société de Physique et d́Histoire Naturelle de Genéve on 22nd October , 2004 .", 'She states that organic sound created by human and animal that have always accompanied human civilization helps to understand it .', 'But as the city noise rose with urbanization , people started escaping it .', 'Organization and commission were formed to control city noise and to provide a noise-free environment .', 'Modern architect of America constructed the Philadelphia Saving fund Society in 1932 to control sound by acoustically isolating people from the city noise .', 'The modern solution was achieved to the problem of noise by turning building into placeless artifact thereby defying their location in the world .']

["Making friend in Zurich 's urban forest and park : The role of public green space for social inclusion of youth from different culture .", 'Integrating the distinct culture of foreign resident youth is a challenge for Swiss political and educational institution .', 'An empirical survey of pupil ( n = 437 ) and teacher in selected school of the city and metropolitan area of Zurich investigated leisure activity in urban forest and public green space for their potential to facilitate social interaction between Swiss and immigrant young people .', 'Pattern of socialising and making friend in these outdoor location were found to differ depending on age , school level , gender and the percentage of immigrant in each residential area .', 'Public urban green space were found to play an important role for child and youth in making contact and friend across culture , which is considered a prerequisite for social inclusion .', 'From multiculturalism to multinaturalism : What rule of method for the new socio-scientific experiment ?', '.', 'This article reflects on the traditional distinction between scientific laboratory experimenting on theory and phenomenon and a political outside where non-experts make do with human value , opinion , and passion .', 'Since today all people are engaged in emerging collective experiment on matter as varied as climate , food , landscape , health , urban design , and technical communication as consumer , militant , and citizen , they can all be considered co-researchers .', "Co-researching has consequence for our understanding of nature and demands a renewed attention to `` multinaturalist '' politics .", 'It also question the division of labor between expert and nonexperts .', "The article finishes with a call to `` dis-invent '' modernity so that we `` modern '' can finally become ordinary human again .", 'Blue urbanism : Exploring connection between city and ocean .', 'What would it mean to live in city designed to foster feeling of connectedness to the ocean ?', 'As coastal city begin planning for climate change and rising sea level , author Timothy Beatley sees opportunity for rethinking the relationship between urban development and the ocean .', 'Modern society is more dependent upon ocean resource than people are commonly aware of , from oil and gas extraction to wind energy , to the vast amount of fish harvested globally , to medicinal compound derived from sea creature , and more .', "In Blue Urbanism , Beatley argues that , given all we 've gained from the sea , city policy , plan , and daily urban life should acknowledge and support a healthy ocean environment .", 'The book explores issue ranging from urban design and land use , to resource extraction and renewable energy , to educating urbanites about the wonder of marine life .', "Beatley looks at how emerging practice like `` community supported fishery '' and aquaponics can provide a sustainable alternative to industrial fishing practices.Other chapter delve into incentive for increasing use of wind and tidal energy as renewable option to oil and gas extraction that damage ocean life , and how the shipping industry is becoming more `` green . ''", 'Additionally , urban citizen , he explains , have many opportunity to interact meaningfully with the ocean , from beach cleanup to helping scientist gather data .', "Ultimately , he explains that we must create a culture of `` ocean literacy '' using a variety of approach , from building design and art installation that draw inspiration from marine form , to encouraging citizen volunteerism related to ocean , to city-sponsored research , and support for new law that protect marine health .", 'Equal part inspiration and practical advice for urban planner , ocean activist , and policymakers , Blue Urbanism offers a comprehensive look at the challenge and great potential for urban area to integrate ocean health into their policy and planning goal .', 'Aquatic system and water security in the Metropolitan Valley of Mexico City .', 'In megacities water quantity and quality are threatened by complex and interrelated process caused by population growth , land use change , unsustainable agricultural practice , deforestation , erosion , destruction of ecosystem , lack of planning , laissez-faire policy , unsustainable water management , political conflict , and increasingly also by the impact of climate change .', 'In the Metropolitan Valley of Mexico City ( MVMC ) located in the high plateau of Mexico City and on former lake , the dry out policy during the last 300 year have been counterproductive , causing scarcity , pollution , health and environmental problem , subsidence and water conflict , particularly affecting social vulnerable people .', 'Megacities require an integrated management of water and aquatic system .', '- integral water resource management , rainwater harvesting , maintenance and replacement of infrastructure , restoration of ecosystem and urban planning .', 'This implies investment and a water culture including a transparent administration and peaceful negotiation of conflict regarding concession , access , and reuse of water allocation .', 'Socio-political and environmental process are complex ; besides technical factor and ecosystem recovery , socio-cultural change must transform human settlement and power structure .', 'Below the double bottom line : The challenge of socially sustainable urban water strategy .', 'Recent interview-based research on how Australian urban water professional grasp the social aspect of sustainable water management suggests that interest in these dimension outstrips understanding of them , and that more culturally intelligent , socially realistic and ethically sensitive notion of people , culture and society are needed .', "Despite lip-service to `` triple bottom line '' assessment of policy and development , Australia 's policymakers have advanced no further than a `` double bottom line '' based on economic and environmental value , the latter preferably expressed in dollar term .", 'The economic ( or market relation ) also substitutes for the social dimension in a continued policy emphasis on customer rather than citizen or community member .', "An overemphasis on behavioural economics , a lack of social , political and cultural theory , and neglect of people 's actual practice means that much policy and research around water fails to grapple with such basic social element as gender , different role and access to resource within household , cultural diversity , or ethical orientation .", 'A major challenge is to mobilise rather than ignore the altruistic and socially-oriented human capacity for adapting to change beyond the customer relation or the confines of technical and economic rationality ; including by collective innovation in value and practice of caring for water .', 'Comment on “ Using functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging ( fMRI ) to analyze brain region activity when viewing landscape ” .', 'Modern neuroscience method , such as functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging ( fMRI ) , offer the unparalleled opportunity to monitor the human brain in vivo − a revolution that has had a tremendous impact on many discipline ( economics , culture , health ) .', 'Thus , the paper by Tang et al .', '( 2017 ) is an exciting epistemological step introducing this technology and the possibility for those studying the health effect of landscape .', 'Yet , as in similar interdisciplinary effort there are always risk : question are very general or result are misinterpreted .', "The present commentary aim , using example and a simple but rigorous language , to help the audience of Landscape and Urban Planning understand the basic principle of fMRI and neuroscience method We end up with a call to landscape researcher and others studying how environment can affect people 's mental health and well-being to boldly be involved in this exciting interdisciplinary effort to help neuroscientist understand how the brain work ."]
